Description: The name means Bulgarian red cattle
Description of origin: Developed by complex reproductive crossing. Initially, the Red Sadovo Cattle breed was developed, which was then used along with Danish red and Angler bulls in the development of the Bulgarian Red Cattle, a breed intended for the South and Northeastern Bulgaria. The Red Danish cattle was mainly used for improvement of the new breed

Description: The name means Bulgarian Brown Cattle
Other name: Bulgarian Brown Cattle, Българско кафяво говедо
Description of origin: Developed by reproductive and backcrossing of the local gray cattle with brown swiss bulls.

Description: named after Rhodope mountain
Other name: Българско родопско говедо, Bulgarian Rhodope Cattle
Description Of Specific Uses: The Bulgarian Rhodope Cattle is the breed of the highest relative milk yield, the highest milk concentration, the highest fertility and the most continuous use in the country. It has an excellent adaptive capacity and extremely high ecological plasticity.
Efabis main colour: Non-typized, basically light redbrown (deer-like) and gray. Individuals of white spots on various parts of the body and even red-pied animals are often found.
Description of origin: Initially, by reproductive crossing between the Rhodope shorthorn cattle with the local Gray cattle, Sofia Brown cattle, Oberinntal cattle, etc., and, later on, with Jersey as the most often used breed in the improvement programmes
Location within country: The Rhodopes. Isolated herds throughout the country.

Description of origin: The breed was developed by continuous (40-50 years) random crossing of the local gray cattle from Northwest Bulgaria with Simmental bulls of Swiss and Yugoslavian origin. Thus, the Kulsko Cattle was developed. At a later stage the Bulgarian Simmental Cattle breed was developed by reproductive crossing of the Kulsko and Gray Iskar Cattle breeds, and systematic and purposeful breeding improvement work.
Location within country: Northwest, North central Bulgaria and some regions in South Bulgaria

Description: Balgarsko sivo govedo means Bulgarian Gray Cattle
Other name: Bulgarian Gray Cattle, Gray cattle, Българско сиво говедо
Adaptability to specific environment: The millennia-long breeding of those animals under the same conditions explains their incredible resistance to the unfavorable environmental factors.
Other special qualities: The Bulgarian Gray Cattle individuals are low-productive, late-maturing animals of limited possibilities of growth.
Efabis main colour: Gray, with shades of dark to light gray, rarely yellowish; in the bulls the forepart of the body is coloured darker, reaching to
Description of origin: Folk breeding
Location within country: In the mountains Strandzha, Sakar, the Central Balkan, Sashtinska Sredna Gora, Rila, the Rhodopes and in the regions of Shumen and Varna.

Description: The largest size breed for milk production, with a fine and compact construction. The head is elongated, dry and gentle. The muzzle is broad with widely open nostrils. The horns are medium long. The body shapes are elongated, angular, with under-developed muscles. The neck is medium long to long, shallow and thin, with numerous clearly outlined skin folders. The back is straight, long and medium broad. The croup is well-developed, medium long to long, broad and straight. The ribs are slantwise positioned towards the dorsal line, with wellexpressed and wide intercostal zones. The limbs are thin and dry. The hooves have a regular shape and size. The dairy features are expressed very well. The udder is voluminous, trough- or goblet-shaped, widely attached high at the rear part. The teats are of optimal length, usually cylindrical in shape. Normally their tips are dark coloured. The tail is medium long to long, ending in a welloutlined white tuft. The animals demonstrate very good adaptive and acclimatization capacities, but they have high food requirements.
Description Of Specific Uses: Breed specialized for milk production.
Efabis main colour: Black-and-white or red-and-white (rr). The black and the red are not dominant body colours. Variants with prevailing pigmented or white coloration are also to be found.
Description of origin: Assimilative crossing of cows of the breeds Bulgarian Brown Cattle, Bulgarian Red Cattle and Simmental with European Holstein Frisien (until 1970) and American Holstein Frisien bulls (after 1970), as well as by extended reproduction of introduced pure-blood Black and White cows from different European countries.
Location within country: All over the country, except the Rhodope region.

Description: The animals are large, having typical exterior traits and construction of the combined dairy and beef breeds. The head is medium. The body structure is proportional. The limbs are normally attached with tough bones, good musculature and a firm hoof horn. The udder is well developed, usually gobletshaped. The hair coat is short. The calves are gray-white at birth. At the age of 2-3-months they become gray-black and latter on they become graybrown. The female animals have an excellent shape of the udder and teats for machine milking. The fat and protein contents are extremely favorable. The male calves are very good for fattening; they have good daily gain and high slaughter output. The breed adapts quickly to various breeding systems and climatic conditions. The animals demonstrate long lifespan and continuous productivity that are very important traits in the evaluation of the breed efficiency.
Description Of Specific Uses: The milk is of high quality, with the highest content of kappa casein В, which makes it very suitable for cheese-production.  The meat is tender, pink-red, marbled, of good taste qualities.
Description of origin: Reproductive and assimilation crossing of local gray cows with bulls of Brown Alpine cattle breed imported from Switzerland, Germany and Austria. Later on, bulls of Brown American cattle breed were used in the breed formation.
Location within country: Throughout the country, mainly in Sevlievo, Veliko Tarnovo and Yambol regions

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed has good adaptability, calm temperament and it is suitable to be bred under the conditions of different breeding technologies.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The ease of calving is 92%.
Horn shape size and comments: Wax-yellow
Description of origin: imported; In the valley of the Arconce river, region of Charolais-Brion, from local large cattle, used as draught animals. Later on, it was crossbred with Shorthorns with the aim of using the new breed for meat production. The breed prefers a mild climate and good pastures.

Location within country: Sliven, Burgas, Vidin, Smolian and Blagoevgrad regions.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is unpretentious and easily adaptable.
Special characteristic of product: High-quality meat is produced when pasture-bred.
Efabis main colour: Dark red; the head, the lower part of the neck, the forechest, the abdomen, the legs and the tail tuft are white.
Horn shape size and comments: Short, thick and curved down on both sides of the head or hornless
Description of origin: imported; In Herefordshire, by crossbreeding of a local small red cattle with a large Welsh cattle in a hilly region of rich grasslands

Location within country: Regions of Plovdiv, Haskovo, Burgas, Smoljan, and Stara Zagora

Special characteristic of product: The meat is juicy, poor in fat, with thin layers of fat and optimal ratio between red meat ant fat.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are fine, slightly curved forward.
Description of origin: imported; Purposeful breeding of the local Aquitaine cattle in the unproductive poor pastures on the broken terrains in the region of the western woodland areas of Central France, characterized by great temperature fluctuations.
Location within country: Single herds are kept in Bulgaria in the lowland parts of the country

Specific resistance or tolerance: The breed is highly resistant to mastitis. It displays an excellent meat performance.
Special characteristic of product: The milk has an optimal fat to protein ratio for cheese production.
Other special qualities: The good adaptability is an advantage of the breed. It is an alternative of the specialized dairy breeds.
Efabis main colour: Red-and-white, the white colour covering the lower part of the body and the periphery (head, legs and tail). The red colour dominates on the upper part of the body. It is intensive, even closer to dark-red. The white head and the red spots around the eyes and jaws are generally tolerated.
Description of origin: imported;

Description: Rodopsko kasorogo govedo means Rhodope Shorthorn Cattle
Other name: Rhodope Shorthorn Cattle, Родопско късорого говедо
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Very well adapted to the steep slopes of the mountains.
Efabis main colour: Non-typized – brown-black, brown, black, gray, yellow
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are thin, fragile, of small circumference at the base and even thickness along the length.
Description of origin: Folk breeding of the primitive brachyceros cattle, under highland conditions, poor pastures, changeable climatic conditions and broken terrains
Location within country: Eastern Rhodopes, mainly in the municipalities of Krumovgrad, Momchilgrad, Zlatograd and Madzharovo

Adaptability to specific environment: It adapts very well under various environmental, climatic and breeding conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: highly resistant to diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: excellently developed mother instinct
Special characteristic of product: soft meat
Other special qualities: The breed is characterized by the rapid growth, high milk performance and calm temperament.
Efabis main colour: The colour varies from golden-yellow to red, with white spots on different parts of the body. The head is white. Often white stripes pass along the forequarter
Description of origin: imported; Simmental cattle are a Swiss breed, which originated under the conditions of the lush Alpine pastures. The extinct Kula Cattle was the first simmentalized breed in our country. It was developed in North-Western Bulgaria by random crossing of the local gray cattle with Simmental bulls, mainly of Serbian and Swiss origin. At a later stage, the Bulgarian Simmental Cattle breed was created by reproductive and assimilative crossing.
Location within country: North-Western and North Central Bulgaria, in some regions of South Bulgaria.

Description: Cherna shumenska kokoshka means Black Shumen Chicken
Other name: Black Shumen Chicken, Черна шуменска кокошка
Description Of Specific Uses: Genetic resource and in hybridization schemes for general purpose use
Description of origin: Local Black chicken improved by crossing with cocks of Black Minorca breed

Description Of Specific Uses: For the production of chickens for general purpose use in small private farms
Description of origin: A synthettic line originating from aboriginal breeds

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother form for bilinear autosexing hybrids for egg production
Description of origin: Crossings based on the White Rhode Island breed

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother form for the production of broilers and hybrids for general purpose use
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding of imported fowl of PlymouthRock breed

Description Of Specific Uses: In the egg-production trend – as a father form in the production of autosexing hybrid combination for brown shell eggs
Additional information: In the egg-production trend – as a father form in the production of autosexing hybrid combination for brown shell eggs.
Description of origin: Crossings based on the Red Rhode Island breed

Description Of Specific Uses: For the production of bilinear hybrids for eggs in ecological farms
Description of origin: A synthettic line established by crossing Line Г and Line G

Description Of Specific Uses: For the production of bilinear hybrids for eggs in ecological farms
Description of origin: A synthetic line previously named LINE XL

Description Of Specific Uses: Father form for bilinear hybrids for general purpose use
Additional information: The plumage is chestnut with black feathers on the tail and it belongs to the Columbian plumage.
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding based on New Hampshire breed

Description Of Specific Uses: In hybridization schemes for general purpose use hybrids
Description of origin: Crossing based on Red Rhode Island breed

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother form in hybridization schemes for broiler production
Description of origin: A synthetic line originating from White Plymouth Rock breed

Description Of Specific Uses: Father form for the production of hybrids for brown shell eggs
Additional information: Father form for the production of hybrids for brown shell eggs
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding of Red Rhode Island breed

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother form for the production of hybrids for brown shell eggs
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding based on White Rhode Island breed

Description Of Specific Uses: For the production of hybrids for general purpose use
Description of origin: Established in England by crossing local hens with cocks of Cornish, Cochinchina, Orpington and Brahma breeds

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother form in hybridization schemes for the production of broilers
Description of origin: A synthetic line with the participation of White Plymouth Rock breed

Description: Starozagorska chervena kokoshka means Red chicken from the region of Stara Zagora
Other name: Stara Zagora red chicken, Line StR Stara Zagora red chicken, Старозагорска червена кокошка
Description Of Specific Uses: Genetic resource and in hybridization schemes for general purpose use
Description of origin: Complex reproductive crossing of local hens with cocks of Red Rhode Island breed

Other name: Bulgarian houd (Barak), Bulgarian coarse-haired hound - Barak, Barak
Description Of Specific Uses: For hunting of small and large ground game
Efabis main colour: Yellow-rusty ochre with a dark cover. There are also dogs of entirely dark coloration. White spots on the muzzle, the chest, the neck, the lower part of the legs, the tows and the tip of the tail are acceptable.
Efabis skin colour: Bluish-gray and in winter yellowgray even in individuals of lighter coloration
Description of origin: indigenous breed;

Description: Named after the Ludogorie region in northeastern Bulgaria
Other name: Bulgarian Ludogorian hound, Българско лудогорско гонче
Description Of Specific Uses: Specialized for hunting of large ground game, mainly wild boar, but it could also be used for hunting other game as hares and predators.
Efabis main colour: Anthracite-black with brown under-coat. White spots on the breasts, restricted or diffused, are accepted. Small white spots on the toes are also accepted but undesirable.
Description of origin: indigenous breed;

Description: Balgarsko ovcharsko kuche means Bulgarian Shepherd dog
Other name: Bulgarian Shepherd dog, Българско овчарско куче
Description Of Specific Uses: Shepherds’ guard dog
Efabis main colour: milti coloured with clearly outlined spots of black, brown, gray, yellow, red, etc. on a white or a black ground.
Description of origin: indigenous breed;

Description: named after the Karakachans - nomadic shepherds
Other name: Karakachan dog, Shepherd dog, Pasture dog, Wolfhound
Description Of Specific Uses: For guarding the herds and property, watchdog.
Efabis main colour: multi coloured, spotted – mainly white colour with large asymmetrical black or brown spots, as well as dark-coloured with large white spots
Description of origin: indigenous breed;

Description: Balgarska byala mlechna koza means Bulgarian White Dairy Goat
Other name: Bulgarian White Dairy Goat, Българска бяла млечна коза
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: body - White; face - White; legs - White
Horn shape size and comments: Individuals of both sexes may be horned or hornless.
Description of origin: It was created by crossing local goats with Saan and saanized he-goats from Switzerland, former Czechoslovakia and Germany

Description: Balgarska vitoroga dalgokosmesta koza means Bulgarian screw-horn longhair goat
Other name: Local screw-horn longhair, Bulgarian screw-horn, Local longhair(screw-horn) goat, Българска виторога дългокосместа коза
Description Of Specific Uses: The skins are used for making of mummers’ costumes.
Adaptability to specific environment: Perfectly adapted to all-year browsing on rough terrains. The breed is resistant to unfavourable climatic conditions, and modest feeding requirements.
Special characteristic of product: The milk is with very good coagulation properties allowing for the production of traditional dairy products. The skins are used for making of mummers’ costumes.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Perfectly adapted to all-year browsing on rough terrains.
Efabis main colour: Extremely rich in shades and nuances. Completely pigmented animals, as long as animals with white depigmented spots. The agouti colour types prevail. The gray colour in various shades – grayish brown, steel gray and light gray. Typical are also red, brown and yellow colours, rarely black and white. The combinations of the above colours result in unicoloured and variegated (bicoloured and tricoloured) animals
Horn shape size and comments: The animals of both sexes are usually horned. The horns have typical, spiral shape with pronounced fore-edge. Horns of the „aegagrus” type are observed in some of the females. Occasionally, some of the animals are polled.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Raised in farms in the Southwest Bulgaria (in the foothills of Pirin and Rhodopes), in the western and central Balkan mountain.

Horn shape size and comments: curved along the axis

Description: The name means long - haired goat from the region of Kalofer
Description Of Specific Uses: Skins are used for making the traditional mummers’ costumes.
Efabis main colour: Uni- or bi-coloured, variegated. The pigmented parts are black or black-gray. Individuals of brown pigmentation are very rare.
Horn shape size and comments: The animals of both sexes are usually horned. The horns of the females are sabre-shaped, curved backwards. They have a slightly visible fore-edge. The horns of the males are big, curved backward and aside in open spirals.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Kalofer region and the settlements in Karlovo region are the initial place of origin and distribution of the breed. In the last decade the basic part of the population is bred in South-Western Bulgaria.

Description: Mestna dalgokosmesta koza (Malashevski tip) means Local long-haired goat of Malashev type
Other name: Местна дългокосместа коза (Малашевски тип), Local longhair goat (Malashev type)
Efabis main colour: The colour is brown, gray, or in various shades and combinations of the both colours, usually dark
Horn shape size and comments: The males have larger horns, curved backward and aside. Some of the animals are polled.
Description of origin: indigenous breed

Description Of Specific Uses: For farm work. The main draft breed in the country.
Efabis main colour: Black and dark bay, rarely bay.
Description of origin: Origin - Bulgaria; light draft breed. Developed by composite of local mares and mares of Nonius breed with Nonius stallions.

Description Of Specific Uses: The main breed for ridding and classical equestrian disciplines (dressage, showjumping and specially – eventing) in our country; amateur riding;
Color comments: rarely skewbald
Description of origin: Half-bred, riding breed. Composite of local, Arabian, Anglo-Arabian and half-bred mares with half-bred and thoroughbred stallions.
continually imported
locally adapted
Location within country: The highland areas of Pirin, Rila, the Rhodopes and the Balkan Mountains; in South Bulgaria between Stara Zagora and Burgas; much less in North Bulgaria.

Color comments: less often – chestnut and black.
Efabis main colour: uni coloured: bay, dark bay, gray
Description of origin: Origin - Bulgaria; local primitive breed. Indigenous breed. Developed by traditional breeding. Created under specific conditions – highland pasture breeding in summer and breeding in the Aegean Sea Region and in the southern slopes of the Rhodopes, Strandzha and Pirin mountains in winter, with long seasonal marches when moving the herds.
Location within country: The Balkan and the Rhodope mountains and the mountains in the Southwest Bulgaria.

Description of origin: Origin - Bulgaria; half-bred, riding breed. Developed by composite of Deliorman, improved local, half-bred and Anglo-Arabian mares with Arabian, Anglo-Arabian, half-bred and Streletsky stallions, but mainly with stallions of Gidran breed.

Description Of Specific Uses: Endurance riding.
Efabis main colour: Gray, bay, chestnut and sometimes black.
Description of origin: imported in 1977 from Russia and Poland;

Description Of Specific Uses: For equestrian sport, riding and driving in harness
Efabis main colour: Gray, bay, chestnut and sometimes black.
Description of origin: locally adapted; composite of Hungarian mares with Purebred Arabian stallions.
Import: since 1894 from Turkey, Poland and Hungary.

Efabis main colour: Black, bay, chestnut, gray, skewbald and piebald.

Description Of Specific Uses: For racing, other equestrian disciplines and as an improving breed. It is the main breed for racing.
Efabis main colour: Bay, chestnut, gray and black with different shades.
Description of origin: England, Continually imported.

Efabis main colour: Bay, black, chestnut, gray and Tobiano Pinto
Description of origin: continually imported; composite of Thoroughbred, Mecklenburger, Barb, Neapolitan and local East Prussian horses
import from Denmark
Comments managment conditions: Performance data was collected from animals kept under stationary conditions /controlled microclimate/ and fed on concentrates without restriction of feeding and watering;under diseases control measures

Description of origin: Imported breeds
Import: year 2000 ,from Denmark , 29 male and 395 female animals,Danish Landrace
Location within country: North-East and East part of Bulgaria
Comments managment conditions: Performance data was collected from animals kept under stationary conditions /controlled microclimate/ and fed on concentrates without restriction of feeding and watering;under diseases control measures

Description of origin: import from Denmark
Comments managment conditions: Performance data was collected from animals kept under stationary conditions /controlled microclimate/ and fed on concentrates without restriction of feeding and watering;under diseases control measures

Description Of Specific Uses: For meat, as a mother breed in cross breeding schemes
Additional information: Endangered-maintained
Efabis skin colour: White, black spots are accepted; covered with white bristle.
Description of origin: Complex reproductive crossbreeding based on the breeds Bulgarian White, Large White, Landrace, Pietrain and Hampshire

Description: The name comes from the location of the breed - the East Balkans.
Other name: Източнобалканска свиня, Смядовска свиня, Камчийска свиня, Тичанска свиня
Description Of Specific Uses: For meat and lard, under natural pasture conditions For traditional bulgarian sausage called Smyadovska lukanka
Additional information: There is a risk for this population due to contacts with some wild populations and the possibilities for contamination with contagious diseases (brucellosis and plague).FAO Breed Survey (1995)
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to the local living conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The breed has a strong constitution, late maturity and low prolificacy (6 piglets).
Special characteristic of product: This breed is known for its excellent meat quality and thick fat. traditional bulgarian sausage called Smyadovska lukanka
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: The breed is well adapted to the local living conditions.
Description of origin: Predominantly by natural selection with slight human interference.
Comments managment conditions: The animals are reared in conformity with the natural environment and the products are ecological.

Additional information: This breed is in danger of extinction.
Description of origin: imported from England
Location within country: mainly regions of Ruse and Razgrad

Description of origin: imported from England
Location within country: mainly regions of Ruse and Razgrad

Description Of Specific Uses: For meat
Additional information: This breed has a reduced genetic diversity and is in danger of extinction.
Description of origin: Crossbreeding of German Noble and Large White pigs of English and Swedish origin.

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat and furs
Efabis skin colour: White, muzzle - black, dark brown, legs - black, dark brown, tail - black, dark brown
Description of origin: Complex reproductive crossing of Chinchilla x White New-Zealand Rabbit x Himalayan Rabbit

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat and furs
Efabis skin colour: Gray-blue, muzzle Gray-blue, legs Gray-blue, tail Gray-blue
Description of origin: Complex reproductive crossing of the breeds Vienna Blue rabbit, Gornostaya Rabbit, French Silver Rabbit, Flemish Giant Rabbit, etc.
Year of origin: 1913 – France; Enlarged Soviet Chinchilla breed – Russia – 1963

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat and furs
Efabis skin colour: muzzle Dark, legs Dark to white at the inner side, tail Dark to light at the lower part of the tail
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding of rabbits of the Flemish breed and local white rabbits
Import: In Bulgaria through importation since the end of 19th and the beginning of 20th centuries

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat and furs
Efabis main colour: Hairs are white at the base and red-haired and reddish at the tip
Efabis skin colour: muzzle-dark brown, legs reddish to snow-white at the inner side, tail-light
Description of origin: Purposeful breeding

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat and furs
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Description of origin: Germany and Belgium, 19th century
Selection of albino of the Red New-Zealand breed, cross-bred with Flemish rabbit

Additional information comments: The breed is split into three major types.
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White
Description of origin: Crossing of Merino and American Rambouillet breeds

Description: Named after the town of Breznik.
Efabis main colour: fleece - White;face - White with black spots around the eyes and the muzzle;legs White or black
Horn shape size and comments: Male animals are usually hornless.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Western Bulgaria, in Pernik, Radomir, Breznik and Kyustendil municipalities

Description: Named after the Maritsa river
Other name: White Maritza sheep, Бяла маришка овца
Efabis main colour: fleece - The typical colour is white, but also pigmented sheep are found (between 4 and 10 % of the animals). There are also mottled sheep (1-3 %);face - white;legs - white
Horn shape size and comments: The ewes are hornless, while both horned and hornless rams are found. However, the horns are poorly developed.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: To the north and west of Plovdiv city and in the regions of Pazardzhik, Plovdiv and Haskovo.

Color comments: uni colour: white
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White.
Description of origin: Reproductive crossing of the New-Caucasian Merino breed with rams of Askanian and American Rambouillet sheep breeds. Initially, the breed was named Caucasian Rambouillet, but later it was changed to Caucasian.

Description: Chernoglava plevenska ovtsa means blackhead sheep from the Pleven region
Other name: Pleven Blackhead sheep, Черноглава плевенска овца
Other special qualities: The animals are well adapted to local living conditions.
Efabis main colour: fleece - In most of the animals wool is white. Individuals with colored wool also occur (4-5 %);face - Black, but also animals with a white spot on the forehead, on the back of the head and between the ears occur; legs - Black, but some individuals have white rings or white spots on the legs.
Horn shape size and comments: The rams have well-developed horns. Some males are hornless. The ewes are hornless or they have underdeveloped horns.
Description of origin: Transitional form of a crossing between Tsigai and Tsakel breeds.
Location within country: Spread in all the plain areas and at the foothills of the mountains throughout the country. Most of the flocks are concentrated in the central and western parts of the Danubian plain.

Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White with black and gray spots; legs - White with specific black spots in the area of the carpal and hock joints and black hooves.
Horn shape size and comments: The rams have spiral horns, while the ewes are hornless.
Import: Small groups of male and female animals were imported in Bulgaria in 1979-1980. Because of the increasing interest, 90 more animals werе imported again in 2000 in the village of Breze, Smolyan region.

Description: Named after Duben village.
Efabis main colour: fleece - Most of the sheep are white in colour (64.3%), but red and ligth-beige are also found;face - White, black, light-beige;legs - White and dark
Horn shape size and comments: Males are mainly hornless. The horned individuals have short horns. All females are hornless.
Description of origin: Autochthonous

Description: Named after Karakachan nomadic shepherds
Other special qualities: The animals are energetic and agile and show good endurance. They can endure long-distance marches.
Efabis main colour: White, black, gray, fawn, brown, red . Evenly dark-coloured in pigmented sheep. Evenly dark-coloured in pigmented sheep.
Horn shape size and comments: The sheep are hornless, but the rams are horned. Single female individuals may also be horned.
Description of origin: Traditional selection

Description: Named after the town of Karnobat
Other name: Karnobat Fine-Wool (Merino) Sheep, Карнобатска тънкорунна порода
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Horn shape size and comments: The ewes are hornless but most of the rams have well-developed horns.
Description of origin: Crossing of the local sheep bred in the region of Karnobat, with rams of the breeds Merinoflaish, Stavropol, Caucasian, and, less – with Askanian sheep breed. Later on, it was crossed with Australian Merino sheep.
Location within country: South-Eastern Bulgaria in the plain part of Burgas and Yambol regions.

Description: Named after the town of Koprivshtitsa
Color comments: uni colour: white or dark-brown
Efabis main colour: fleece White, up to 40% dark-brown; face White or dark-brown, but animals with white or with spotted faces are also found; legs White or dark-brown
Horn shape size and comments: Commonly the male and female animals are hornless. Individuals of poorly developed horns are rarely found
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: These sheep are bred in the highland areas of Sredna Gora and at the foothill of the Balkan range, chiefly in the municipalities of Koprivshtitsa, Panagyurishte and Pirdop.

Description: Named after the town of Kotel
Efabis main colour: The fleece in most of the sheep is semi-open and pigmented from grey-brown to black.
Description of origin: Autochthonous

Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is well adapted to local living conditions.
Other special qualities: This breed was used as female line when the Thrace Finewool breed was established.
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White.
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless
Description of origin: imported
Import: In 2008 some animals were imported by Dr. Yanko Mitev, Yambol Region.
Location within country: The breed is spread mainly in Southern France, in the Pyrenees, in the territories of the departments of Aveyron, Tarn and Lozère. The sheep are well-adapted to mountainous regions and the regions of dry climate at an altitude of 300 to 1000 m a. s. l.

Description: Mednochervena shumenska ovtsa means Copper-red sheep from the Shumen region
Other name: Медночервена шуменска овца, Copper-red shumen sheep
Other special qualities: The animals are well adapted to local living conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: fawn, copper red, black
Efabis main colour: - fleece: Red-brown, copper, fawn, black; - face: Black; - legs: Black
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes are hornless, but rams have well-developed horns.
Description of origin: Autochthonous

Description: Mestna karnobatska ovtsa means local sheep from the region of Karnobat.
Other name: Local Karnobat sheep, Местна карнобатска овца
Efabis main colour: fleece - Commonly pigmentated from ligth-beige to dark - brown;face - Brown; legs - Brown.
Horn shape size and comments: Females are usually hornless, but some females have small underdeveloped horns. The rams have well developed horns.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: South-Eastern Bulgaria in the plain regions of Burgas and Yambol regions.

Adaptability to specific environment: These animals are well adapted to mountainous and semi- mountainous areas.
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White.
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless
Description of origin: imported

Description: Named after the village Replyana
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White, color spots chiefly around the eyes;legs - White, pigmented spots.
Horn shape size and comments: The females are predominantly hornless, but also there are individuals with rudiments of horns.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: North-Western Bulgaria – in the vicinities of the towns of Belogradchik and Montana – in Sveti-Nikolska (St. Nicholas) and Chiprovska mountains.

Description: Rodopski tsigay means tsigai from Rhodope mountains
Horn shape size and comments: Male animals have well-developed snail- shaped horns. The females are predominantly hornless, rarely, there are some ewes with small horns.
Description of origin: Assimilative and reproductive crossing of local breeds with purebred Tsigai rams in the mountainous parts of Rila, Pirin, Rhodopes, Strandzha, Sakar and Sredna Gora. In the initial stage of the breed development some farma have used also rams of Merinofleischschaf and Caucasian fine-wool breeds.
Location within country: At the foothills and in the mountainous parts of Rila, Pirin, Rhodopes, Sredna Gora, Strandzha, Sakar, Belasitsa, Ograzhden and Osogovo mountains.

Description Of Specific Uses: The best material for fur coats.

Description: Named after Sakar Mountain
Efabis main colour: fleece- Predominantly white, but pigmented sheep are also found; face - White; legs - White.
Horn shape size and comments: Well-developed in rams. The ewes are hornless.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: On the territory of Sakar Mountain between the rivers Tundzha and Arda, where the soils are infertile, and the precipitations are limited and unevenly distributed. The dry period in this part of the country is rather long and the pasture is scanty.

Other name: North-East Bulgarian Merino Sheep, Североизточнобългарска тънкорунна порода
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White
Horn shape size and comments: males are horned, but females are hornless
Description of origin: Complex reproductive crossing of local sheep first with Merinoflaish, and, later with Askanian and Caucasian sheep. Two breed types – Dobrudzha and Shumen types are generally recognized.
Location within country: It is spread in Dobrich, Silistra, Ruse, Razgrad regions, as well as in the plain areas of Shumen, Targovishte and Varna regions

Description: Sintetichna populatsia balgarska mlechna means Bulgarian Dairy Synthetic Population
Other name: Bulgarian Dairy Synthetic Population Sheep, Синтетич на популация Българска млеч на
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White, but also pigmented or with pigmented spots; legs - White or with pigmented spots.
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless, but some individuals are horned.
Description of origin: It was established by crossing ewes of fine-wool, semi-finewool and local dairy breeds with rams of the following dairy breeds: Pleven Blackhead sheep, East-Friesian sheep, Awassi sheep and Local Stara Zagora sheep. Partial crossing with sheep of the Chios breed and Lacaune breed has been applied in the last years. Mainly internal breeding is carried out in the pure-breed flocks.
Location within country: The breed is spread in the plain regions and at the foothills of the mountains throughout the country

Description: Named after the city of Sofia
Other name: Sofia sheep, Elin-Pelin Sheep, Елинпелинска овца
Efabis main colour: fleece - White;face - White. Sometimes pigmented spots around the eyes, the muzzle, on the ears and legs. A breed specific white triangle on the muzzle;legs White with coloured spots
Horn shape size and comments: The rams and ewes are hornless,but some individuals may be horned.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: In Sofia plain, in the regions of Elin Pelin, Novi Han, Ravno Pole, Ivanyane, Vrazhdebna, etc.

Description: Named after Rodhope mountain.
Adaptability to specific environment: The sheep are not affected by hoof diseases and damages of the limbs despite the mountainous route on steep and rocky terrains in the Rhodopes.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: The sheep are not affected by hoof diseases and damages of the limbs despite the mountainous route on steep and rocky terrains in the Rhodopes.
Efabis main colour: fleece White and black (55 – 60% of the sheep are pigmented); face White and black; legs White and black
Horn shape size and comments: Male animals have strongly developed firm horns.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: High-mountainous parts of the Central Rhodope massif.

Description: Named after Stara Planina mountain
Other name: Central stara planina sheep, Средностаропланинска овца
Efabis main colour: fleece White or pigmented with shades of gray, fawn, red; face Pigmented; legs Pigmented
Horn shape size and comments: Male animals have well-developed snail-curved horns, while the females are hornless, but also horned females are found with short and under-developed horns.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Central Balkan mountains range, in some settlements of Sevlievo, Apriltsi and Troyan municipalities.

Description: Staroplaninski tsigay means tsigai from Stara Planina mountain
Color comments: uni colour: whiteö
Efabis main colour: fleece - White, with characteristic shine; face - White.
Horn shape size and comments: Males have well-developed snail-curved horns. The females are predominantly hornless, but there are some individuals with short rudimentary horns.
Description of origin: Developed by assimilative crossing of local ewes with Tsigai rams /predominantly of Priazov type/ in the mountainous regions of the Balkan and the high hilly and mountainous areas of Northern Bulgaria.
Location within country: The mountainous regions of the Balkan and the high hilly and mountainous areas of Northern Bulgaria.

Description: Named after the town of Stara Zagora
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Stara Zagora Region, Eastern part of the Thracian lowland – Sliven, Haskovo and Yambol regions

Description: Named after the Strandzha mountain
Named after the town of Svishtov
Horn shape size and comments: The male animals are horned, while the females are hornless, but ones with poorly developed horns may also be found.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: North Bulgaria - along the rivers Roussenski Lom, Yantra, Rositza and Osam

Description: Named after the town of Teteven
Horn shape size and comments: The ewes are usually hornless, while rams are horned.
Location within country: Central Balkan mountains in the region of Teteven town,Ribaritsa village, in the valley of the Cherni Vit river, in Golyam Izvor and Galata villages.

Description: Named after the region of Trakia
Other name: Тракийска тънкорунна порода, Thracian Fine-Wool (Merino) Sheep
Adaptability to specific environment: These animals are well adapted to the local conditions (mountains up to 1 200 m asl.).
Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face - White; legs - White.
Horn shape size and comments: Well-developed in the males. The females are hornless.
Description of origin: Plovdiv and Stara Zagora type. Complex reproductive crossing of the local sheep raised in those regions with rams of the Merinoflaish and Caucasian breeds.
Location within country: In the plain areas of Plovdiv, Haskovo, Stara Zagora, Sliven and Yambol regions.

Description: Vakla means patch-faced, splotch-faced.
Other name: Patch - faced maritza sheep, Вакла маришка овца
Efabis main colour: fleece - Fleece is usually white. Some body parts (the tail base, forebreast, and belly) may have pigmented spots with pigmented wool. Thus, the animals with bigger spots on the skin seem mottled;face - White, velvet-black pigmentation arount the ears, the eyes and the muzzle, which gave the name “patch- faced”; legs - White, with velvet-black spots of various size.
Horn shape size and comments: The ewes are hornless, while the rams are both hornless and horned. Horns are an undesirable trait among the breeders of Patch-faced Maritza Sheep
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: To the north and west of Plovdiv city and in the areas of Pazardzhik, Plovdiv and Haskovo

Description: Zapadnostaroplaninska means Western Stara Planina mountain
Other name: West balkan mountains sheep, Западностаропланинска овца
Efabis main colour: fleece - The predominant part of the animals have white wool (up to 90%) and the rest – colored;face - White or pigmented;legs - White or on large pigmentated spots.
Horn shape size and comments: The male animals are usually hornless. Horned individuals are also found, but the horns are not massive.
Description of origin: Autochthonous
Location within country: Sofia, Vratsa and Pernik regions and, Slivnitsa, Dragoman, Godech, Svoge, Botevgrad, Berkovitsa and Tran municipalities

Color comments: uni colour: white;
Efabis main colour: fleece - White; face White; legs - White
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless
Description of origin: imported

Description Of Specific Uses: Mother line for the production of broilers
Description of origin: Crossing with the participation of turkeys of BIG-5 line

Description Of Specific Uses: As a father line for the production of broilers.

Description Of Specific Uses: For the production of blackfeathered broilers
Description of origin: Russia, Stavropol Region, by crossing
Import: In Bulgaria from ex USSR since in 1956s

Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for prolificacy.
Color comments: multi coloured: usually white with coloured spots
Description of origin: part of American Hair Sheep group with European influence

Additional information: 2003: The local Busha breed has been almost extinct. During the war, a nucleus herd of the purebred Busha, established by the UPI combine near Sarajevo, has been destroyed together with the entire documentation.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to karst regions and hilly regions.
Other special qualities: These are hardy animals.
Color comments: uni coloured: blue, brown
Horn shape size and comments: fine horns curved upwards and forward
Description of origin: indigenous breed. Belongs to the family of the European short horn cattle (Bos brachyceros europeus, Ruetimeyer). Today's Busa was probably created by crossbreeding the indigenous breed brachiceros cattle and shorthorn cattle brought by migrating peoples from the Northeast (Alpine brown, Tyrolean grey and Pinzgau cattle).
Location within country: mountains of Bosnia, Herzegovina, Serbia, Montenegro

Additional information: 2003: The Gatacko breed, pure Tyrolean Grey and crossbreed of this type represent some 10 to 15 percent of the total cattle population.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to local conditions and local production systems.
Color comments: uni coloured : grey
Description of origin: Tyrolean Grey x local cows of the Busa type
Location within country: areas of Gacko, Stolac, Nevesinje, Trnovo, Sarajevo and Mostar

Additional information: 2003: The breed was gradually abandoned and replaced by Simmental during recent decades. In 1950, research on the breed composition of herds in Sava valley (the northern part of Bosnia) showed that 23,8 percent of the total cows belonged to Posavsko cattle and 7,0 percent to crosses between Posavsko and Simmental.
Description of origin: small variety of Serbian Steppe. Posavsko (a dual-purpose breed) was developed, in the northeastern part of the country, by farmers and by the breeding station at Modrica based on the traditional Podolic population (Bos europeus primigenius, Ruetimeyer).

Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to high mountains
Color comments: uni coloured: red or grey

Other name: Bosanski Brdski Konj, Bosnian Pony, Bosniak
Additional information: 2003: During the war the breeding and conservation program for the Bosnian Mountain Horse has been seriously affected.The majority of the horse population (some 70 percent) belongs to this local breed Bosnian Mountain Horse.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to the local environment.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This flow influence on the hyperkeratosis of skin and hyperplasia of connective tissue and cartilaginous of metatarsal joint, what is characteristic disease for this breed.
Color comments:
uni coloured: most specimens (42%) are brown and rest white, grey, and black
comment: horses with different colours of hair are very rare (0, 5%)
Description of origin: local Busa pony. Firs reiterated stable that raised BMH was in Gorazde.

Additional information: 2003, Very poor results in meat production have lead to extinction of this breed. Today only crossbreed of this pig can be found.
Adaptability to specific environment: Very resistant to bad living conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Well resistance to diseases.
Special characteristic of product: It is not efficient for meat production. Fresh meat from this pig is however rarely used, but it is traditionally smoked. This product called prsut is very appreciated at consumers and it is considered delicates.
Color comments: uni coloured: grey
Description of origin: origin of Sumadija, Turopolje. This pig originated from European wild pig (Sus scrofa europeus),

Color comments: uni coloured: red
Horn shape size and comments: medium-sized
Description of origin: composite of different red-coloured European cattle breeds
Location within country: country-wide but mostly in Grodno and Minsk regions

Additional information: Data before independence refer to Former USSR.
Other special qualities: This breed is characterised by a strong constitution, hardiness and high milk production over a long lifetime.
Color comments: uni coloured: light grey with yellow or pale yellow top line (similar to Brown Swiss)
Description of origin: composite of Swiss Brown and improved local (Babaev and Miskov)
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for seven months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.

Additional information: Data before independence refer to Former USSR.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown of various shades
Description of origin: imported from Switzerland and Germany in early 19th century
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 6 - 6.5 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: The crossing of Swiss Brown with indigenous breeds throughout the former USSR has led to the development of many regional breeds including Ala-Tau, Lebedin, Caucausian Brown and Carpathian Brown.

Other name: Belorusskaya Upryazhnaya, Coach, Draft, Harness, White-Russian Carriage, Byelorussian Harness
Additional information: Data before independence refer to Former USSR.
Color comments: uni coloured: dun, bay, chestnut and light bay
Description of origin: composite of draft and coach breeds: maybe Dole and local horses
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 6-7 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters:
The top performance results for the breed are as follows:
- 2 km walking record (with a pull of 150 kg) in 14 min 41 sec;
- 2 km trotting record (with a pull of 50 kg) in 5 min 13 sec;
- with a pull of 300 kg the record was 388.8 m;
- maximum load capacity kg 660;

Other name: White-Russian Pied, White-Russian Spotted, Byelorussian Black Pied
Additional information: Data before independence refer to Former USSR.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to stress.
Color comments: multi coloured: black with white spots
Description of origin: composite of Large White, Large Black, Berkshire, Middle White, Tamworth, Yorkshire and local pigs

Description Of Specific Uses: Fine fibres 20 - 24 µ (kg): 1.190; Heavy fibres >25 µ (kg): 0.425
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is raised in the Andean rangelands in altitudes above 4 000 m asl. The Huacaya has a greater density of hair fibers allowing a greater adaptation to climatic change compared to the Suri breed.
Special characteristic of product: The breed produces a very valuable fine fibre.
Other special qualities: The animals are constantly exposed to cold, heat, dump, hunger and thirst. They usually drink once a week even when water is available. It is reported that they have higher digestibility of crude fibre than sheep. They are considered as a very hardy breed.
Description of origin: indigenous breed. all presentday camelids (Bacterian camel, dromedary, llama, alpaca, guanaco and vicuna) decended from a group of animals living 16 million years ago in the Rocky mountain area of presentday USA
Location within country: mainly in department of La Paz
Additional performance parameters: - dried dung (boñiga) is used as fuel source;

Description of origin:
indigenous breed.
All presentday camelids (Bacterian camel, dromedary, llama, alpaca, guanaco and vicuna) decended from a group of animals living 16 million years ago in the Rocky mountain area of presentday USA.
Location within country: mainly in department of La Paz

Description of origin: imported from USA

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to the harsh environment conditions in the semi-arid thorn forest of the Chaco. The environment of the Chaco differs in Bolivia, Paraguay and Argentina due to soils and rainfall though winters are dry and cold in all three countries.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are able to withstand the harsh environment and remain very fertile.
Color comments: comment: various colours
Description of origin: Criollo type
Location within country: semi-arid thorn forest of the Chaco
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were measured under very extensive stationary conditions with no housing and browsing in the semi-arid Chaco.
Comments managment conditions: There is an acute lack of water during cold and dry winters.
Additional performance parameters: The breed has been selected for fertility and growth. The main selection goal is beef production. Cows are milked in the wet season for cheese production.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to highland conditions in altitudes above 3 500 m asl.

Description of origin: The name of the breed comes from the Saavedra experimental station where the breed has been selected primarily for milk yield corrected for fertility in a humid tropical environment. Criollo cows of the area were purchased with a small number of bulls thought to be above average in their performance (no milk records existed). Semen was imported from Criollo herds selected for milk yield in a similar environment in Cuba, Nicaragua, Costa Rica and Brazil. Although the herd is surely highly heterozygous it is physically uniform (colour ranges from Guernsey colour without the white patches to Jersey colour).
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured under stationary conditions with no housing and with grazing and concentrate feeding. Lactation yield reported does not include the amount of milk suckled by the calf during lactation.
Comments managment conditions: Bulls of this breed are used for: a) cross-breeding with Holsteins or Brown Swiss for intensive milk production in those areas close to a market and with the possibility of concentrate supplementation (the cross-breds regularily produce more than 20 litres per day at calving); b) purebreeding in those areas where supplementary feeding is impossible and uneconomic and cattle must graze pastures or browse. In these cases, the cross-bred gives no more than the Criollo, which is however healthier, more fertile and more resistant to parasites.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to seasonally flooded plains.
Color comments: uni coloured: light brown, similar to Jersey
Description of origin: selected from the almost extinct Beni Criollo
Location within country: one ranch near Yacuma river in Beni, eastern Bolivia
Comments managment conditions: The animals are managed extensively on seasonally flooded plains. For about six months of the year they graze in up to 50 cm of water.
Additional performance parameters: Cows are never milked. They have been selected for over 25 years for beef production and uniformity.

Description of origin: native breed; introduced some 400 years ago by the Spanish colonists
imported; locally adapted

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Guinea pig gives birth 2.8 times per year on average.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to an arid environment and live in very hilly regions with steep slopes. Well adapted to high altitude areas (> 4000 mtrs. above sea level), cold temperatures and low quality pastures.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Gestation lenght is 345 days. Mortalityrate of new-borns: 15%.
Special characteristic of product: The Llama meat is more tender than meat of native sheep. Llama meat is high in protein and low in fat, it also contains B Vitamins. Dehydrated meat (sun dried) known as Charque contains considerble amounts of vitamine D. Bolivia is currently working on the control of Sarcocystiosis and Footh and Mouth disease in order to open up regional and international markets for llama meat. Fine fibres 20 - 24 µ (kg): 0.121; Heavy fibres >25 µ (kg): 0.618
Other special qualities: The animals drink usually only once a week, even when water is available.

Description Of Specific Uses: Used especially for transportation of crops.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to high altitude areas (> 4000 mtrs. above sea level), cold temperatures and low quality pastures.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The breed is resistant against viral pneumonias.
Special characteristic of product:
Fine fibres 20 - 24 µ (kg): 0.900; Heavy fibres >25 µ (kg): 0.525
Llama meat is high in protein and low in fat, it also contains B Vitamins. Dehydrated meat (sun dried) known as Charque contains considerble amounts of vitamine D. Bolivia is currently working on the control of Sarcocystiosis and Footh and Mouth disease in order to open up regional and international markets for llama meat.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours ranging from white till black but brown colours are observed more frequently in the Tampulli breed
Description of origin:
indigenous breed (Lama glama).
Lamas were first domesticated in the Andes region. The Inca people already reared the Alpaca in humid areas specifically for wool production while the Lama was reared in dry areas and used for meat production and transport.
Additional performance parameters: Performance data vary according to region and altitude.

Specific reproductive characteristic: Pigs fallow throughout the year but with a peak in spring at which on average 54% of the parturitions happen. Pigs fallow 1.3 times per year on average. On average piglets gain 96 grams per day before weaning. After weaning they gain on average 162 grams per day.
Other special qualities: Rustic animal.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly black
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Comments managment conditions: Traditional low input systems. Pigs scavenge on natural pastures and are sometimes supplemented with maize and/or pumpkins.

Specific reproductive characteristic: Survival rate of newborn lambs: 84%; Weight of ewe at parturition: 40.5 kg.
Description of origin: imported; locally adapted; introduced by the experimental stations of Ex- IBTA in the Central and South Altiplano

Description Of Specific Uses: Lately, with the growth of urban populations sheepproduction is more directed towards the production of lambs for slaughter.

uni coloured: black, white
multi coloured: black and white pied

Description of origin: The donkeys of the Brazilian breed originated from animals brought from Italy, predominantly Sicily, and have a close genetic relationship with African donkeys. In Brazil they were crossed with donkeys from Portugal or its African colonies. These breeding nuclei started in São Paulo State, and the products of these crosses are known as Paulista Donkeys.

Description of origin: imported; locally adapted; The Holstein cow originated in Europe. The major historical development of this breed occurred in what is now the Netherlands and more specifically in the two northern provinces of North Holland and Friesland, which lay on either side of the Zuider Zee. The original stock was the black animals and white animals of the Batavians and Friesians, migrant European tribes who settled in the Rhine Delta region about 2,000 years ago.
Managment conditions performance measure: Average production for all Holsteins is enrolled in official U.S. production-testing programs in 1987.

Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptable to a wide range of climatic and geographical conditions. They are more tolerant of heat than the larger breeds.
Other special qualities: They are excellent grazers and perform well in intensive grazing programs. Most Jerseys produce far in excess of 13 times their bodyweight in milk each lactation.
Description of origin: imported; locally adapted; The Jersey breed originated on the Island of Jersey, a small British island in the English Channel off the coast of France. The Jersey is one of the oldest dairy breeds, having been reported by authorities as being purebred for nearly six centuries.

Description Of Specific Uses: Barbados Blackbelly sheep is the genetic resource used for meat production but the West African and crosses with the BBB also contribute to mutton and lamb production.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for prolificacy. Ewes have a well developed mammary system. breeds at any time of year and twice per year lambing is common, along with a high percentage of multiple births; annual lambing rate is above 150%.
Other special qualities: These are hardy animals.

Description of origin: introduced from Africa over 300 years ago. The Barbados Blackbelly Sheep (BBB) is a tropical hair sheep. Evidence points to Dutch traders bringing wool breeds of sheep into Barbados that were crossed with African hair sheep brought to the island along with the slaves, resulting in what is now known as the Barbados Blackbelly Sheep.

Description of origin: Mithun Bos frontalis is the decendant of Gaur, which originated in the Northeast India but has been breed in Bhutan since at least the 17th century. Mithun (male) are often crossbred with Thrabam (female of Nublang) to reproduce Jatsa and Jatsham, which are productively superior compared to either of the parent breeds ( Biodiversith Action Plan 2009)
Location within country: All regions except far north and far south of Bhutan.
Comments managment conditions: These cattle feed mainly on browsing.

Additional information: In the western Bhutan the breed is called Bajo while in eastern Bhutan it is called Goleng. The Goleng / Bajo look alike and are historically from the same origin.Real breed studies are lacking and they are not specified in the census data.

Horn shape size and comments: The horns are shorty and fine and are sometimes even missing.The horn colour is black.The average length of the horn is 21.3 cm in male and 13.4 cm in female. horn circumference is 15.8 in male and 9.9 in female.
Description of origin: Bos taurus short horn, humpless, small breed of Tibetan and Mongolia.The origin of goleng is from the place of domestication along the silk road to Tibet and Mongolia.They came in ancient times over the highest Himalayan ridges to the southern slopes of Bhutan but remained at high altitude areas particularly found in Merak sakten dungkhags.
Year of origin: Before 1950ies when there was occasional trades of cattle with Tibet.
Managment conditions performance measure: open free range system
Comments managment conditions: Farmers usually keep 1 to 2 goleng cattle in their herds of cattle and cattle -yak crosses.They are well adapted to cold and harsh climate,high altitude,high radiation and big day and night temperature differences.their fodder requirements are very modest.

Description: Nublang is the traditional cattle breed of Bhutan since its presence dates back to time immemorial. It is a priority breed for conservation as its existence is threatened by introduction of high yielding exotic breeds in the country and restriction of forest grazing in the country.
Additional information: # Nublang is genetically unique and distinct from any other cattle in the neighboring countries # Nublang in the eastern part of the country is genetically different from the Nublangs in the west and centre region
Additional information comments: # Age old tradition # Time-tested draught power # Affordable # Easily manageable; zero management required # Robust and very adaptive # Contribution to the genepool
Adaptability to specific environment: * Requires minimal or no management  * Grazes freely in the forest during the day and is tethered at night  * The animal is highly adapted to a wide range of agroclimatic conditions  * Relatively more resistant to diseases than exotic breeds  * Good foraging abilities  * High adaptability can endure adverse nutritional and climatic conditions
Specific resistance or tolerance: resistance to many diseases and parasites..
Color comments: multi coloured: usually black-and-white or red-and-white
Horn shape size and comments: Big Horn directed sidewards, backward head, thinner posterior part
Description of origin: The origin of Nublang is linked to the legendary lake NubTshonopata, located on the western mountain ranges of Haa and above Nakha village in Sangbay geog. The legend resonates over many generations that the first breeding bull was gifted by the *Tshomoen of Nub Tshonapata to a cow herder who generously provided food and shelter to the Tshomoen. According to the elders of Sangbeykha, the gifted bull actually appeared, heading towards the herd of the herder, after a fewdays of the departure of the Tshomoen. The herder took good care of the bull and crossbred it with his herd. Soon the Nublang breed became popular and spread widely in the region. Thus Sangbey geog came to be known for the best Nublang breed in the kingdom. They are considered as a stabilized breed from crossing of humpless cattle (Bos taurus) from Tibet and humped cattle from India
Location within country: They are found throughout the country with higher concentration in Chukha, Haa and Samtse districts.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were measured under stationary conditions with all year round housing and grazing and fodder.
Comments managment conditions: # Requires minimal or no management # Grazes freely in the forest during the day and is tethered at night # The animal is highly adapted to a wide range of agroclimatic conditions # Relatively more resistant to diseases than exotic breeds # Good foraging abilities # High adaptability can endure adverse nutritional and climatic conditions
Additional performance parameters: Average age at 1st mating (month) 43  Average gestation period (days) 279

Description: The population is the total of native and improved chicken
Additional information: Khuilay - meaning ‘bald’. The naked neck is a notable and dominant characteristic characterised by complete lack of follicles in the neck and fewer or no feathers on the head. A featherless neck is an excellent adaptation for a hot environment as it is mostly found in Southern part of Bhutan. Naked neck has been reported in number of breeds including Transylvanian Naked neck, Malay Game, Cou Nu du Forez (France), Shingangadi (Zaire), and also in a number of local chicken populations around the world. This is true with Bhutanese local chicken population as well since naked neck has been found to occur in other types of indigenous chicken population. The gene for naked neck (Na) is an autosomal dominant and is mapped on chicken Chromosome 1. Naked neck has broad and flat back with prominent and square breast. As a broiler, they dress very nicely. Carcass is easily and quickly plucked and bare areas do not have as many feathers under the skin.
Specific resistance or tolerance: They are relatively resistant to major poultry diseases.
Color comments: Uni colour-red,white,
Description of origin: indigenous: Who introduced chickens in Bhutan?Where were they brought from?There is no record or evidence of these as of now.Chickens have existed in Bhutanese villages from time immemorial withstanding changes and test of time.They are found in almost all agro-ecological zones ranging from wet-subtropical to alpine regions.Frizzle and Naked neck are found mainly in warmer regions of southern foothills. Record suggests over 63%households in Bhutan raise chickens.
Comments managment conditions: Chickens are raised in four types of rearing systems:intensive system, semi-confined backyard system and scavenging system (free range).Most chickens in villages are reared in scavenging system, which is one of the most economical and sustainable feeding systems to utilize feed resources in the villages.Birds search their own food, scratching and picking on the ground in and around the household boundaries.

However, genetic differentiation among Bhutanese native chicken population was small when estimated from blood groups and morphogenetic characteristcs (Yamamoto et al.,2007)

Location within country: Poultry population is scattered all over the country however it is more rare than other breeds and found mostly in Samtse, Chukha, Dagana, Tsirang, Mongar,Trashigang and Sarpang
Managment conditions performance measure: intensive system
Comments managment conditions: Chickens are raised in four types of rearing systems:intensive system,semi-confined backyard system and scavenging system(free range).Most chickens in villages are reared in scavenging system, which is one of the most economical and sustainable feeding systems to utilize feed resources in the villages.Birds search their own food,scratching and picking on the ground in and around the household boundaries.

Additional information: Morphological, biochemical and mitochondrial DNA variation analysis revealed that notable frequency differences were not observed among local goat populations. But they are genetically affected by Indian breeds in southern areas and /or Tibetan goats from northern areas (Mannen, et al. 2007).
Color comments: Mostly black, white, brown with dark dorsal line
Horn shape size and comments: Mostly twisted
Description of origin: indigenous breed : Local goats are said to have originated in the village though they are genetically affected by Indian breeds in southern areas and /or Tibetan goats from northern areas (Mannen, et al. 2007). The Bhutanese goat has originated from bezoar type of wild goats.
Location within country: Southern part of Bhutan mostly concentrated in Samtse, Chukha, Dagana, Tsirang and Sarpang.
Performance data reference: • Local goats are of small size but are known for good quality mutton. The meat is tender and has good taste. Bhutanese people are not habituated with goat milk which is rarely consumed.
Managment conditions performance measure: Tethered their animals in the fallow land while others stall fed them.
Comments managment conditions: In mid-altitude areas significantly higher numbers of farmers tethered their goats on fallow land while in low-altitude areas more farmers stall-fed them. Farmers in both areas however also allowed open grazing.

Description Of Specific Uses: They are used for carrying loads for long distance and suited for hilly terrain.
Additional information: These are pony type of horses generally characterized by compact body, a well-developed chest, a strong back, round muscular quarters, strong and thin shin bones with hard and solid hoofs. They tend to have a short neck, with low withers, sloping quarters, a straight back, deep chest, straight shoulders, and a well-set tail. They are known for carrying loads over long distances and suited for hilly terrain. They are surefooted, skilled, intelligent, and sturdy. No uniformity can be seen in their coat colour.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to local environment.
Description of origin: Boeta (breed originated from Tibet) The Boeta are rare and only few crosses are available. The general characteristics of this type of horses could not be recorded so far.
Performance data reference: • Age at puberty: 24 – 36 months • Age at foaling: 4 – 6 Years • Gestation period: 330 – 350 days • Inter-foaling period: 357 – 758 days • Carrying capacity: 30 – 80 Kgs
Managment conditions performance measure: extensive management
Comments managment conditions: Usually horses are allowed to graze in native pasture and no pasture is produced specifically for horses. Some farmers exposed to improved horse management practices through farmers’ field day or trainings go for selective breeding but on a limited scale. In some places, horses are also taken to mountain pastures in summer when there is no work and the agriculture lands are filled with agricultural crops. Shelter to the horses is provided especially in winter. Maize, wheat, buckwheat, paddy are the main concentrate fed to the horses. Drenching of mustard oil and egg are also given to the weak horse to boost the stamina and vigour. Deworming is seldom done in horses. Regular health assessments done with the assistance and support from Livestock staff has reduced the incidence of disease in horses. Scrub animals are castrated on time, thereby improving quality of the horses.

Description: The population is the total of native horses only.
Description Of Specific Uses: seldom used for riding
Additional information: Study of genetic constitution through multi locus electrophoresis of blood protein revealed that both local and Spiti horses were similar to Asian native horses which had a common lineage with Mongolian horses. The polymorphic loci and average heterozygosity value are not significantly different between Bhutanese local horses and Spiti horses (Nozawa et al. 2007)  Yuta are the most dominant breed (67%) in all the Dzongkhags followed by Haflinger cross breed and mules. The Boeta are rare and only few crosses are available. The general characteristics of this type of horses could not be recorded so far.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to local environment. They are courageous in difficult terrain.
Description of origin: indigenous breed: Farmers believe that at least four types of local horses exist in the country namely: Yuta (pure local horse), Boeta (breed originated from Tibet), Merak Saktenpata (breed originated from Merak and Sakten)
Location within country: They are found in Trashigang Dzongkhag in eastern Bhutan
Managment conditions performance measure: Horses are generally allowed to graze in the native pasture and shelter is provided only in winter. Maize,Buck wheat,wheat and paddy are occasionally fed to horses.
Comments managment conditions: Usually horses are allowed to graze in native pasture and no pasture is produced specifically for horses. Some farmers exposed to improved horse management practices through farmers’ field day or trainings go for selective breeding but on a limited scale. In some places, horses are also taken to mountain pastures in summer when there is no work and the agriculture lands are filled with agricultural crops. Shelter to the horses is provided especially in winter. Maize, wheat, buckwheat, paddy are the main concentrate fed to the horses. Drenching of mustard oil and egg are also given to the weak horse to boost the stamina and vigour. Deworming is seldom done in horses. Regular health assessments done with the assistance and support from Livestock staff has reduced the incidence of disease in horses. Scrub animals are castrated on time, thereby improving quality of the horses.
Additional performance parameters: • Age at puberty: 24 – 36 months • Age at foaling: 4 – 6 Years • Gestation period: 330 – 350 days • Inter-foaling period: 357 – 758 days • Carrying capacity: 30 – 80 Kgs

Description: The population is the total of native horses( Boeta, meraksaktenpata and yuta) only.
Additional information: Breed Characteristics: Yuta are pony type of horses, preferred next to the mule. They are characterized by strong forelimbs with narrow chests. The hind limbs are mostly close hock and their hoofs are hard and solid. They are surefooted, sturdy, skilled, courageous and adaptable to local environment. No uniformity in the coat colour. They can vary in colour from black to bay and grey to white. The load carrying capacity is rather high compared to its body capacity varying from 40-80 Kgs. They are satisfied by low management with modest feeding.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to local environment. They are courageous in difficult terrain.
Color comments: Vary in colour from black to bay and grey to white.
Description of origin: indigenous breed.
Performance data reference: • Age at puberty: 24 – 36 months • Age at foaling: 4 – 6 Years • Gestation period: 330 – 350 days • Inter-foaling period: 357 – 758 days • Carrying capacity: 30 – 80 Kgs
Managment conditions performance measure: extensive management
Comments managment conditions: They are easily satisfied in regard to feeding, management and care.
Additional performance parameters: carrying capacity is from 30 to 80kgs

Description: The population of the yr.2009 is the total of native pigs ( Doemphab and Jituphab) only.
Description Of Specific Uses: Sacrifice during annual religious ceremonies
Additional information comments: The population reflected is the total population of pig including local (Jituphab and Doemphab) and improved breed in Bhutan.
Description of origin: indigenous breed- The existence of the local pig breeds is also quite interesting.National survey findings indicate that local pig breeds existed since generations and their ancestors could be the wild boar.This is because some of the physical characteristics are very closely related to the wild boar.Farmers have been rearing this breed since the time of their great grand-parents.There is a spatial distribution of native pigs across Bhutan.Looking at the potential pockets areas across the regions,it indicates that a larger concentration of native pigs is located in western and west- central Bhutan compared to Eastern and East Central Bhutan.
Location within country: Mostly concentrated in Pema gatshel,zhemgang,Dagana and Haa. The population reflected under population data is the total population of pig including local(Jituphab and Doemphab) and improved breed in Bhutan.
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Managment conditions performance measure: confined in simple house
Comments managment conditions: In general, 58% of Bhutanese farmers rear pigs by the confined method with a simple house made from locally available materials. Some farmers rear pigs by tethering and some participate in migration along with cattle in the lower foothills during winter and confinement in summer while some practice scavenging system without any housing. Few farmers tend to follow both tethering and confinement systems of management with simple housing. Some follow tethering in their homesteads without any shed. Majority of the farmers feed pigs with local feed resources that are commonly available in their locality. The most commonly fed local feed ingredients in the degree of availability and importance are alcoholic residue, kitchen waste, maize/ rice bran/hulls, green/seasonal weeds, nettle leaves, pumpkins, yams and taro. Local feed ingredients are fed 2-3 times a day depending upon the quantity available and the age group and body size of pigs.

Description Of Specific Uses: # Local meat highly preferred by the Bhutanese community # Sacrifice during annual religious ceremonies # Fattening for sale to meet urgent monetary need # Source of financial security # Role in religious rites y in the Bhutanese way of life and its meat is widely consumed.
Additional information: Jituphab (also termed as Saphab) is small in size with a bulging belly and small, flat erect ears. Generally both of these kinds are called as Yuphab in the Bhutanese context. They most often have 5 pairs of teats.
Color comments: Hair colour is black while skin colour is black to white and few are grey
Description of origin: indigenous breed: The existence of the local pig breeds is also quite interesting.National survey findings indicate that local pig breeds existed since generations and their ancestors could be the wild boar.This is because some of the physical characteristics are very closely related to the wild boar.Farmers have been rearing this breed since the time of their great grand-parents.There is a spatial distribution of native pigs across Bhutan.Looking at the potential pockets areas across the regions,it indicates that a larger concentration of native pigs is located in western and west- central Bhutan compared to Eastern and East Central Bhutan.
Managment conditions performance measure: confined management conditions
Additional performance parameters: Liveweight at first service of young boar 15-30kgs. Litter size at birth 3 to 9 numbers.
