Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Linzhou and Duilongdeqing Districts of Lhasa City, Tibet Autonomous Region.

Color comments: multi coloured: various colours, most common are yellow, spotted, red purple and black
Horn shape size and comments: The Liang Mountain have horns with shapes of""Baozi horns"""", sharp horns"""", taro horns"",""Zhaoyang horns"" ,and etc.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in the counties or cities of Liangshan Yi Autonomous Prefecture and the counties of Panzhihua city, Sichuan Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Liping reaches sex maturity comparatively earlier than other breeds.
Color comments: uni coloured: black or yellow are most common but brown, black and white as well as yellow and white may also be found
Horn shape size and comments: Horns of the females are short tender upswept and usually black brown. Horns of the males are rugged and mainly ""bamboo shoot horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Liping, Congjiang and Jinxiu counties in southeast Guizhou Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Luxi reaches sex maturity comparatively later than other breeds. The Luxi shows good breeding performance. The females reach sex maturity early and are able to be pregnant at the age of 8 months.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality meat.
Other special qualities: This breed has good strength for draught.
Color comments: uni coloured: light yellow to red and brown, yellow is rather common, the majority of them have pink areas: eye socket, muzzle, underside of belly, and inner side of quarters
Horn shape size and comments: mainly ""long men horns"".
Description of origin: central Chinese type
Location within country: Originated in Heze and Jining prefecture, southwest of Shandong Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to a harsh climate. They withstand temperature fluctuations -50°C to 35°C.
Color comments:
uni coloured: brindle or reddish-brown, occasionally yellow, black
multi coloured: occasionally pied
Location within country: Originated in Inner Mongolia; distributing in Provinces of Heilongjiang, Hebei, Shanxi, Shaanxi, Qinghai, Jilin and Liaoning, Xinjiang and Ningxia Autonomous Region.
Comments managment conditions: There is no free access to water, the animals graze all year under severe weather and unfavouable feeding conditions (poor vegetation).
Additional performance parameters: The fore quarters develop better than the rear quarters.

Color comments: uni coloured: black, yellow
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are mainly ""Longmen horns"" and ""shoulder pole shaped horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in the Yimeng mountainous area in central and south of Shandong Province.

Special characteristic of product: Meat is tender and delicious.
Color comments: uni coloured: females are often light yellow, green yellow or red yellow, while the males are black or with a black back
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are taper shape, splaying like a character and winding forwards and upwards.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Zhangpu, Longhai, Pinghe, Tong'an, Nan'an and Zhangzhou Prefectures in Fujian Province.

Color comments: multi coloured: yellow and red: light yellow or black is found under the quarters
Horn shape size and comments: For the males, there are two horn shapes of ""bamboo shoot"" and ""hawk claw"". Horns of the females are short and small.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Nandan County, Sanbao of Tian'e County, Bogong of Hechi County, and Xianan of Huanjiang County in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to cold and hot climatic conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high prolificacy. The females are managed to first mating at the beginning of 2.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality beef (good muscularity). The meat seems bright red with marbling.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught.
Reference for special qualities: Bureau of Ani. Sci. of Nanyang Region; Report on breeding effect in last ten years. Chinese J. of Yellow cattle 1986, no.2. Wang Guan-Se; Research on weaining weight of Nanyang cattle; Chinese J. of Yellow Cattle, 1986; no 3.
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, red or yellow and white in coloured.
Horn shape size and comments: short horns, lateral pointing tips. mainly ""radish horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed developed through long-time selection and improvement
Location within country: The Nanyang breed had its origin in the region of Nanyang, Henan Province, principally distributed in Nanyang city and in Nanyang, Tanghe and Dengxian counties.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.

Other name: Guanling y, Guxi y, Longlin, Wenshan y, Guangnan
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Panjiang breed reaches its sex maturity at the age of 8~10 months.
Color comments:
uni coloured: mainly yellow in coloured, and less with brown and black
multi coloured: some spotted ones, however, may occasionally be found
Horn shape size and comments: various horn shape
Location within country: Originated in the border area of Yunnan, Guizhou and Guangxi.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, red
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Pinglu and Xiaxian Counties in Shanxi Province.

Color comments: multi coloured: yellow or red yellow and few of them have a black line on the back
Horn shape size and comments: horns are mainly short and small with the tines outward.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: The central producing area is located in the 25 townships of Pingwu County in Sichuan Province.

Horn shape size and comments: horns mainly winding outwards and upright then.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Dulan and Wulan Counties and Ge'ermu City in the edge of the Chaidamu Basin in Qinghai Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to hilly country-side.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high prolificacy.
Special characteristic of product:
This breed is producing good quality meat. The meat is tender and has a distinct marble-texture.
The draught powers are 475.5kg, 333.6kg and 281.2kg for the bull, the bullock and the cow respectively.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught.
Reference for special qualities: Stationary of Animal Science of Shanxi province; Selection results in last ten years; J. Chinese Yellow cattle 1986, No.1 Dong Wei-An, Fattening experiment of Qinchuan castrates, J. Chinese Yellow cattle 1986, No.2
Color comments: uni coloured: mauve, red and yellow in Qinchuan
Horn shape size and comments: short horned, lateral pointing tips. The horn length is about 10cm for females and 14.5cm for males.
Description of origin: indigenous breed improved through long-time selection, belongs to the Central Plain Yellow cattle group
Location within country: Originated in Guanzhong Prefecture of Shaanxi Province, distributing over 27 counties or cities in Guanzhong Plain, Shaanxi Province.
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 F76-16
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.
Additional performance parameters: At moderate nutrient level and feeding up to 18 to 24 months, dressing and meat percentages are 58-61 and 50-52, respectively, with 75-76% lean meat.

Other name: Krasnaya Nemetskaua, Red Colonist (obsulete synonym), Red German, Red Ukrainian, Krasnaya Stepnaya
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is well adapted to continental climate.
Color comments: uni coloured: red of various shades
Description of origin: composite of Red East Friesian, Angeln and Ukrainian Grey, later also Swiss Brown, East Friesian: In 1930, China imported dual-purpose Shorthorn, Brown Swiss and Anatayckas cattle to improve the local breeds in Inner Mongolia, Jilin, Liaoning and Hebei provinces.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected form animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and with grazing all year round and subjected to fattening for only a short period.
Additional performance parameters: There are 3 main zonal types, Zaporozhye (high milk production), Crimean (combine high mily yields with high fat content) and Donetsk (high milk production with high live weight). The milk yield is three to five times higher than compared to Mongolian cows.

Description Of Specific Uses: This breed is usually used for tractive power, with the average draught power of 400kg.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours exist but uniform black and black and white are most common
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: the grass roots of south Tibet of Rigeze region in Tibet autonomous prefecture and the south foot of the Himalaya Mountain.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability to a cold climate. No tolerance to hot and wet climate is reported for this breed.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for the low calving rate.
Special characteristic of product: They have a good carcass quality and lean meat.
Reference for special qualities: Bai Jin-Shan; Study on milkability of Sanhe cattle Chinese J. Animal Science 1984, No.5 Li Min et al.; Beef performance of Sanhe cattle Animal Husbandry and Veterinarian 1986, No.1
Color comments: multi coloured: red, white
Horn shape size and comments: curved horns with upward pointing tips
Description of origin: composite of Simmental, Yaloslav Yakut (male) and indigenous breed (female)
Location within country: Hulunbeier Region of Inner Mongolia, Sanhe Region of Energulayou Banner
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey F76-15
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured under stationary conditions. The animals were housed for 12 months per year and fed on grazing and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: Since 1945, animal breeders have selected and bred cattle sistematically. Sanhe cows could produce 4000 kg of milk annually, with a fat content of 4 %. They also have a good carcass quality and lean meat. The dressing and meat percentages of steers were between 50 and 55 percent and 44 and 48 percent, re spectively, under normal feeding conditions without fattening.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Sanjiang, Baishi, Shuimo of Wenchuan County, Aba Autonomous Prefecture, Sichuan Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellowish
Horn shape size and comments: The Taihang has various horn shapes and the ""windward horns"" are common.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in over 20 counties in the west mountainous area of Hebei Province; most Taihang cattle are distributed in counties of Laiyuan, Yixian, Tangxian, Quyang, Fuping, Xingtang, Lingshou, Pingshan, Jinjing, Zanhuang, Lincheng, Neiqiu, Xingtai, Shahe, Wu'an, Shexian and Cixian, Hebei Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: light brown, grey or black
Horn shape size and comments: small outwards spreading horns
Description of origin: hardly any purebred of Taiwan in 1981

Color comments: uni coloured: usually yellow, red or brown, also black and grey
Horn shape size and comments: crescent-shaped horns
Description of origin: composite of Chinese Yellow, Red Sindhi and Kankrej
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected at Hengchun Research Station, Taiwan Livestock Research Institute.
Additional performance parameters:
- body weight at weaning (205 days old): 130 130 kg (males) and 122 kg (females);
- yearling weight: 223 kg (males) and 218 kg (females);
- feed conversion (gain/dry feed): 0.096 kg (males) and 0.079 kg (females);

Specific reproductive characteristic: The females are managed to first breeding at about 2.5 years old and males 3.5 years old.
Color comments:
uni coloured: mainly red as well as black
multi coloured: white spotted
Description of origin: similar to Mongolian but dwarf
Location within country: Tibet and QinghaiDistributed in the middle and lower reaches of Yarlung Zangbo River, east part of the Himalaya Mountain and the lower reaches of Sanjiang River Valley, Tibet.

Description of origin: variety of Mongolian

Color comments: Yellow
Description of origin: Wenshan Autonomous Prefecture of Guizhou Province.
Location within country: Wenshan Autonomous Prefecture of Guizhou Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Wannan is managed to have first breeding at 10 months and 1 year old for males and females, respectively.
Special characteristic of product: The meat is fresh, tender and delicious.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: The Wannan breed is native to Anhwei Province, distributing over the vast hill and mountainous areas beyond the Yangtze River and areas on both banks of the Yangtze.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow or brown yellow
Horn shape size and comments: The horns of bulls are thickset and patulous, with the shapes of"" across shoulder pole horns"" or ""Long men horns"". Female: short slim horns spreading upwards.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Wenling County, Zhejiang Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Weining reaches sex maturity comparatively later than other breeds.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, less yellow-brown and black, however white and yellow may also be found
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are of various horn shapes, mainly ""radish horns"" and ""hawk claw horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Weining, Hezhang, Bijie and Nayong Counties in Guizhou Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: yellow, brown or black
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in the two islands of Weizhou and Xieyang of Beihai City in Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

Color comments: uni coloured: black
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are black and comparatively small. And the horns of males are usually ""radish horns"", while those of the females are often ""qiangcai horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: The central producing area is Wuchuan County, Zunyi Prefecture, Guizhou Province.

Color comments: uni coloured: mostly yellow
Horn shape size and comments: cuneiform horn shape
Description of origin: including Enshi, Xiangxi and Sinan
Location within country: Originated in the border area of Hunan, Hubei and Guizhou Provinces.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals endure wide temperature ranges. Consequently, they are distributed across mountain and coastal areas.
The breed is known for its adaptability to a cold climate in the local environment (mountains and hills)
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for low fertility.
Special characteristic of product: Good meat/milk body conformation is reported for this breed.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown
Horn shape size and comments: curved horns with forward pointing tips
Description of origin: composite of Ala-Tau, Brown Swiss (male) and indigenous breed (female)
Location within country: Yili and Tachong Region of Xinjiang
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey F76-15
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured on animals kept under transhumant conditions. The animals were housed for 6 months per year and fed on grazing and fodder.
Additional performance parameters: Under grazing on natural pasture the dressing percentage for18-month-old steers has been 47.4%, 50.5 for 30-month-old and 53.1for adult steers, with respective meat percentages of 36.3, 38.4 and 39.3.

Special characteristic of product: Meat is slim, tender and tasting delicious.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are relatively broad and long head, and mainly ""longmen horns"".
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Peixian and Tongshan Counties of Xuzhou Prefecture, Jiangshu Province.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for adaptability to cold climatic conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Yanbian reaches its maturity at 14 and 13 months of age for bulls and cows respectively.
Special characteristic of product: This breed is producing fine quality meat.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for good strength for draught. Grazing all year round in the severe local weather conditions has resulted in thicker skins, coarser hair, sturdier bones, broader chests and a better constitution, and they are well adapted to poor feeding (tolerance to coarse-feed) and management conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: yellow
Horn shape size and comments: thickness of horn, backward printing tips
Description of origin: indigenous breed, improved through long-time selection: belong to the Northern Yellow cattle group. including Yanbian, Chaoxian and Yanjiang.
Location within country: Distributed in the Provinces of Jilin, Heilongjiang and Liaoning
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured on animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 12 months and fed on grazing and concentrates.

Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is managed to breeding at the age of 2 years.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, brown, red, yellow, grey and white
Horn shape size and comments: All the males have horns, but most females have no horns or only have very short horns. And most of the horns are stubbed. The horn shapes of ""long horns"",""short horns"" and inverse character can be found in males.
Location within country: Originated in the tropical and subtropical regions in the south, southeast and central of Yunnan Province, The central producing areas are Dehong Dai nationality, counties of Ruili, Luxi and Wanting of Jingpo nationality autonomous region, Xishuangbanna autonomous prefecture in Lincang region and some counties of Simao prefecture.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability towards heat, humidity and a hilly environment.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The animals are reported to show resistance to tick-flies.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are known for their high prolificacy.
Color comments:
uni coloured: brown
multi coloured: black, grey, red, yellow
Description of origin: indigenous breed improved through long-time selection
Location within country: Dehong, Xishuangbanna and Lincang region of Yunnan
Performance data reference: Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 FAO Breed Survey
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were measured on animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 12 months and fed on grazing and fodder.
Comments managment conditions: The animals are housed during night time.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The females are managed to first breeding at about 2 years old and male at 2.
Color comments: uni coloured: red, brown, yellow
Horn shape size and comments: mainly ""windward horns"".
Description of origin: Central Chinese type, similar to Nanyang
Location within country: Originated in the northern part of Zaoyang County in Hubei Province.

Special characteristic of product: Their milking performance is outstanding.
Color comments: multi coloured: various colours of black, yellow, white, brown, sandy, red, and most of them have white spots
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: the county of Nielamu of Rigeze region in Tibet autonomous prefecture, lying between the mountains of Himalaya and Laguigang.

Special characteristic of product: The meat is tender, sweet~smelling and without the smell of mutton.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly yellow, light yellow, grass white, black or red
Horn shape size and comments: The bulls have short rugged horns
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in the eleven counties of Zhaotong City, Yunnan Province.
Additional performance parameters: The pressed skin is tough and tensile with close texture.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The Zhoushan is managed to first breeding at 2 years old.
Color comments: uni coloured: black
Horn shape size and comments: various horn shapes.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Dinghai District of Zhoushan City, Zhejiang Province.

Additional information comments: Anyi gray chicken has the characters of tender meat and good flavor. However, the growth rate of this breed is slow.
Color comments: Gray
Description of origin: According to the records, Anyi gray chicken has been reared in the producing areas for more than four hundred years. This breed is formed after a long term of artificial and natural selection.
Location within country: Dongyang Town of Anyi County, Jiangxi Province

Additional information comments: Baicheng you chicken has the features of beautiful shape, high quality meat, high resistance to heat and cold. And selection should be strengthened to improve the production performance.
Color comments: Mainly yellow mottled or black mottled.
Description of origin: According to the records, Baicheng you chicken has been raised for more than 300 years from Yongzhen period of Qing dynasty. Local farmers have the technology of fattening chickens, and the bodies of these fattening chickens look plump and subcutaneous fat distribute evenly, so these chickens named Baicheng you chickens.
Location within country: Baicheng County of Aksu area, Xinjiang Uigur Autonomous Region

Other name: Jiangshan, Shangrao Baier, Yushan, Baier Yin
Special characteristic of product: egg weight is 53~ 55g., eggshell colour is puce, eggshell thickness is 0.34~0.38 mm., egg shape index is 1.35~1.38.
Color comments: comment: yellow beak
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Guangfeng,Shangrao and Yushan Counties, and Shangrao Prefecture in Jiangxi Province; Jiangshan City, Zhejiang Province

Other name: Bai yiner chicken, Jiangshan Baier chicken
Additional information comments: Baier yellow chicken has the characters of high egg production, the average egg number is more than 180 per year. So, this breed is a precious material for developing new egg-types.
Color comments: Yellow
Description of origin: Baier yellow chicken is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement by local people in producing areas.

Special characteristic of product: egg weight is about 53.62g. egg shape index is 1.35.
Color comments: comment: males: 10~15 pieces of green tail feathers
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Bashang district, Zhangbei, Guyuan, Kangbao, Shangyi, Fengning and Weichang Counties, Hebei Province.

Special characteristic of product: average egg weight is about 56g. eggshell thickness is 0.325mm. egg shape index is 1.32.
Color comments: uni coloured: dark red or yellow plumage
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Datun and Wali of Chaoyang District and Qinghe town of Haidian Distirct, Beijing Municipality.

Special characteristic of product: Egg weight is about 60g and sometimes 70~80g. It is about 70% eggshell colour with puce. Eggshell thickness is 0.386mm. Egg shape index is 1.33.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Ulanqab League, Inner Mongolia; Youyu County, Shanxi Province.

Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproduction performances of this breed are decreasing due to inbreeding.
Description of origin: originated in Nei-Mong, Kuoshiug, Taiwan (southern Taiwan)

Special characteristic of product: eggshell colour is puce, average egg weight is about 38.2g., egg shape index is 1.35.
Color comments: comment: black beak
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Dehong, Xishuangbanna, Honghe and Wenshan Autonomous Prefectures, Linchang and Simao Prefectures, Yunnan Province.
Comments managment conditions: Chahua Chicken is distributed in rural households.

Additional information comments: Changshun blue-eggshell chicken lays high quality blue shell eggs and it is enjoyed by the masses.
Color comments: Male-neck and saddle: red; back and abdomen: red-and-yellow; primaries: glossy reddish orange. Black male-body and fluff: black. Female-mainly yellow mottled, few black mottled and white.
Description of origin: Changshun blue-eggshell chicken distributes among Han, Miao and Buyi numerous nationalities residence for a long history. Local farmers found that a small number of local chickens lay blue eggs and these eggs taste good, so this kind of egg were regarded as treasures by local masses. Then, Changshun blue-eggshell chicken is formed after a long term of artificial selection.
Location within country: Guyang Town of Changshun County, Guizhou Province

Additional information comments: Chengkou Mountain chickens are famous for their meat quality and they are adapted to grazing and farming. However, these chickens have high broodiness, low egg production and slow early growth.
Color comments: Black
Description of origin: According to Chengkou County annals, Chengkou Mountain chicken had been raised as early as in the Daoguang period (AD 1844) of Qing dynasty in Chengkou region where the traffic was blocked. This breed is formed after a long-term selection and development by local farmers.

Specific reproductive characteristic: The cock has good fertility.
Color comments: multi coloured: males: mainly dark red feathers, green tail, black-red feathers on the breast and belly
Description of origin: indigenous breed

Special characteristic of product: average egg weight is 62~64g., eggshell colour is puce, egg shape index is 1.35.
Other special qualities: good abilities to find food.
Color comments:
multi coloured: males: brownish with a lustrous black tail: females: purple yellow
comment: yellow beak
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Zhuanghe County, Liaoning Province; distributed in Jilin, Heilongjiang and Shandong Provinces.

Additional information comments: aninghe chicken has high resistance to cold, and is suitable for field grazing. the breed has stable production performance. However, the chickens grow slowly at early time.
Color comments: Male-neck and saddle-red or golden yellow; brest-black or red; secondaries, main tail and sickles-black. Female-mostly light yellow or yellow mottled, few white or black mottled.
Description of origin: Daninghe chicken had been raised as early as in Qing dynasty by people in Woxi County of Chongqing. The breed is formed after a long time of artificial selection and improvement by local farmers in Daba Mountain, a relative isolation of the natural ecological conditions.

Additional information comments: Dawei shan mini chicken named “Xiang chicken” has the features of small body size, strong muscle, tender and delicious meat. Dawei shan mini chicken is beautiful and aggressive, and it is important genetic resource for breedness of broiler chickens or game chickens.
Color comments: Male-white with yellow, black with yellow or yellowish red; Female-white mottled, black mottled or yellow mottled.
Description of origin: There is an ancient custom of domesticating birds and fighting cocks for fun in Pingbian Miao minority Autonomous County. Dawei shan mini chicken, which is small and looks beautiful, is used for enjoying or fighting game.
Location within country: Pingbian County, Hani-Yi autonomous prefecture of honghe, Yunnan Province

Additional information comments: Dehua black chicken is one of excellent black plumage breeds. However, this breed has high broodiness and low egg production. So, selection should be strengthened to improve the production performance.
Color comments: Dark black
Description of origin: According to the Dehua Country Annals, Dehua black chicken had been raised about 260 years ago.
Location within country: Dehua County of Quanzhou City, Fujian Province

Special characteristic of product: Average egg weight is 49.6g at the 500 days. Eggshell colour is aqua. Egg shape is 1.33. Eggshell thickness is 0.35mm.
Description of origin: indigenous breed

Additional information comments: Dong’an chicken with excellent meat quality has good market economic value and development prospect. “Dongan chicken” dish and the unique cooking technology are important methods for developing the traditional food culture and exploring the market.
Color comments: Black or yellow.
Description of origin: Dong’an chicken with stable genetic performance has been raised for a long history. This breed is formed after a long time of artificial selection and improvement by local farmers in Dongan county where the traffic is frequently remote and no other chickens are brought into from other place.

Additional information comments: Dulong chicken adapts to high altitude and high humidity conditions, and suits for free-range feeding. The main disadvantage of this breed is low egg production, so selection should be strengthened.
Color comments: White with yellow, black mottled or yellow mottled.
Description of origin: The pronunciation of Dulong chicken is “ganbing” in the Dulong language，means teeny chicken. The breed has been raised by Dulong people for a long time. The areas are remote, inaccessible, and no foreign chickens are introduced into. So the breed is formed after a long term of natural selection.
Location within country: Dulongjiang Town of Gongshan County, Yunnan Province

Special characteristic of product: average egg weight is about 53.84g. egg shape index is 1.34.
Color comments:
multi coloured: gold-black feather, black beak, white skin and very few times black skin
comment: mainly red single comb and sometimes red pea comb or purple single comb or pea comb.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Emei, Leshan, and Ebian Counties, Sichuan Province.

Description of origin: originated in Ehr-Mei, Hsin-Chu, Taiwan

Other name: Lingyun Black-bone chicken, Donglan Black-bone chicken,
Additional information comments: Guangxi Black-bone chicken suits to free-range feeding in mountain regions. The main disadvantages for the breed include high broodiness, low egg production, slow growth rate, and low feed conversion ratio. So, selection should be strengthened to improve the production performance.
Color comments: Mostly black in Donglan County and yellow mottled in Lingyun County
Description of origin: In the producing area, the local people uusually regard feeding chicken as an important household sideline. The traffic is blocked and other chicken breeds can hardly be introduced. The breed is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement.
Location within country: Donglan, Lingyun County, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Prefecture

Additional information comments: Guangxi Partridge chicken has the features of tender meat and good flavor. It could be used as a good material to develop new types or breeds.
Color comments: Male-mostly brownish red, few brownish yellow or russet; main tail-black; Female-mostly brown mottled or yellow mottled; primaries, secondaries and main tail-mostly black.
Description of origin: he locals in the producing area prefer to select and rear chickens with partridge plumage. They have always kept the custom of slaughtering chickens when celebrating festivals or presenting partridge chicken to guests. The custom prompts the formation of the breed.
Location within country: Lingshan, Pubei, Hepu, Heng, Mashan, Du’an County and Fangchenggang city, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Prefecture.

Other name: Da'an, Jiangkou chicken, Madong, Nuodong, Xindu
Special characteristic of product: Egg weight: 41.07g. Eggshell colour: sandy beige. Egg shape index: 1.28~1.53.
Color comments:
multi coloured: males: red, black tail feathers, wing feathers are laced with black
comment: yellow beak
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Guiping, Pingnanteng, Changwu, Hexian, Lingxi and Rongxian Counties, Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region.

Special characteristic of product: commercial egg weight is about 51.4g., eggshell thickness is 0.35mm., egg shape index is 1.32.
Color comments: multi coloured: males: dark red or yellow: females: yellow, white and black
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Originated in Gushi County, Henan Province. Also Bred in Shangcheng, Xinxian and Huaibin Counties, Henan Province; Houqiu and Jinzai Counties, Anhui Province.

Special characteristic of product: egg weight is 52g. Eggshell colour is tan.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Minhe, Ledu, Ping'an, Huangyuan, Huangzhong and Datong Counties, Qinghai Province.

Special characteristic of product: Average Egg weight is about 50~60g. Eggshell colour is puce or light brown. The eggshell thickness is thicker than normal breed's eggshell thickness.
Color comments: multi coloured: blue, red, purple, white and other colours
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Kaifeng, Zhengzhou and Luoyang Cities, Henan Province.

Special characteristic of product: egg weight is about 42.89g. egg shape index is 1.38.
Color comments:
multi coloured: males: fawn and black: females: yellow and black
comment: yellow beak, white or yellow skin
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Location within country: Changting and Shanghang Counties, Fujian Province.

Additional information comments: Hetian Black chicken adapts well to the unique environments of producing areas. Conservation of the breed should be strengthened.

Additional information comments: Wenchang chicken has the features of precocious puberty, tender meat and good flavor, especially minute pores, high intramuscular fat content and moderate subcutaneous fat content. Traditionally, chickens are indispensable food when celebrating local festivals or entertaining guests in producing areas. The breed is formed after a long term of artificial and natural selection.

Additional information comments: Ji'an Red Duck has excellent characteristics of strong forging capability, higher lean rate, tender and tasty meat. The breed can be processed into pressed salted duck with attractive appearance and bright white skin, thus higher export ratio than other breeds. However, the growth rate of this breed is lower, so breeders should strengthen breeding program to improve its growth rate at early stage in future.
Color comments: Drakes- head and neck - grayish red; wing and trunk - brown; abdomen and tail - grayish white with little reddish brown. Ducks -head, neck, wing and trunk is brown or light brown; abdomen and tail - grayish white.
Description of origin: Nan’an pressed-salted duck in the producing area has been processed for nearly a hundred years of history. In order to improve the quality of pressed-salted duck, the local people consciously choose red-feather duck for breeding, propagation and feeding, and then use it as the raw material to process pressed-salted duck. Hence, Ji'an Red Duck is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement.
Location within country: Suichuan Jizhou, Jishui County, Jiangxi Province.

females: red orange shanks

Additional information comments: Jianshui brown duck has excellent characteristics of tender and delicious meat, strong foraging ability, bearing coarse feed and high egg production, they can adapt to all kinds of grazing environment. However, the growth rate of this breed is relatively slow, Breeders should strengthen breeding program in future.
Color comments: Drakes - yellowish brown; mirror feathers - greenish black; sex feathers - deep brown. Ducks - grayish brown.
Description of origin: Because brown plumage ducks have excellent characteristics of tender and delicious meat, strong foraging ability, bearing coarse feed and high egg production, the producing area people kept on breeding russet brown plumage ducks and eliminating ducks with other colors, and finally formed Jianshui brown duck with consistent plumage characteristics in the middle of 1970s.

Additional information comments: Longsheng Cui duck has the characteristics of tender and delicious meat, high blue eggshell rate but low production performance and significant individual difference. Breeders should strengthen breeding program in future.
Color comments: Drakes- black; head and neck - peacock green, few individuals with white spots on the neck and breast; mirror feathers - blue; tail and sex - greenish black. Ducks- mostly greenish black.
Description of origin: The producing area of Longsheng Cui duck is a gathering place for Miao nationality. The Miao people advocate black, and hold that the green shell eggs have cool and nourishing effects. Under this background, Longsheng Cui duck with black plumage and blue eggshell is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement.
Location within country: Madi, Weijiang Town, Ge Autonomous County of Longsheng, Zhuang Autonomous region, Guangxi Province.

Additional information comments: Mawang duck has the characteristics of precocious maturity, high egg production, small and flexible body, strong foraging ability and cold tolerance. Breeders should strengthen breeding program to further improve egg production in future.

Description of origin: The producing area of Mawang duck has a long history of raising ducks, which is recorded in the local annuals in 1865. The egg-type Mawang duck is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement by local people.
Location within country: Mawang Town, Tujia -Miao Autonomous County of Youyang, Chongqing City.

Description of origin: The producing area of Rongshui Xiang duck has the custom of raising and eating ducks. There has record for Xiang duck ever since the 1950s. Rongshui Xiang duck is formed after a long-term artificial selection and improvement of local people under the local unique natural environment and production conditions.

Additional information comments: Daozhou gray goose is a medium-body size breed. It has excellent characteristics of fast growth rate, tender and delicious meat and high feed conversion efficiency. Breeders should strengthen breeding program to improve its egg production performance in future. Daozhou gray goose can be used as paternal line in developing meat-type strians.
Color comments: Neck-with a grayish brown stripe starting from the top of head down the center of the back of neck and running as entire length; ventral neck, breast and abdomen -white.
Description of origin: According to “Daozhou annuals ” records, the producing area of Daozhou gray goose has marriage customs of using geese instead of wild geese. The local farmers raised geese by natural incubation under the condition of self-reproduction and selffeeding because of inconvenient traffic. Therefore, Daozhou gray goose is formed.

Additional information comments: Dingan goose is a medium-body size breed. It has characteristics of bearing coarse feed, laying eggs at all seasons, delicious meat but low egg production. Breeders should strengthen breeding program to improve its egg laying performance in future.

Description of origin: The producing area of Dingan goose locates in the banks of Nandu River with sufficient water and forage grass resource Dingan goose is formed under this special environmental conditions after a long-term artificial selection and improvement by the local people

Color comments: Neck- the back of neck has a grayish brown stripe, both sides and ventral of neck are grayish white; breast- grayish white or white; back, wings, shoulders and legs feather- gray with white edge; abdomen-grayish white or white.
Description of origin: In Hongwu years of Ming Dynasty, Pingba gray geese were introduced into the producing area by station troops whose native place was Fengyang of Anhui Province. Local people have the custom of using gray geese as sacrifice. Furthermore, there are many Hui people in the producing area, and geese are their main meat food. Thus, Pingba gray geese were formed after long-term acclimatization and artificial selection.
Location within country: Pingba County, Anshun City, Guizhou Province.

Additional information comments: Yunnan Goose is a medium-sized breed. It has excellent characteristics of tolerance to high-altitude, bearing coarse feed and high fat deposition which is suitable for the salted and cured products. But the egg production of this breed is low, so breeders should strengthen breeding program to improve its egg production in future.
Color comments: White or gray
Description of origin: According to the historical records, Yunnan Goose has been domesticated by Qi clan of the Hui nationality in Yongping for more than 740 years. There are a lot of Muslims living in the producing area. Salted goose is one of the main foods of the Muslims and the goose fat is also a major fat source intaking by the Muslims. Therefore, the people in the producing areas have the custom of raising and fattening goose. Yunnan Goose breed is formed after a long term of artificial selection and improvement.
Location within country: Yongping County in Dali Prefecture, Yunnan Province.

Description: The breed has moderate body conformation. The breed is described as follows: reddish skin, medium-sized and almostly rectangle head, unequal shaped and deep wrinkles, slightly dished face, thick snout, long and straight face, medium-sized, and drooping ears, flat and straight back (but concaved for the sows), lightly pitching rump, large and not reaching grounded belly, rumpled hams, sleeping pastern. The coat color of the breed is black, individually with white leg-ends and tail end. Average weight of female adult is 65.8kg. The litter size is on average 7.9 piglets. The daily gain in the fattening period is about 200g. The average dressing percentage is 68.5%. The backfat thickness is 3.5cm.The eye muscle area is 15.2 square cm

Description Of Specific Uses: The principal use of animals of this breed is meat production, which is improved by crossing with Zebu (Brahman) cows and for milk production Holstein crosses are used.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to the local environment of a medium coffee climate in the mountainous area of the Colombian Andes.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to Dermatobia hominis (Nuche) and Brucelosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are known for longevity and prolificacy.
Special characteristic of product: Animals of this breed produce lean and tender meat, and milk of excellent quality.
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are highly appreciated for crossbreeding with Zebu (Brahman) and Holstein, to produce hybrids for meat and milk respectively.
Reference for special qualities: German Martinez C. PhD ICA- La Livertad- Villavicencio Gustavo Hernandez PhD ICA -Tibaitata- Bogota; Oscar Arboleda, PSc Universidas Nacional- Medellin
Color comments:
uni coloured: white skin/fleece with black or reddish (pale) ears, the latter called Blanco Orejimono (White Pale Ear), BOM
multi coloured: mixed black and white: blue white and with black markings mainly on the head, neck and flanks called blue-painted
Horn shape size and comments: medium sized horns with black tips
Description of origin: Colombian Criollo cattle breed
Location within country: In the medium (coffee) zone between 800 and 1 800 m asl in the Colombian Andes, in the departments of Antioquia, Caldas, Risaralda, Quindio, Cauca, Valle del Cauca, Huila, Tolima and Cundinamarca.
Performance data reference: FAO Breed Survey Data forwarded from EAAP in 1991 Martinez, C.G. 1987. Estimation of genetic parameters of several productive traits in a Colombian cattle breed Blanco Orejinegro (BON) and its crosses with Zebu, Charolais and Santa Gertrudis. Ph. D. Thesis. Oklahoma State Univ., Stillwater, United States. Hernandez, B.G. 1981. Las razas Criollas Colombianas para la produccion de carne. Recursos geneticas animales en America Latina Ganado Criollo y especies de altura. FAO. Rome, 22-52.
Managment conditions performance measure: Production data were measured under sedentary conditions, without housing and with permanent grazing.
Comments managment conditions: The animals are usually grazing, and very rarely show animals and males in AI programmes are housed.

Description Of Specific Uses: Its meat is very sought after because of its lean and excellent quality, both in pure bred animals and those crossed with Zebu (Brahman).
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is reported to be heat tolerant and is adapted to flooded lowlands.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to tick infestation.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is known for high fertility (conception rate).
Special characteristic of product: Meat of this breed is sought after because its low fat content and tenderness compared with that from Angus cattle and for this reason Angus might be a possible ancestor of this breed.
Other special qualities: This breed is known for longevity.
Reference for special qualities: Hernandez, B.G. 1976. Genetic factors in beef cattle crosses in Colombia. Ph.D. Thesis. Colorado State University, USA
Color comments: multi coloured: red, yellow
Description of origin: The breed was formed by a mutation of Costeño con Cuernos and/or by crossing the latter with Red Angus and/or Red Polled, which is very improbable because the breed was known long before the introduction of the aforementioned British breeds. The name of the breed is derived from its lack of horns and from its place of origin - the Sinú river valley on the north coast of Colombia, department of Cordoba.
Location within country: Atlantic Coast, Valle del Sinu, Cordoba Province

Adaptability to specific environment: Presente en ambientes áridos
Specific resistance or tolerance: Adaptada a condiciones de sequia extrema
Specific reproductive characteristic: Es una raza que presenta alta precocidad y un tamaño de camada promedio de 1.6 crias.
Color comments: Predominan 1. Rojo cerezo: Desde tonalidades rojas claras hasta rojas oscuras (similar a un café rojizo), está tonalidad es en todo su cuerpo, a veces se encuentran un lucero blanco en la frente de los animales. 2. Pejo: Presenta una capa oscura (negro o café) en todo su cuerpo y a su vez manchas de colores claros que contrastan con la capa predominante (blancos y/o amarillos)
Horn shape size and comments: Longitud del cuerno en reproductores machos: 37.4 cm Longitud del cuerno en reproductores hembra: 16.3 cm
Description of origin: Esta población se originó a partir de los primeros animales que llagaron a la región del Cañon del Chicamocha (provincia de Garcia Rovira, Santander) con los conquistadores españoles. Durante más de 400 años, esta población ha permanecido en relativo aislamiento y forma parte de los sistemas productivos de la región
Managment conditions performance measure: Los sistemas de produccion predominantes en cabra santandereana son extensivos y basados en ramoneo.
Comments managment conditions: La cabra santandereana soporta sequias extremas, los productores realizan mínima vermifugación.
Additional performance parameters: Existe una alta mortalidad de cabritos, cercana al 30%; causada por depredadores de la zona.

Description Of Specific Uses: working with cattle
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are adapted to all of the climates of Colombia's different agro-ecological regions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: High incidence of Infectious Equine Anemia (IEA) which is endemic in the country. There are isolated outbreaks of Venezuelan Equine Encefalitis. There are high numbers of gastrointestinal parasites.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Their fertility and birth rates are low. On average they give birth every 24 months, with over 90% survival rates
Other special qualities: They are strong, rustic (i.e. not highly selected/tough) and have a nervous but docile temperament.
Color comments: uni coloured: wide range of colours, with chestnut being the most predominant coloured
Description of origin: Horses introduced by the Spanish conquistadores after Columbus' second voyage .
Location within country: country-wide with greatest density in hot, tropical lowland areas where the country's greatest livestock population is found
Managment conditions performance measure: Extensive husbandry conditions with grazing of a low nutritional quality.
Comments managment conditions: Extensive grazing.

Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are adapted to all climatic environments of the country.
Specific resistance or tolerance: High incidence of Infectious Equine Anemia (IEA) which is endemic in the country. There are isolated outbreaks of Venezuelan Equine Encefalitis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Their fertility and birth rates are low. On average they give birth every 24 months, with over 90% survival rates.
Special characteristic of product: Its gait is in diagonal bipeds in four time. They are lively animals with a great deal of character, but docile at the same time.
Other special qualities: The animals are of a beautiful phenotype, with a great deal of character, liveliness, agility and gentleness in their movements and with extraordinary resistance.
Color comments: uni coloured: wide range of solid colours, with chestnut being the most predominant colour
Description of origin: Descendants of Spanish horses introduced in the 16th century.
Comments managment conditions: Stabled and fed mainly on concentrates.

Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are adapted to all climatic environments of the country.
Special characteristic of product: They trot in bipedal alternate diagonals, executed in two time and canter is executed with diagonal advances in three time. They are lively animals with a great deal of character, but docile at the same time.
Color comments: uni coloured: wide range of colours, with chestnut being the most predominant colour
Description of origin: These horses may have originated from Criollo and English Thoroughbred horses.
Comments managment conditions: The particular husbandry conditions depend whether the animals are used as show or work animals.

Color comments: uni coloured: grey
Description of origin: probably descended from 300 pigs introduced by De Bastidas in 1525
Additional performance parameters: The first heat occurs at 5-6 months of age and 53-68 kg of body weight.

Special characteristic of product: The native Machaeras breed produces milk of high fat and protein content giving excellent halloumi, the traditional local cheese. Kid meat is lean and very tasty.

Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to the local environment but requires good management and feeding.

Description: Lighter weight type with a strong constitution, lesser (shorter) body frame, adapted to more extensive conditions in smaller flocks. High slaughter efficency and both meat and feather quality. Well maintained brooding and guiding instinct.
Additional information: The Bohemian goose was bred pure until the end of the last century, when it was almost replaced by importation of big foreign breeds. Thereafter, due to the high breeding and management requirements of the imported breeds, the Bohemian goose was regenerated from the remaining population in the Southern Bohemia and included among the breeds of poultry of great economic value in the 1930's. Experimental keeping of the Bohemian goose under large-scale production system was carried out after the World War II, but the low egg production and light live weight led to its replacement by other breeds. Presently these geese are reared by breeders of the Bohemian Goose Club. In 2003, kept on 23 private farms with individual recording and pedigree hatching involving about 160 geese and 40 ganders. Another 50 geese and 20 ganders are tested for the meat yield of the progeny at an international poultry testing station.
Efabis cultural role comment: traditional feast food (Christmas)
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals rear goslings twice a year. They have a reputation as good sitters.
Special characteristic of product: plumage cushions
Description of origin: old indigenous breed
Managment conditions performance measure: On farm animals are traditionally fed by seasonal feed, pasture, and about 20% grain Testing station uses standard compound mixture with NL 248 gL/kg and ME 11,5 MJ/kg in the starting period and 179 g NL and 12,8 MJ in the test period, kept in a deep litter hall with outdoor run and natural light
Comments managment conditions: In smallhold conditons, there are geese even 12-16 year old and still productive
Additional performance parameters: Live weight (station tests) 5,4kg/4,5kg in 1 year old males and females respectively, and 6,7kg/4,9kg in elder males and females respectively 56-day fattening test (station tests): liveweight (LW)= 3,39kg (males) and 2,97 kg (females), feed conversion 2,97 kg/kg LW in males and 3,09 in females Slaughter analysis (skinless body, minimum difference between males and females): 70,3% slaughter yield, fat 2% LW, muscle 18,8% LW

Performance data reference: Similar to the Czech goose, slightly lower egg weight but higher of reared goslings (7.7 - 8.3) in a ten-year data set. However this might be a result of smaller flock size and/or breeders care compared to the Czech goose.

Description of origin: The breed has been imported from Sweden and the island Jersey. The first import took place in 1896. From 1896 to 1980 the Danish Jersey population expanded by pure breeding. Since 1980 some import of semen, mainly from USA, but also from New Zealand has taken place. The percentage of genes originating from the original Danish Jersey of 1980 has consequently decreased and it is now down to 74% (1997).
Import: since 1980 import of semen from Jersey bulls from USA and New Zealand
Managment conditions performance measure: Milk parameters are the average yield of all milk recorded cows at 1. lactation in 305 days. Meat parameters have been measured on young bulls at performance test stations.
Comments managment conditions: Danish Jersey is used in intensive dairy production. The majority of cows is housed in tie barns during winters. Heifers are raised in loose holdings and summer grazing. Male calves are mainly used for special veal production in intensive fattening units and slaughtered at approximately 220 kg liveweight at approximately 8 months of age.

Additional information: 1997: Information based on number of females served by AI.

Managment conditions performance measure: The milk yield is the average of all milk recorded cows in 1996-97. The meat parameters have been taken at performance tests for bulls with 42-336 days in 1996-97.

Color comments: multi coloured: red with white head belly and legs
Description of origin: imported from United Kingdom
