Description of origin: composite of local breeds, Anglo-Norman and Thoroughbred (United Kingdom)
Import: since 1950, 20% from Thoroughbred (United Kingdom) and Holsteiner (Germany)

Efabis cultural role comment: sport
Color comments: uni coloured: grey, bay, chestnut
Description of origin: composite of local breeds and Arab

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability towards extreme climatic conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: white with black face and feet
Description of origin: native breed. This breed was brought to the Carpathian region from the 13th century onwards.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to extreme climatic conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Description of origin: This breed was brought to Hungary in the 18th century by German settlers.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its adaptability towards extreme climatic conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, white
Horn shape size and comments: corkscrew - shaped; ram: angle of 120° between the two horns;
Description of origin: indigenous breed

Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: spiral shaped horns

Color comments: multi coloured: white with black head and legs

Additional information: 1994: Seventy Bronze turkeys are kept in Debrecen and 80 in Kiskunság in closed breeding.
Description of origin: This breed was imported from England in the 18th century. The pure-bred population is now considered a native breed in Hungary.

Additional information: All the 50 registered Copper turkeys are kept in Bugac (Kiskunság, central Hungary) as a closed breed.
Description of origin: The original population of turkeys was imported from Bosnia in the 18th century. Later they mixed with the imported Bronze turkey, which resulted in the Copper turkey breed. The pure-bred population is now considered as Hungarian indigenous breed.

Description: Kerbau
Description Of Specific Uses: meat producer, social, culture, labor, and economic uses
Additional information: Resistant to parasitic diseases (ticks and worms), High adaptation to changes in temperature and humidity, High fertility and annual calving, Estrus period of 22 – 96 hours.
Adaptability to specific environment: High adaptation to changes in temperature and humidity
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to parasitic diseases (ticks and worms)
Specific reproductive characteristic: High fertility and annual calving
Special characteristic of product: Meat for traditional food
Color comments: Black coloured body with white stripes around the neck, chest surface, and legs.
Horn shape size and comments: Curved toward the back, up, and down. In small number for short straight down horns.
Description of origin: Asian swamp buffaloes long adapted on the west coast of Aceh.
Location within country: Bener Meriah, Central Aceh, and and Gayo Lues district in Aceh Province.
Managment conditions performance measure: Traditional management.
Comments managment conditions: Live in groups in traditional management
Additional performance parameters: Estrus cycle of 19 – 25 days

Description: Kalang is the name of floating platform house made of timber-logs where this local buffalo breed spending most times in swampy areas, especially during high tide.
Description Of Specific Uses: Special use for buffalo race.
Adaptability to specific environment: resistance to limited feed and turbid drinking water
Specific resistance or tolerance: resistance to various parasitic diseases (ticks and worms).
Other special qualities: Having calm and tame temperament
Color comments: Skin color is mostly black and rather dark, with variation of grayish black or bluish black. In a small number are albino. For young buffalos (2.5 years),skin color is generally creamy or light brown, whilefor the olders are more brown colored blackish gray.
Description of origin: This local buffalo breed is expectedly from plained-chinese swamp buffalo and brought by Chinese for hundreds of years, since the time of the kingdom of Banjar, and by generation adapted in South Kalimantan.
Location within country: In almost all districts in South Kalimantan, Central Kalimantan and also spread in East Kalimantan.
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management
Comments managment conditions: commonly extensive system

Description: Kalang is the name of floating platform house made of timber-logs where this buffalo breed spending most times in swampy areas, especially during high tide.
Description Of Specific Uses: In many places the buffalo's head is used for a ritual ceremony before the start of constructing buildings.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to swampy areas.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals of this breed are susceptible to Haemorrhagic Septichaemia and Fasciolasis.
Color comments: uni coloured: greyish to black; albinism occurs
Horn shape size and comments: curved horns that point horizontal backwards
Description of origin: composite of South-east Asian buffalo and indigenous breed indigenous breed buffaloes, has been created long ago
Location within country: Only in Kalimantan, especially in siuth and central of Kalimantan where the area is swampy
Comments managment conditions: The farmers prepare a floating platform made of timber-logs (called Kalang). The capacity of the Kalang is 60 to 100 heads of buffaloes.The buffalos come to the Kalang when the tide is coming.

Description: Kuntu buffalo is domestication result of swamp buffalo and raised in Kuntu Darussalam District
Color comments: Light to dark grey skin color
Description of origin: Kuntu is a name of region where the buffalo raised, Kuntu Darussalam grazing area

Description: Moa is the name of the island where this local buffalo breed naturally adapted.
Color comments: Skin color varies: Black, Grey, White, dominant black with white, dominant gray with white, dominant white with black, dominant white with gray.
Horn shape size and comments: Similar to U-shape horns in swamp buffalo with varying size.
Description of origin: This local swamps buffalo breed alreadyadapted for hundreds of generations in Moa Island, Southwest Maluku District, Maluku Province.
Location within country: Moa Island and a number of districts in of Maluku; and spread to NTT, NTB, East Java, South Sulawesi, Papua and East Timor.

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to plantation and rainfed areas.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The first calving of this breed is earlier than in other buffalo breeds. The calves grow faster because of the higher milk yield in comparison to other breeds.
Special characteristic of product: Milk production of this breed is higher than of other buffaloes.
Other special qualities: This breed has a bigger body and heavier carcass than other Indonesian buffalo breeds.
Color comments: uni coloured: light to dark black
Horn shape size and comments: coiled horn shape
Description of origin: Imported from India since 1908.
Location within country: North Sumatra, Central Java, East Java
Comments managment conditions: A high number of animals is kept by Indians within and arround plantation areas.

Description: Pampangan is the name of local swamp buffalo in South Sumatera Province.
Additional information: Good converter for main feed source of the weeds in swamp areas
Adaptability to specific environment: Highly specific adaptation to swamp land
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistance to lacal diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Quite fertile
Special characteristic of product: red meat for traditional food
Other special qualities: milk for traditional food
Color comments: uni coloured: greyish to black
Horn shape size and comments: curved shaped horns that point horizontal backwards
Description of origin: Local swamp buffalo breed that are adapted long times in South Sumatra, This local buffalo breed comes into Bubalus bubalis sub generaor Indian buffalo that has evolved over many years, especially in Pampangan Subdistrict, OKI Distrct, South Sumatera.
Location within country: Especially Pampangan Subdistrict, then spread to Subdistricts of Jejawi, Lampam Pangkalan, Air Sugihan, Tulung Selapan and Pedamaran as well as to Districts of Banyuasin and OganIlir

Description: Local buffalo raised from generation to generation in Simeulue island of Aceh Province
Specific resistance or tolerance: Adaptable to parasite attack and heat stress
Specific reproductive characteristic: High reproduction ability and at 33 – 35 months reach its first parturition
Color comments: Redish fur color and white color around the eye, mouth and forehead, and white color in all legs
Description of origin: Simeulue is the name of an island in Nanggroe Aceh Darussalam Province
Location within country: Salang region, West Simeulue, Central Simeulue district, and Alafan district

Description: Sumbawa is the name of Sumbawa District in Sumbawa Island where the buffalo is adaptable by generations
Description Of Specific Uses: Milk is made for candy and poding (called Palopo). as good plowing workers in wet paddy fields. Ability to work in paddy fields during rainy season by 16.7 days/ha and dry by 12.6 days/ ha.
Additional information: Well adapted in two types of agro-ecosystem ie in wetlands and dry land
Additional information comments: Natural grassland (Rangeland) as places to live and grazing Sumbawa buffaloes
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted well to wet land and dry land, especially in the islands of Sumbawa and surrounding areas. But fairly sensitive to limited feed shortage and heat stress.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Good resistance to local diseases and parasite invasion.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Relatively similar to swamp buffalo.
Special characteristic of product: Sumbawa buffalo has a compact body with full of meat.
Other special qualities: Male Sumbawa buffalo has a very sturdy body, compact, and short legs
Color comments: Generally, three types of skin color exist, i.e. pink, gray and black. There is white color at front of the head.
Horn shape size and comments: Most horns grow outwards and form a circle. Stem horn is round and blunt with gray color.
Description of origin: This local swamps buffalo breed adapted by centuries in Tana Samawa or Sumbawa Island in West Nusa Tenggara (NTB) and other smaller Sundah islands.
Location within country: Mostly in NTB, and spread throughout the islands of Nusa Tenggara and various provinces in Indonesia; even to Timor-Leste.
Managment conditions performance measure: Buffalo farmers in Sumbawa Island.
Comments managment conditions: Animals are allowed for freely grazing in he meadow (Lar) around small rivers.
Additional performance parameters: Buffalo races (preferred) especially just before the rice planting season as an attraction appreciated by local community and becaming a tourism object.

Description: Body has various colour patterns.
Other name: spotted buffalo, Tedong Bonga, Kerbau Belang
Description Of Specific Uses: In many places the buffalo's head is used for a ritual ceremony before the start of constructing buildings. In North-Sumatra, West-Sumatra and Toraja the people have the traditional habit to hang the horns of slaughtered buffaloes on the front side of their houses. In Java many handicraft artisans make objects out of the buffalo horns.
Adaptability to specific environment: High adaptability to locally tropical environment and local feed
Specific resistance or tolerance: Good resistance to local disease and parasites
Specific reproductive characteristic: Good fertility
Special characteristic of product: Toraya Buffalo is the most determine the degree of sanctity of a traditional ceremony.
Color comments: Body colors of black, gray, white and mixtures. As striped buffalo, this animals have large blotches, spots and small blotches.
Horn shape size and comments: Similar to swamp buffalo horn-shaped with curved horn side towards the rear. Horn size varies.
Description of origin: This local swamp buffalo breed adapted hundreds of years especially in Tana Toraja and North Toraja.
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management
Comments managment conditions: semi intensive management and grazing management

Special characteristic of product: Animals of this breed produce brown meat which is very tasty.
Location within country: Aru and Ceram Island (Maluku), Irian Island

Description: Aceh is the name of the Province where this local beef breed adapted by generations.
Description Of Specific Uses: the meat taste better than other beef
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is known for its heat tolerance.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistance to various parasitic diseases (ticks and worms) and to infectious diseases (i.e. Surra, MCF)
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility rate is very high
Special characteristic of product: Meat is preferred by Aceh community for traditional food
Color comments: uni coloured: white, greyish to reddish white with blurred white legs and belly
Horn shape size and comments: usual Zebu horn shape
Description of origin: Composite breed from the crossing between Bos sumatraensis cattle from indonesia and zebu cattle (Bos indicus) from India.
Location within country: Mostly in 23 district in NAD Province as well as in North Sumatera
Managment conditions performance measure: Semi intensive management by cattle farmers
Comments managment conditions: Combination of housing and grazing management

Description: Indigenous cattle breed of Indonesia domesticated from the Banteng, a wild cattle species.
Provision Uses: Carting, DraughtPower, Meat, SavingSecurity, SkinsHides, Transport
Additional information: Bali cattel is widely distributed in Indonesia
Additional information comments: Native Indonesian cattle
Adaptability to specific environment: Good adaptability to cope severe environment, poor pasture or fodder as well as good heat tolerance
Specific resistance or tolerance: High resistance to local diseases, but susceptible to MCF (sheep as carrier) and Jembrana disease.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High reproductive rate
Special characteristic of product: White color with clear border (oval shape) on buttocks
Other special qualities: Black line on the back of female
Color comments: multi coloured Mainly reddish-brown turning black with white patches on hindquarters and legs for male; yellow-reddish-brown with white patches on hindquarters and legs for female.
Horn shape size and comments: sharp U-shape
Description of origin: especially domesticated from bos banteng
Location within country: Bali, Lombok, Timor, Sulawesi, eastern Java, Kalimantan, Sumatra, in almost 26 of 27 Indonesian provinces
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Comments managment conditions: Bali cattle are kept housed in back yards for a few months of the year, otherwise they are kept on pasture.

Other name: Bos Sondaicus Schlegel and Müller, Bibos Banteng Wagner
Adaptability to specific environment: These animals are well adapted to minimum pasture and fodder conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Animals of this breed are highly productive.
Color comments:
uni coloured: black or brown with white stockings, rump patch
comment: Males change their coloured from reddish-brown to dark-brown black with maturity
Horn shape size and comments: sharp U-shape
Description of origin: wild species Bos (Bibos) banteng, Bos (Bibos) javanicus (d'Alton)
Location within country: mainly in Ujungkulon, west Java, also Baluran, east Java
Comments managment conditions: Banteng are living wild in the National Conservation Park at Ujungkulon (West-Java) and Baluran (East-Java).

Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are known for their heat tolerance.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed has a low reproductive ability.
Special characteristic of product: The fat content of the meat is relatively high.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, greyish-white, reddish-white or blackish-white
Horn shape size and comments: short horns
Description of origin: composite of Bos indicus and Bos taurus, imported from Australia
Comments managment conditions: Animals of this breed are kept under intensive management in feed lots. Smallholders that live close by collaborate with the feed lots and receive input technology and feed stuff from the feed lots.

Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is very tolerant towards heat.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals of this breed need intensive tick and fly control.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The reproductive ability of this breed is moderate.
Special characteristic of product: The meat quality is moderate.
Color comments: uni coloured: brownish-black to black
Horn shape size and comments: very short horns
Description of origin: composite of Brahman (Bos indicus) and Aberdeen Angus (Bos taurus) originally imported from Australia: being developed in Peternakan Tri-S Tapos and on smallholder breeding farms in Lombok
Location within country: Bogor, west Java and Lombok, west Nusatenggara
Comments managment conditions: Brangus cattle are usually kept under good management conditions.

Description: Local cattle in the Donggala District of Central Sulawesi Province
Description Of Specific Uses: as a animals pullers carts that carry agricultural and plantation product
Additional information: length of productive life
Additional information comments: - The cow is able to give birth to 10 times
Adaptability to specific environment: very high tolerance to tropical climate
Specific resistance or tolerance: resistance to local diseases and parasites
Specific reproductive characteristic: fertility is quite good
Special characteristic of product: the presence of a large gelambir is capable to release body heat through evaporation
Other special qualities: more active sweat glands to release heat
Reference for special qualities: rapid body growth and large body size
Color comments: mostly white in color-gray and the others is brown and white plain color
Horn shape size and comments: horn shape is long and pointed
Description of origin: is the result of random cross between PO, Madura and Bali cattle
Location within country: Palu valley in Donggala district of Central Sulawesi
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, semi-intensive
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management by farmers

Description: One breed of Bos Taurus dairy cattle.
Adaptability to specific environment: Holstein-Friesian are well adapted to highlands above 700 m asl in temperatures ranging from 16-24 °C and rainfall of about 2000 mm per year.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The breed shows a general resistance against diseases, but is susceptible to mastitis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The breed shows good reproductive abilities.
Special characteristic of product: It is a very good dairy breed. The milk contains an average fat percentage.
Color comments: multi coloured: black and white
Horn shape size and comments: close small horns
Description of origin: Holstein-Friesian have been imported from the Netherlands (since 1893), USA (1974,1990), Canada, Japan, Australia (1987) and New Zealand (1986)
Location within country: Mostly in Java Island and in Very small number out of Java Island.
Comments managment conditions: This breed is raised above 300m asl. By-products are used as fodder.

Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: small V-shaped horns that point outwards
Description of origin: This zebu breed has been imported from India.
Comments managment conditions: The majority of the population is kept by farmers in plantation areas.

Description: Coat cover of Indonesian Simmental Cattle is red with white colour on the head, lower leg, and tip of the tale. Generally confromation of Indonesian Simmental Cattle is long, compact, and dense.
Additional information: The breed can be recomended for industrial crossing.
Adaptability to specific environment: These cattle are adaptive in heat tolerant
Specific reproductive characteristic: The breed is known for its excellent growth, very good meat structure and good muscling.
Color comments: Hair colour of commonly redish-brown
Description of origin: in 1974 the simmental cattle entering indonesia to Padang Mangatas Breeding Center Western Sumatera from Australia

Description: Jabres stands for Jawa Brebes where Javacattle naturrally adapted by generations in Brebes Regency.
Description Of Specific Uses: as a meat producer Jabres have a solid structure of meat.
Additional information: tend to resemble the Bali or Madura cattle
Additional information comments: based RFLP results showed that Jabres, Bali and Madura cows have kinship relations shown the similarity of DNA bands
Adaptability to specific environment: These cattle are highly heat tolerant.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The reproductive rate is low.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A strong draught animal highly appreciated by Javanese farmers.
Special characteristic of product: Quite high carcass percentages (51%).
Color comments: multi colour: Color varies from light brown, dark brown, red, brick, white, white-black to black with brown as a dominance. Partly having a white spot on the forehead.
Horn shape size and comments: Horns vary in size and shape. Horns shapestraight up, straight down, forward curve, down curve and others.
Description of origin: result of inter-se mating of the crossing PO and Madura or Bali cattle
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management by farmers
Comments managment conditions: combination of animal house and pasture management

Description: Local cattle raised by people along the streamline of Kuantan river
Specific resistance or tolerance: Tolerance to diseases caused by worm
Description of origin: Local cattle breed at Kuantan, an area along Kuantan river, Riau province
Location within country: Kuantan Singingi District, and Indragiri Hulu District, Riau Province

Adaptability to specific environment: Limousin need to be kept under good management conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals of this breed are susceptive against ticks and biting-flies.
Special characteristic of product: The meat is well marbled.
Color comments: uni coloured: dark brown
Horn shape size and comments: short open horns
Description of origin: Tested bulls have been imported from New Zealand in 1987.
Comments managment conditions: The animals are kept under good management conditions.

Description Of Specific Uses: Madura cattle is also used for socio-cultural events such as the ‘Sonok’ cattle-contest and the ‘Karapan’ cattle racing contest.
Additional information comments: Karapan is a traditional racing attraction in Madura. The cattle run pulling a non-wheel crate and a driver behind. Sonok is a cattle dancing attraction following traditional music when there is a Madurese traditional ceremony. Many of tourist are attending the Karapan and Sonok.
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed performs well under conditions of extreme heat and low fodder.
Color comments: uni coloured: chestnut with pale underparts
Horn shape size and comments: small horns
Description of origin: Composite breed originated from the crosses of Bali, Jawa and Ongole (Bos-indicus) around 500 years ago in Madura Island.
Location within country: Madura island, Sapudi Island, Jawa and Kalimantan.
Comments managment conditions: Animals of this breed are an attraction at shows and therefore they receive special treatmen e.g.brushed and get additional feed.

Description: Local cattle in Pasundan, the name of a region in south area of West Java
Adaptability to specific environment: Quite high feed efficiency to produce muscle conformation (very goodframe)
Specific reproductive characteristic: Able to give birth 23 times during its lifetime, or on average 10 to 14 times
Special characteristic of product: Average carcass proportion 53% (bull) and 52% (cow)
Color comments: Having black line (eel strip) start from its back to the base of its tail, white color on its buttock down to the leg. In group, brown color more dominate than black and white
Horn shape size and comments: Short horn as dominant description
Description of origin: Beef cattle raised by people at the forest buffer zone area along north Priangan
Location within country: Ciamis, Pangandaran, Tasikmalaya, Cianjur region, Sukabumi, Garut, Purwakarta, Kuningan, Majalengka

Description: Peranakan Ongole (Ongole Grade) is the name of crossbred cattle between Java cattle and ongole.
Other name: Java-Ongole Cross, Javanese Ongole, PO, Upgrade Ongole, Brenggolo (java.)
Additional information: included in Bos Indicus famly
Additional information comments: has a good ability in tropical conditions and less of feed
Adaptability to specific environment: These cattle are highly heat tolerant.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The reproductive rate is low.
Special characteristic of product: A strong draught animal highly appreciated by Javanese farmers.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, grey, greyish white, blackish white
Horn shape size and comments: zebu horn shape
Description of origin: Peranakan Ongole cattle was originated from the crossing between of Ongole and Javanese cattle
Location within country: Mostly distribute across all provinces in Indonesia.
Performance data reference: Aryogi , E.Romjali, Maryono and T Hartati, 2006. Program to strengthen beff cattle germ plasm (PenguatanPlasma Nutfah Sapi Potong) Final Report. Indonesian Beff Cattle Research Institute.
Managment conditions performance measure: farmers level at Situbondo Region, East Java Province
Comments managment conditions: Cattles are grazed at forestry areas around the village and fed only based on local forages
Additional performance parameters: The cattles usually used for draught animals as well as saving purpoises

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat production, economic value, social, superior bull
Additional information: High adaptation from low to middle land and to low quality feed Traditional management with agriculture product and native grasses, Age of maturity 15 – 16 months, Birth weight 29.71 – 34.00 kg, Age of breeding anim 17.05 – 24 months, Age at first parturition 26.15 – 33.10 months, Parturition interval 13.43 – 15.25 months, Calving rate 70%, Calving interval 13.4 – 15.3 months, Age at first parturition 26 – 33 months, Relative resistant to tropical diseases and ectoparasites
Additional information comments: Breed manuscript for PO Kebumen (No. 358/Kpts/PK.040/6/2015
Adaptability to specific environment: These cattle are highly heat tolerant.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A strong draught animal highly appreciated by Javanese farmers.
Color comments: Hair colour of commonly white to grayish white, black nose and black tail.
Horn shape size and comments: Short horn; usually female with longer horn than male.
Description of origin: Crossing native Java with imported Benggala or Ongole and adaptive for generation in local region.
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management by farmers

Other name: Bantiang ratuih, Bos sumatraensis, Jawi ratuih
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is very heat tolerant.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Tolerance to disease and ticks
Specific reproductive characteristic: Early maturity and highly ferlitity
Special characteristic of product: Good quality of lean meat
Color comments: uni coloured: very variable, mainly yellowish-red
Horn shape size and comments: small horns
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Comments managment conditions: Pesisir are almost all year round on free range.

Adaptability to specific environment: These cattle are highly heat tolerant.
Color comments: Hair colour of commonly white to yellow, white and black nose and black tail.
Description of origin: breeding of Ongole crossbred cattle with characteristics capable of utilizing high coarse fiber feed and low protein, higher performance, and body weight than Ongole crossbred cattle

Description Of Specific Uses: Meat production and economic value
Additional information: Parturition interval 17 – 19 months, Age at first parturition 3.1 – 3.3 years, Calving interval : 450 – 500 days, Estrus cycles : 18 – 26 days, estrus period 18 hours, Good animal in grassing system and walking ability for long distance to find water and feed resources. Resistance to parasite disease and well adaptability, Adaptive to tropical climate of Rote Ndao region, Very good worker for planting.
Additional information comments: Breed manuscript for Rote Ndao Cattle, Indonesia Ministry of Agriculture Decree No.: 41/Kpts/PK.020/1/2017
Adaptability to specific environment: highly heat tolerance
Specific resistance or tolerance: resistance to local diseases and parasites
Specific reproductive characteristic: high fertility
Special characteristic of product: important role for culture (customs)
Color comments: White hair mixed with bold red or black stripped
Horn shape size and comments: Upside curve, long and compact horn
Description of origin: Crossing white haired Sumba – Ongole cattle with bali cattle and inter-se mating generations.
Location within country: Rote Ndao district, East Nusa Tenggara
Managment conditions performance measure: semi intensive management by farmers

Adaptability to specific environment: This triple-purpose breed is well adapted to lowlands below 300m asl.
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly brown and brownish-black
Horn shape size and comments: open short horns
Description of origin: composite of Sahiwal (Bos-indicus) and Friesian Holstein imported from New Zealand since late 1985
Location within country: north Sumatra, south Kalimantan, south-east Sulawesi
Comments managment conditions: This breed needs more intensive pest control against ticks and biting flies.

Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed require more feed stuff in terms of quantity and quality in comparison to indigenous Indonesian cattle.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is susceptive to ticks and other tropical insects.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The reproductive ability seems to be lower in comparison with indigenous Indonesian cattle.
Special characteristic of product: Simmental has a better meat quality in comparison to Ongole.
Color comments: uni coloured: brown to dark brown with white face
Horn shape size and comments: small horns
Description of origin: imported from Australia (1984)
Location within country: The population is very scattered and mainly found in Java, Sumatra, Nusatenggara and Sulawesi.
Comments managment conditions: Usually farmers keep the Simental cross cattle under good management conditions in order to raise a better price.

Provision Uses: Carting, DraughtPower, Meat, PackBaggage, SavingSecurity, Transport
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is very heat tolerant and well adapted to thrive on poor pasture.
Other special qualities: Strong, tame and docile temperament.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, greyish, blackish-white
Horn shape size and comments: short to medium horns
Description of origin: imported from India in 1904 and 1909

Description: Sumbawa is the island name from where this breed originated
Description Of Specific Uses: meat has a a good taste.
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is known for its heat tolerance.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistance to various parasitic diseases (ticks and worms) and to infectious diseases (i.e. Surra, MCF)
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility rate is very high
Special characteristic of product: Meat is preferred by Aceh community for traditional food
Color comments: Mostly white for female and gray white for male; and in a small part a combination of black and yellowish red
Horn shape size and comments: Horns have large and long sizes with smaller sizes for male than female.
Description of origin: This breed is originally from Hissar cattle imported from India by the Dutch East Indies, then farmed by people in Sumbawa island
Location within country: Sumbawa Island, West Nusa Tenggara Province
Managment conditions performance measure: extensive management at beef cattle farmers
Comments managment conditions: Traditional management, all the day cattle are allowed for grazing in pastures.
Additional performance parameters: Extremely good adaptation in hot and dry temperatures.

Description: Native breed chicken with long crowing from Sumenep District, East Java Province
Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptable to arid and dry environment in lowland and highland
Specific resistance or tolerance: Disease resistant and tolerate to local environment
Specific reproductive characteristic: Start laying eggs on 6-7 month of age, produce ± 30 eggs for 12 weeks
Special characteristic of product: Having long and melodious crowing, quite high on circumference of chest and body weight
Other special qualities: Long and melodious crowing
Color comments: Various color as ordinary local chicken and predominantly wild type with 70% barred plumage color. In the rooster almost have the uniform color that has a base color of greenish green with a silvery white yellow cover to almost 90% of the plumage
Description of origin: Red Junglefowl (Gallus gallus) brought from Kutai Kingdom then adapted to Puteran island environment conditions which were arid and barrens area, surrounded by beach and isolated.
Location within country: Potera island, Sumenep District, Madura islands. In Madura islands Gaok chicken are find in Gapurana vilage, included in Talango regency, Sumenep district. Gaok chicken also spread in Pamekasan district and Bangkalan district beside Poteran island and Sumenep district
Managment conditions performance measure: Traditionally raised in the backyard
Comments managment conditions: Raised as fancy chicken or pets because of its unique crowing sound

Color comments: Characteristic of the feather color is mix of white, brown, black, and grey. Shank colors are dominated by grey, white, yellow, and black with the grey one is dominant.

Description: KUB-1 chicken is originated from the crossing among local chickens from Cianjur, Bogor, Jatiwangi, Ciamis and Depok districts. Continued by intense selection for egg productivity and shortened brooding periods for five generations. KUB-1 is abbreviation from "Kampung Unggul Balitbangtan".
Description Of Specific Uses: The average egg production is 160 eggs/year , where as males are used for meat production with average body weighrt of 1.1 kg at 13 weeks of age.
Additional information: KUB-I population has been distribued widely in around 20 provines in Indonesia.
Color comments: KUB-1 has dominant colours of black feather (64%), feather pattern of non bar (63%), bright gold flicker feather (75%); combination of black, green and grey shank (74%); single comb type (75%).
Description of origin: KUB-1 was developed by researchers at Indonesia Research Institute for Animal Production (IRIAP), Bogor, West Java
Location within country: The development program has distributed KUB-1 to 26 provinces in Indonesia namely Aceh, North Sumatera, West Sumatera, Bengkulu, Jambi, Lampung, South Sumatera, Riau island, Banten, West Java, Centreal Java, East Java, Yogyakarta special regency, Bali, West Nusa Tenggara, North Maluku, South Sulawesi, Gorontalo, Southeast Sulawesi, Maluku, Papua.

Description: multiply in Kedu of Temanggung Regency Central Java Province.
Description Of Specific Uses: #NAME?
Color comments: Based on the distribution of feather color, the color is categorized as white, colored and black.
Description of origin: the Indonesian Native chicken derives from the jungle fowl in India, Nepal, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and South East Asia unspecific cross of Gallus gallus (ayam-Asia), Gallus soneratii (ayam-India), Gallus lafayeti (ayam-Ceylon), Gallus varius (ayam-Asean) and Gallus bankiva and This local chicken breed was cultivated by Kedu community by generations in Central Java Province.
Location within country: Mainly in Temanggung, Magelang, Wonosobo Districts as well as in surrounding area in Central Java. This chicken also spreads to Klaten, Magelang, as well as out of Java Island such as in South Klaimantan and South Sulawesi.

Description: Has characteristics of typical crowing sound, very melodic and composite-stacking, which can reach 24 syllables.
Description Of Specific Uses: Crowing sound produced is very beautiful so potential to be used as a type of singer chicken. This chicken is the object of bioakustik crowing study because of its melodious voice.
Color comments: Body color pattern has many variations. Part is white to yellowish white. Coms has a bright red color, pial is red. Feather on the neck is red to white. Back feathers are red, yellow and black, chest hais are is black. Wing feathers are black and red. Tail feathers are shiny black. Legs are grayish black. Nails are white. Hair color on the chest, wings and tail are black, while the others are red. These characteristics is similar with Sumatera Red Jungle Fowl (Gallus gallus).
Description of origin: Estimated as native chicken breed derived from the Red Jungle Fowl and naturraly adaptep in Solok, West Sumatera.

Description: Merawang is the name of the village where this local chicken breed originated in Merawang District, Bangka, Bangka Belitung Islands.
Description Of Specific Uses: High egg production, Rapid growth, Low fatty, Religious ceremony for the Chinese community in Bangka Island
Special characteristic of product: High nutritious egg, less fat meat
Color comments: Have Colombian or golden feather pattern. Dominant feather color is brown, red and golden yellow, with columbian feathers, ie tip of the wings and tail are black. Sex linked feather color. In females, feather color is usually brown popcorn black, while males are reddish brown with black tail feathers. Skin, beak, and shank have white or yellowish color, while eye color is yellow.
Description of origin: Originated from the species Gallus gallus-, family Phasianidae where this chicken is taken by tin miners from mainland China to Indonesia in the Dutch colonial period.

Description: Nunukan is the name of the District where this local chicken bred was originally formed in East Kalimantan.
Description Of Specific Uses: - High egg production - Rapid growth, weight at age 6 months 3.5 kg and adult over 4 kg
Color comments: comment: yellowish beak, red comb
Description of origin: This local chicken breed expectedly originated from the southern part of mainland China, which entered into Tarakan brought by Chinese immigrants through Tawao and Nunakan. This chicken long adapted in Tarakan and Nunukan, East Kalimantan.
Location within country: Tarakan and Nunukan Districts, East Kalimantan

Description: distinctive, melodious, and long flowing voice of the rooster
Description Of Specific Uses: Pelung chicken has a melodious voice
Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptive to local environment
Special characteristic of product: Rooster with distinctive, melodious, and long flowing voice that can be hear from afar
Other special qualities: Big body and rapid growth
Color comments: For males, feather color varies from black to red color combination, black with yellowish red or reddish yellow. Sometimes there is a combination of black with green feather. For females, feather color is dark yellow / brown, cream, black. For feathers on the neck, there is a line of yellow, black. Black color has white spots, and dark yellow spots white spots.
Description of origin: The local chicken breed came from the area of Cianjur, West Java.
Location within country: Cianjur region, province of West Java, Indonesia

Description: Characteristic of cock shown as basic colour of black with feather of redish yellow brown and black with shiny green covered of white yellowish feather; where as the characteristic of hen include of black with columbian colour, black with patches or black with dark yellowish 2. The colour of shank is greenish black, greyish black, yellow or white 3. The comb characteristic
Additional information: New: Pelung Ulu Chicken never been sold/distributed and just recently selected in 2014 to produce male line. Unique: Body weight in 12 weeks: male > 1.2 kg, female: >1 kg Hatching behavior decreased, henday production increased to 38-40% Pelung Ulu sound is not typical like a Pelung chicken Uniform: Body weight males uniform with coefficient of variation under 10%. Stability: Since the third and fourth generation, body weight at 12 weeks until ready for propagation has shown the results of a certain age body weight that doesn’t change.
Color comments: Feather colour males for base colour black with red yellowish brown cover, and base colour glossy greenish black with yellowish white cover Feather colour females in general black and red Columbian, some for black or dark yellow Shank colour for greenish black, grayish black, yellow, or white Comb colour for red (single)
Description of origin: Body weight in 12 weeks: male > 1.2 kg, female: >1 kg Hatching behavior decreased, henday production increased to 38-40% Pelung Ulu sound is not typical like a Pelung chicken

Description: Sembawa Chicken is one of the potential chickens to be quality sources of local laying hens
Additional information: New : Never been sold just recently distributed in 2015 for multi-location test Unique : The egg production of sembawa is 22% higher on production egg than the arab chicken. Uniform : 1. egg production variability less than 15% 2. Shank colour is greyish black 3. Sembawa chicken has black barred with silver colour Stability: The egg production of sembawa chicken at multi-location test is similar to egg production in the station of National Breeding & Forage Centre Sembawa (BPTU HPT Sembawa)
Adaptability to specific environment: The sembawa chicken is well adopted in tropical climate of Indonesia
Color comments: Feather colour is black barred white Shank colour is blackish gray Comb colour is red (single)
Description of origin: As a result on selection process, have 22% higher on production egg than the arab chicken. The variety of eggs production below 15%
Location within country: National Breeding & Forage Centre Sembawa (BPTU HPT Sembawa)

Additional information: Produce Superior Female Stock breed for meat chicken with FCR for about 2.5 – 3.0 Hatchability 67.93 ± 22.33 %
Special characteristic of product: Rapid growth, less fat meat
Color comments: Feather colour for gray, black spotted white Shank colour for dark (green, gray and black), yellow and white. Beak colour for blackish, yellow and white
Description of origin: Selection result based on 25% highest body weight on male chicken at 10 weeks of age for 6 generations

Description: Sentul is the name is derived from the name Sentul lute pieces that have gray yellowish.
Adaptability to specific environment: Tropical environment
Special characteristic of product: Dual function chicken for meat and eggs
Color comments: Characteristic of the dominant feather color is gray with black hairs side. Other feather color is yellowish orange, like the color or the fruit rind harp Sentul. In males there is also red with a little white. Flickering feathers are dominated by silver and gold colors. For females beak has four colors (black, gray, white, gray and white), whereas for males there are only two colors (white, black), with the white one is dominant. Tail feathers are a mixture of gray, red, black, and white. Beak has varies color start from yellow, white, black and white. Skin color are all 100% white, while color is color claw claw white, black, and yellow. Variations in the color of the beak, legs scales, feather color is caused by genetic factors and other factors.
Description of origin: This local chicken breed originated from red jungle chicken and adapted long times in Ciamis Region, West Java.
Location within country: Ciamis and spread in several districts in West Java.

Description: Most development is located in the Upper North River District, the District Alabio, south kalimantan.
Additional information: The breed is used mostly for egg production
Additional information comments: The breed found mainly in swamp and river areas

Color comments: Males havedominant feather colors: over the head for brown spots, brown with white spots and white; neck for brown, blackish gray andgrayish white; back for blackish gray & brown; chest for brown &andgrayish white; wings for brown &shiny bluish green; tail for black. Fluorescent feathers are silver &shiny bluish green. Feather pattern plain and black. Beak, feet and shank is light ivory yellow to dark. Females have dominant colors: over the head for black, white, black & white; neck for grayish brown and grayish white; back for brown and grayish brown; chest for grayish brown and brown; wings for grayish brown and grayish white; and tail for grayish brown.

Description: a cross between java and locally duck in the Bayang South Coastal District of West Sumatera Province

Description of origin: The breed is originated from crossing beetwen local duck breed at Bayang sub distcrict, South pesisir district, west sumatera

Description: Kerinci is the name of the District where this local duck breed naturraly adapted.
Description Of Specific Uses: Averaging egg production period: 10 mo., eggproduction 180 eggs / year., age at peak production 26 week., duck day production 60.16%.
Additional information: Male posture: upright with an angle of 70-80 degrees. Female posture: leaning forward at an angle of 40-45 degrees.
Adaptability to specific environment: ability to adapt well to the limitations environment
Specific reproductive characteristic: Age of maturity: 141-164 days
Color comments: Females have a white base color with light brown spots on the chest area to the end of the tail with dark colored wings. Males, in addition to the basic colors of white, are also dominated by brown color, especially on neck, chest, and back. The end of the tail has a mixed color of brown and black or dark blue. Legs and beak tend to be dark or black. In males, there is a foot membrane with a little orange or bright color.
Description of origin: This local duck breed is descended from Indian Runner ducks that were evolved for a long time in Koto Majidin Village, Wair Hangat Subdistrict, Kerinci Regency, West Sumatera.
Location within country: Kerinci district, Jambi Province and In almost all districts in West Sumatera.

Description of origin: Crossbred between the Indian Runner and the Miscopy ducks.

Description: Mojosari duck is allegedly derived from the original Indonesian ducklings (Anas Java) and wild ducks/mallards that have been hereditary for generations by the people of Modopuro village, Mojokari Sub-district, Mojokerto

Description: Peking duck x white Mojosari duck

Description: originated from Tanah Datar, precisely in the area Pitalah

Females have dominantly striped straw color pattern, which is a striated pattern between dark brown / black with a light brown, or otherwise light brown with striated dark brown / black. Sometimes there is a circular white feathers on the neck.
Description of origin: This local duck breed came from Pitalah Batipuh Nagari area, Tanah Datar District, West Sumatera.
Location within country: Mainly Tanah Datar, then spread to Agam, Bukittinggi, 50 Cities, Payakumbuh, Jambi, as well as upland areas in Sumatera.

Description: Rambon duck is originated from West Java, inherited from Syech Syarif Hidayatullah, islamic leader of Sunan Gunungjati as the media for islamic religion around 14 th century.
Description Of Specific Uses: This duck is used as single purpose as egg producer.
Additional information: Rambon duck has special character as excellent feed converter (average of 4,0) ; average egg production of 256 eggs/year with average weight of 56 grams/egg , first age of laying is 25 weeks with production rate of 75%/year.
Additional information comments: Male Rambon duck is usually used as meat type, where at 4 months of age can reach 1,5 kg.
Description of origin: Rambon duck possibly originated from the crossing between Tegal and Magelang ducks.
Comments managment conditions: Male Rambon duck is usually used as meat type, where at 4 months of age can reach 1,5 kg.

Managment conditions performance measure: Goats were kept indoor and sometimes grazed at natural pasture

Description: Peranakan means "crossbreed"
Additional information: Dual purpose breed (milk and meat)
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is well adapted to cool as well as to hot climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This goat breed is susceptible for bloat.

Special characteristic of product: The PE goat-meat is tasty and preferably used for barbecue and soup a la Jakarta.

Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is better adapted to the cooler highlands.

Description: Saburai goat originated from Lampung province
Additional information: Classified as big type of goat
Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptive to tropical environment
Description of origin: Grading up local Etawah Grade females to Boer males followed inter se mating, developed in the Districts of Tanggamus, and Pesawaran Bandar Lampung, Lampung Province.

Description: Goats are similar to Ettawa and used as meat and milk production
Additional information: Average milk production 1,7 l/day,
Additional information comments: Goats were kept indoor and feed resources from legumes tree

Description of origin: This local goat breed kept by farmers of Lumajang East Java over generation from Ettawa cross
Import: Could be ancestor from Jamnapari goats of India
Location within country: Mainly in Lumajang subdistrcit then distributed to other district such as Malang, Jember
Managment conditions performance measure: Animals were kept intensively and fed using legume or grasses , does were bred naturally, weaning were conducted at around 4 months oled
Comments managment conditions: The intensive management is prefereed by farmers for easy handling

Specific reproductive characteristic: This pony breed shows good reproductive characteristics.
Special characteristic of product: Having strong power as working animal, and a kind of tough racing horse
Other special qualities: Tender and juicy meat source for spesific consumers (horse meat consumers)
Color comments: uni coloured: variable, dominantly brown
Description of origin: part of the Southeast Asia Pony group

Color comments: uni coloured: light to dark brown
Description of origin: part of the Southeast Asia Pony group: kuda-Kuningan is a composite of Mongolian, China and Southeast Asia pony. In the 7th century the first Mongolian horses were brought to Java as a gift from the king of the Kwan dynasty to the King in Java. In the 13th century, the Juan cavalry brought the Chinese horses to Java.

Color comments: uni coloured: mainly brown
Description of origin: composite of Sandlewood and Thoroughbred

Description: Sandelwood is the name of sandalwood (Santalum album), which formerly had been a leading commodities and exported from Sumba and other islands to the Asian country.
Other name: Sandalwood Pony, Sandelhoutpaard, Soemba, Sumbanese, Sumba
Color comments: Various color: black, white, red, brownish
Description of origin: This breed belong to the Southeast Asia Pony group. The breed was derived from crossing indigenous breed Southeast Asia ponies with Arab horses brought from Australia to Sumba.
Location within country: In Some Districts of East Sumba, West Sumba, Central Sumba and West Sumba, East Nusa Tenggara Province.
Comments managment conditions: These horses are kept in well build stables.

Color comments: multi coloured: mainly brown
Description of origin: composite of Sandel and Thoroughbred since 1918: intensive breeding programme since 1974

Adaptability to specific environment: Tolerance to arid and dry environment
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to local diseases
Special characteristic of product: Multi function horse, as : racing horse, producing meat milk and oil, workhorse and tourist attraction
Color comments: Reddish brown, mocca, chocolate, yellow, albino
Description of origin: This local hourse breed is predicted from Arabic horse as its anchestor ors(Prior to 1512), then grows by generations in Sumbawa District , West Nusa Tenggara Province.
Location within country: Specially in some districts of West Nusa Tenggara, further spread acroos some regions in Java, Sumatera and Sumba Islands.

Color comments: multi coloured: mainly brown
Description of origin: imported from Australia, Europe and USA
Location within country: Jakarta, west, central and east Java, Jogyakarta, west Sumatra, north, central and south Sulawesi. west and east Nusatenggara
Comments managment conditions: Animals of this breed recieve highly intensive care.

Description: Composite of Sandel and Thoroughbred (F3, F4)
Color comments: uni coloured: mainly brown, also whitish-brown and greyish-brown
Description of origin: composite of Sandel and Thoroughbred (F3, F4)
Location within country: Jakarta, west, central and east Java, Yogyakarta, west Sumatra, north, central and south Sulawesi, West and East Nusa Tenggara

Color comments: multi coloured: red and grey striped
Description of origin: indigenous breed pig breed

Color comments: multi coloured: black with white saddle
Description of origin: imported

Description: Rex Rabbit x Satin Rabbit (50 : 50)
Description of origin: The Reza Agrinak rabbit has smooth and shiny fur skin compared to local rabbit breeds in Indonesia
Managment conditions performance measure: intensive management system
Comments managment conditions: Rabbits receive concentrate and forages according to physiological state

Description: Name of Batur Subdistrict the place this breed sheep came from.
Additional information: The sheep are used for meat production , and wool is utilized as handicraft
Additional information comments: Medium wool quality
Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptive to high elevation area
Specific reproductive characteristic: Medium prolificacy
Special characteristic of product: As a crossing with merino, wool are in medium quality
Color comments: Dominant color of the body is milky white
Horn shape size and comments: Hornless
Description of origin: Crossbreed between Merino ram and local thin tail females and adapted in Dieng Plateau, Batur Subdistrict, Banjarnegara District, Central Java Province.
Import: Merino rams were imported from Australia
Location within country: Mainly in Batur, Wanayasa, Pejawaran and Pangetanthe Sub Districts in Banjarnegara District.
Managment conditions performance measure: Intensive management systems under traditional farming
Comments managment conditions: Sheep are kept intensively in areas of horticulture
Additional performance parameters: Tail are thin and long, sharp at the end

Description: Cross breed of 50% Lokal Sumatera sheep, 25% St. Croix sheep and 25% Barbados Blackbelly sheep
Additional information: Cross breed of 50% Local Sumatera sheep, 25% St. Croix sheep and 25% Barbados Blackbelly sheep
Adaptability to specific environment: High adaptability to tropical environment and semi intensive to intensive management
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistans to internal parasites
Specific reproductive characteristic: Moderate prolificacy
Color comments: Dominantly are white
Description of origin: New breed of sheep from breeding research
Import: St croix and barbados sheep are imported from US
Managment conditions performance measure: intensive to intensive management
Comments managment conditions: The breed was aimed to be develop at plantation areas
Additional performance parameters: Hornless sheep

Description: Ekor Tipis sheep means fat tailed sheep
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is especially adapted to tropical climate and poor feeding conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This sheep breed is quite small and prolific. Unrestricted breeding season and high prolificy. They can produce 3 (three) lamb crops every two years.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually white, sometimes brownish black, often black around eyes and nose
Horn shape size and comments: males: closely curled small horns
Description of origin: indigenous breed Java thin tailed sheep breed

Description: Garut is the name of the district in the province of West Java, Indonesia
Description Of Specific Uses: Developed as hobby, well known as fighting (agile) sheep.
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is adapted to tropical humid climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It has been suggested that the domba-Garut is more resistant to worms as well as to the ""old world screw worm fly"", but there is insufficient scientific evidence for these conclusions
Specific reproductive characteristic: This sheep breed is known for its prolificity.
Special characteristic of product: The fleece varies from broad unattractive wool to a type more like hair or kemp than wool. White animals are preferred for meat and black animals are preferred for fighting.
Color comments:
multi coloured: various colours, mostly white but with brown or black patches
comment: males often have a tuft of straight hair about 15 cm on the throat
Horn shape size and comments: big and spiral shaped horn
Description of origin: "composite of Javanese Thin Tailed, Merino and Kaapstad sheep
Location within country: This animals specifically located in Garut District, and spread to West Java, Banten, Jakarta, Central Java, Yogyakarta, East Java, and some other provinces outof Java. Even at a small amount spread to Malaysia and PNG.
Performance data reference: F17-68, 96 Asian Livestock, vol. XVIII, No 12, December 1993.

Description: Kisar is a small island in the Southwestern Maluku, Indonesia
Additional information: Small size breed
Additional information comments: Used mainly as meat producer
Adaptability to specific environment: Resistant to low feed quality and extreme climate
Specific resistance or tolerance: High resistance to local disease and parasites
Specific reproductive characteristic: Prolific sheep
Color comments: 4 Colour Comment Body is dominated by black and white color (white dominant), plain white hairs, a mixture of black and white (predominantly black), a mixture of black, brown and white, brown and black and white mix plain black. Ears generally follow body color. Existing distinctive featurefor having a black color on the face with black turning the eyes.
Horn shape size and comments: Horns are only found for males with a circular shape, similar to Garut sheep horn, but in a smaller size. In a very small, hornsare only lumps.
Location within country: Mainly found in Kisar island and spread around Southwest Maluku District and surrounding small islands
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Managment conditions performance measure: Data were collected at farm level in dry reas of kisar island
Comments managment conditions: Sheep are well adapted to dry area with relatively low productivity

Description: Palu sheep originated from Central Sulawesi known as Domba Ekor Gemuk (fat tail sheep) and developed in Palu region.
Additional information: Tail size is moderate as a reflection of fat tail sheep
Additional information comments: Small ears, sharp at the end
Adaptability to specific environment: Adaptation in Palu valley with hot climate
Specific resistance or tolerance: Hot and dry climate
Specific reproductive characteristic: - First sexual maturity at 6 – 8 month of age (female) - First mating at 10 -12 month of age
Special characteristic of product: #NAME?
Color comments: Combination of black, white and chocolate
Horn shape size and comments: #NAME?
Description of origin: Selection by farmers in Palu District
Location within country: Palu District, South East Sulawesi Province

Description: Developed by communities in the province of West Java
Additional information: Medium size of tail, a reflection crossing between fat and thin tail sheep
Special characteristic of product: Tail are considered to be medium size
Color comments: Dominant hair colour : white, varied with black, brown, and combined with black-white stripped
Horn shape size and comments: Circular horn named by region Leang, Gayor dan Ngabendo
Description of origin: Crossing Merino, Local and Kaapstat sheep and adapted for generation in West Java.
Import: Merino and Kaapstat sheep were introduced to Indonesia around 1900
Location within country: Local sheep breed for meat which were raised in most district or sub – district of West Java Province

Description: Sapudi is the name of Sapudi Island in East Java Province.
Other name: Fat-Tailed, Ekor Gemuk, Madura sheep, DEG
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is well adapted to arid tropical climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is susceptible to timpanitis and scab (located mainly in the ears).
Specific reproductive characteristic: The breed is known for its reproductive ability.
Special characteristic of product: The meat of this sheep breed is very fatty.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Description of origin: descended from a fat-tailed breed of South-west Asia (e.g. Baluchi), This local fat tail sheep breed has been adapted by generations in Sapudi Island. This sheep is predicted from West Asia brought by Gujarat (Persian) merchants in the coastal areas of North East Java and Madura.
Location within country: Sapudi Island and spread on Madura Isaland and around small islands, as well as Northern coastal areas of East Java Province.
Managment conditions performance measure: Data on liveweight, prolificacy, post-lambing reproduction, lamb survival have been recorded of a group of selected Javanese fat- tailed sheep kept at the Garhan- Sheep Breeding Unit of the provincial Livestock Services of East Java in Jember.
Comments managment conditions: Sheep were kept at barn and sometimes grazed during day time and return in the afternoon

Description: developed by communities in the province of Central Java Wonosobo district.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to high elevation of Dieng plateau
Color comments: dominant color of the body is white, black spotty to face
Description of origin: Derived from crosses with the Texel sheep and tail thin sheep or tail fat sheep
Location within country: Wonosobo district the province of Central Java

Description: INDIA_DONKEY_0400_HALARI_05002
Description Of Specific Uses: • Bharwad & Rabari Pastorals mainly use this donkey as pack animal to carry luggage during migration with small ruminants. • Kumbhar (potter) community also use this animal for pottery work in Dwarika, Jamnagar region. • Halari Donkey also used as pack/ donkey cart to lift mud & bricks in brickmaking factory (Int Bhatto). • Bharwad Pastoralist maintains Halari donkey herd with few elite Jack and breed them & sell young foals and surplus donkey in Vautha donkey fair, an annual donkey fair organized in Vautha village of Dholka Taluka of Ahmedabad District. Buyers come from different regions of Gujarat and other states to buy Halari donkey to use this animal in construction work.
Additional information: Halari donkey breeders usually keep few female and one or two breeding male/Jack and breed them selectively. Jack are very carefully selected on the basis of physical characters like Pure white coat, excellent height, body length with well-built body size and good scrotal circumference are selected for breeding and raised. Purity of the breed is maintained by the breeder through selective breeding and avoiding crossing other local non-descript donkey breed as far as possible. Through selective breeding they produce good Halari donkey which they sell to local donkey traders or in Vautha Donkey fair earning good price.
Other special qualities: Docile temperament
Color comments: Coat colour -White
Location within country: Jamnagar, Devbhumi Dwarika districts of Guajarat
Additional performance parameters: • Average Load carrying capacity (kg) : 147.95+2.41kg • Average work duration/day (hrs.) : 4.63+ 0.16 Hrs. • Average Distance covered (km) : 11.47+0.39 km

Description: INDIA_DONKEY_0400_KACHCHHI_05003
Description Of Specific Uses: Utility of Kachchhi donkey varies from area to area and from community to community; • Muslim Sama of Khavda (Pachham) use for Agriculture purpose like inters cultivation for weed removing, especially during the Monsoon season & Patel community farmer of Nakhatrana taluka uses mostly Kachchhi donkey for inter cultivation specially in groundnuts crop field • Muslim Sindhi pastoralist of Banni area uses the donkey with cart for transportation of woods for coal making, fodder, water etc. especially during the Winter & Summer season as well as selling of foal. • Kumbhar (potter) uses donkey for lifting mud, pottery material as well as for lifting raw material for construction of check dams, ponds etc as well as selling of foal • Hindu Koli, Vagher and fisherman communites in Abdasa, Anjar & Mundra taluka uses donkey with cart for wood transportation for Coal making & fish transportation near coastal area. • Hindu Bharwad/ Rabari, Sheep & Goat breeder of Rapar taluka uses it as pack animal during migration, post monsoon season.
Additional information: 4. Very Docile in temperament Excellent adaptability to both Extensive & Intensive system of rearing & management Good in load carrying capacity, lifts approx. 80-100 Kg on back and 200-300 Kg on cart.
Adaptability to specific environment: 1. Excellent drought & heat tolerance capacity in arid & semi-arid region viz. “Kachchh”.
Other special qualities: Only donkey breed used for Agricultural activities like Inter culturing in field crops, particularly in Pachchham area of Bhuj taluka and Nakhatrana taluka of Kachchh district in monsoon season. Very Docile in temperament
Color comments: Grey (dorsal surface grey & ventral surface white), White, Brown and Black coat colour, Dorsal & Shoulder stripes (Black stripe/line on the back & shoulders) and Zebra marking in few animals.
Description of origin: Kachchh district of Gujarat

Description: INDIA_DONKEY_0600_SPITI_05001
Description Of Specific Uses: The Spiti donkeys are able to carry upto 100kg of load in high altitude mountainous area with thin atmosphere having lesser oxygen. Usually, they are very calm, easy to handle and are rarely bad-tempered.
Additional information: 3. Head General description The face is also covered with long hairs like rest of the body. The head is comparatively broader and shorter Ears straight, either completely erect or with slightly lateral orientation Eyes brown or dark brown Back Straight
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to alpine climatic conditions, low oxygen and temperature.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Cold tolerance
Specific reproductive characteristic: Male and female both mature at same age.
Color comments: 1. Coat colour Mainly brown, also brown-black and black 2. Head marking Major white markings mostly around muzzle and sometimes around eyes
Description of origin: Spiti

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_0400_BANNI_01011 Reared in Banni grassland of Kachchh region of Gujarat
Description Of Specific Uses: Used mainly milk production.
Additional information: 1. Colour a. Coat colour Mainly Black, sometimes Copper b. Muzzle Black in majority animals and  Brown in copper colour animals  c. Eyelids Black and Brown also  d. Tail Switch White or Black  f. Hoof Generally Black and Brown   2. Horns a. Colour Generally black-gray and gray in both the sexes b. Size Medium to large, heavy with 24 to 30 cm diameter in adult animals c. Shape (Straight/curved) Curved d. Orientation Vertical. Inverted double coiling (31.20%), inverted single coiling (68.80%) 3. Ears  a. Length (cm) 29.30 ± 0.08 b. Orientation Horizontal in majority animals  (Horizontal/drooping) 4. Head  a. Forehead Broad and convex, White spot in some animals  (Convex/concave/straight) b. Face Length (cm) 53.66 ± 0.16 5. Body a. Hump (Large/medium/small) Medium to large  b. Dewlap (Large/medium/small) Nil c. Naval flap (Large/medium/small) Medium  d. Penis sheath flap Medium  (Large/medium/small) e. Tail Length (cm) 88.39 ± 0.48
Additional information comments: Well adapted to Marshy region.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to local climatic conditions and traditional extensive production system of night grazing in Banni grassland Drought tolerance-Excellent (during summer water provided only
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to drought and arid climatic condition
Specific reproductive characteristic: Not known
Special characteristic of product: Not known
Other special qualities: Heat tolerance Excellent
Color comments: Coat col: Mainly Black, sometimes Copper Muzzle Black in majority animals and  Brown in copper colour animals  c. Eyelids Black and Brown also  d. Tail Switch White or Black  f. Hoof Generally Black and Brown
Horn shape size and comments: Vertical, and upward in direction with inverted double/single coiling. Size medium to large, heavy with 24 to 30 cm circumference in adult animals
Description of origin: Maldharis of banni came from Halieb in Afganishtan about 500 years ago with their animals in search of pasture
Managment conditions performance measure: Buffaloes in Banni area maintained under extensive production system and animals grazed during night in Banni grassland. In other part of Kachchh and Gujarat state semi-intensive production system adopted by the livestock keepers. Supplementary feeding provided to lactating/advance pregnant animals
Comments managment conditions: Semi intensive and extensive system
Additional performance parameters: Service period (mo) 2.39 ±0.05

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_1800_BARGUR_01015
Description Of Specific Uses: Milk, mostly for household consumption
Additional information: Horns  a. Colour Grey  b. Size (cm) Medium in males and Medium to long in females  c. Shape (Straight/Curved) Curved  d. Orientation Backward and inward
Additional information comments: Medium sized animal.
Adaptability to specific environment: Drought Tolerance Excellent, Heat Tolerance Excellent
Specific resistance or tolerance: Not specific to any disease
Specific reproductive characteristic: Not known
Special characteristic of product: Not known
Other special qualities: Not known
Color comments: a. Coat Brownish black and brown b. Muzzle Black  c. Eyelids Black  d. Tail Switch Brownish black  e. Hooves Grey
Horn shape size and comments: Horns  a. Colour Grey  b. Size (cm) Medium in males and Medium to long in females  c. Shape (Straight/Curved) Curved  d. Orientation Backward and inward
Description of origin: Named after its distribution area in Bargur hills of Tamil Nadu in Anthiyoor taluk, Erode district. Malai - means hills; Erumai/Emmai- means buffalo.
Location within country: Erode (Hamlets of Bargur village A & B of Anthiyoor taluk, and Gundri & Kadamboor village of Sathyamangalam taluk) of Tamil Nadu

Description: Registered breed. Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_2010_BHADAWARI_01003 Bhadawari buffalo is known for high milk fat content.
Description Of Specific Uses: This breed is famous for high butter fat
Special characteristic of product: high butter fat content
Color comments: uni coloured: copper-coloured with pale legs
Horn shape size and comments: horns curve outward, downward, backward parallel and close to neck and finally upwards.
Location within country: Agra and Etawah districts of Uttar Pradesh, and Bhind Morena districts of Madhya Pradesh
Performance data reference: FAO Breed Survey published literature from 1980 onwards F66-58 N4-41, 42
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured under farm conditions with grazing and fodder or concentrates.

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_2600_CHHATTISGARHI_01016
Description Of Specific Uses: Work for agriculture.
Additional information: Chhattisgarhi are riverine type buffalo with chromosome number (2N = 50). Chhattisgarhi buffalo bullocks are preferred over cow bullocks for ploughing the rice fields (especially during monsoon).
Additional information comments: Chhattisgarhi buffaloes are maintained on extensive system of management called Bathaan system of housing. It is a semi-migratory system of management of buffaloes where buffaloes are taken to nearby forest/hillocks/free grazing land. Herds of related farmers are pooled and housed in a temporary wooden enclosure to save cost of management and labour.
Adaptability to specific environment: Drought tolerance is very good, heat tolerance is excellent. Studies based on relative gene expression of heat shock proteins viz. HSP 60, HSP 70 and HSP 90 in Chhattisgarhi buffalo have shown that they are better heat tolerant buffaloes.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Not specifically
Specific reproductive characteristic: Not known
Special characteristic of product: ‘Peda’ made from the milk of these buffaloes is a famous milk product in the region.
Other special qualities: Buffalo keepers of Chhattisgarh prefer Chhattisgarhi buffalo bullocks for ploughing rice fields and other agricultrual operations.
Color comments: Mostly Black, sometimes grey coat colour
Description of origin: Chhattisgarh state
Location within country: Kawardha/Kabirdham, Mungeli, Bilaspur, Korba, Sarguja, Balrampur, Jashpur, Mahasamund, Bemetara, Raipur, Baloda Bazar, Dhamtari and Kanker of Chhattisgarh
Managment conditions performance measure: Field condition
Comments managment conditions: Extensive and semi intensive system
Additional performance parameters: Service period 8-13 months

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_1500_CHILIKA_01012
Description Of Specific Uses: The milk and curd of these buffaloes have better taste and preservation quality, and is preferred by local people. The curd from milk of Chilika buffalo can be preserved for 5-7 days at room temperature.
Additional information: 1. Colour  a. Coat colour Brownish black or Black b. Muzzle Black  d. Eyelids Black  e. Tail Mainly Black sometimes Grey  f. Hoofs Black 2. Horns a. Colour Black  b. Size (cm) Male: 48.32±0.24, Female: 50.76±0.12 c. Shape (Straight/curved) Curved  d. Orientation Upward, inward 3. Ears a. Length (cm) 23 b. Orientation Horizontal 4. Head a. Forehead Straight b. General description Head is in upright position and medium in size. 5. Body a. Hump Small b. Dewlap Small  c. Naval flap Small  d. Penis sheath flap Medium 6. Udder a. Shape Bowl/Round  b. Udder size Small  c. Teat shape Cylindrical d. Teat tip Round  e. Milk vein Small
Additional information comments: Basic temperament of the breed Moderate
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to saline conditions. Drought tolerance Excellent. Heat tolerance Good.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Not specific to any disease
Specific reproductive characteristic: Not known
Special characteristic of product: The milk and curd of these buffaloes have better taste and preservation quality, and is preferred by local people.
Other special qualities: The curd from milk of Chilika buffalo can be preserved for 5-7 days at room temperature.
Reference for special qualities: Breed descriptor Sethi B.P., Dash S.K. and Ray P.C. 2007. Buffalo Genetic Resources of Orissa – Chilika. Orissa Livestock Resources Development Society (OLRDS) and Chilika Buffaloes Promoters’ Society (OUAT), Bhubaneswar.
Color comments: Brownish black or Black
Horn shape size and comments: Curved - Upward and inward. Size - Male: 48.32±0.24, Female: 50.76±0.12cm
Description of origin: Name of breed backs to the native tract, which is surrounding the Chilika lake in Orissa.
Location within country: Bhusandapur, Tangi, Parikuda, Maluda, Krishnaprasad, Brahmagiri and Satapada area surrounding Chilika lake in Orissa
Performance data reference: Sethi B.P., Dash S.K. and Ray P.C. 2007. Buffalo Genetic Resources of Orissa – Chilika. Orissa Livestock Resources Development Society (OLRDS) and Chilika Buffaloes Promoters’ Society (OUAT), Bhubaneswar
Managment conditions performance measure: Field/Farm conditions
Comments managment conditions: Semi-intensive and extensive system
Additional performance parameters: Ostrus cycle duration (days) 21

Description: INDIA_BUFFALO_0800_DHARWADI_01018
Description of origin: Northern Karnataka
Feeding of adults: agro-industrial by-products, concentrate, farm-household by-products, fodder, grazing

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_1606_GOJRI_01017
Description Of Specific Uses: Good milking capacity
Additional information: Gojri buffalo has a medium built proportionate body with thick skin. Horns are heavy medium sized with curved orientation which moves backwards and then towards front to complete the loop.
Additional information comments: Well adapted to foothills and hilly terrains
Adaptability to specific environment: Good drought tolerance, Very good heat tolerance
Specific resistance or tolerance: Not for any specific disease
Specific reproductive characteristic: Not known
Special characteristic of product: Milk is used for various products
Other special qualities: Animals are maintained on grazing with very low input system on routine basis, however very little additional supplement / concentrate is given to these animals. Gojri buffalo play a significant role in the livelihood of the Gujjar’s in the region.
Color comments: Colour a. Coat Brown or black b. Muzzle Black  c. Eyelids Black  d. Tail Switch Mostly brown or grey, sometimes black  e. Hooves Black
Horn shape size and comments: Horns  a. Colour Black  b. Size (cm) Male: 35.75±1.32; Female: 44.61±0.61  c. Shape (Straight/Curved) Curved  d. Orientation Moves backwards and then upwards towards front to complete a big loop
Description of origin: Himalayan foot hills
Location within country: Punjab: Pathankot, Gurdaspur, Hoshiarpur, Rupnagar and SAS Nagar (Mohali) Himachal Pradesh: Kangra and Chamba
Managment conditions performance measure: Field condition
Comments managment conditions: Semi intensive and extensive systems
Additional performance parameters: Animals are maintained on grazing with very low input system on routine basis, however very little additional supplement / concentrate is given to these animals.

Description: Registered breed. Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_0400_JAFFARABADI_01006 Jaffabadi is the heaviest of all the Indian breeds of Buffaloes. Horn shape is peculiar of this breed. Horns usually emerge out by compressing the head and form a ring like structure. It makes eyes to look small - termed as study eye, especially in males.
Color comments: uni coloured: black
Horn shape size and comments: large drooping horns compressing the head

Description: Registered breed, Accession No. INDIA_BUFFALO_0212_LUIT_01014
Description Of Specific Uses: Work efficiently in marshy land.
Additional information: The diploid no. of chromosome (2N) in Swamp buffaloes of Assam is 48, out of which 23 pairs are autosomes and one pair is sex chromosome. The 4th pair of metacentric chromosome of swamp buffalo resulted from the tandem fusion of chromosome no.4 and 9 of riverine buffalo.
Additional information comments: First swamp buffalo of India
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to hot humid climate of North East region of India Drought and heat tolerance is excellent
