Color comments: Elongated white ear lobes
Efabis main colour: Body is feathered with black colour. Tail feathers of roosters seem green-black colour under the light. Shanks, toe skin and scales are light or deep gray, not feathered.
Description of origin: It is assumed that this breed has similarietes with the French breed La Flèche.
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011).
Additional performance parameters: Avarega birth weight both male and female is 37g

Description: Breed names comes from Angora which was old name of Ankara being current capital city of Turkey.
Other name: Ankara Kecisi, Mohair goat, Tiftik-Kecisi, Angora Goat
Description Of Specific Uses: This breed produces mohair as a specific product.
Additional information: 2010: Angora goat account for 2.8% of the total goat population. This breed is at risk.
Efabis cultural role comment: Breding is descended from father to soon. It is done competitions and festivals for the most beautiful kid, does and buck among goat breeders. It is located in among the symbolic values of Ankara province. The capital city of Turkey is Ankara whose name comes from Angora. It was used nutrition and dressing for soldiers during the war.
Adaptability to specific environment: It has high adaptability to arid climate adverse enviromental conditions. It has low adaptation in more humid and rainy environments.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to sudden fodder changes.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average lambing rate is 85%. Twinnig rate is 5-24%
Special characteristic of product: Mohair is an important raw material for textile ındustry because of its strength, elasticity, fine structure, absorbency and dyeability. Mohair (Textile fabric industry; Sweaters, blankets etc.) and pelt
Other special qualities: It is a slow growing breed. Maternal instinct is very well. It is seen that some goats close to parturition take care of kids of other goats. It has an ability to walk long distances. Management is easy.
Reference for special qualities: 1. Breed Registration List, the TR Official Gazette (2004). 2. Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Efabis environmental role: It plays a important role by grazing on cultivated lands after harvest and grassland
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has no need for special keeping and feeding. It is raised in simple, partly or completely covered sheepfolds in winter and in exposed areas on the other seasons. Furthermore, it can also be raised on rugged and rocky lands.
Color comments: Rarely coloured animals can be seen as cream, yellow, silver-gray, brown or black
Horn shape size and comments: Both does and bucks are horned. In bucks, horns are long, strong, screw shaped and turned slightly backward, and does horns are weaker and shorter and extend towards posterior.
Description of origin: İndigenous breed
Location within country: Primamily in the province of Ankara, Central Anatolia and in some parts of Southeast and East Anatolian regions
Performance data reference: Angora Goat Registration Data Sheet, which is apperared in the Gazette in 2004. The Catalogue named Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources ın Turkey in 2011.
Managment conditions performance measure: Extensive
Comments managment conditions: The animals endure feed shortages during the winter period.

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals survive in a very arid desert region with sparse vegetation.
Horn shape size and comments: scimitar (or sabre) shaped horns with sharp anterior edge
Description of origin: Capra aegagrus

Description Of Specific Uses: The breeds skin is used for specific cheese called 'tulum chese'.
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to lowlands.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to hot climate and arid areas
Color comments:
unicoloured: usually red or brown, also grey
multi coloured: also pied
Efabis main colour: Black, brown, cinnamon to gray and mixed colour
Description of origin: Syria
Location within country: Kilis, Hatay, Gaziantep, Adana, Kahramanmaraş and Şanlıurfa provinces

Description: The Honamli means a nomad of Turkish
Adaptability to specific environment: Good
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to harsh environmental conditions and infectious diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the Autumn. The birth rate is 92.8%. Litter size is 1.35. Survival ability rate of kids up to weaning is 97.2%.
Other special qualities: It is a breed that can be bred on pastures for whole year
Efabis genetic features: Close to the Hair Goat
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to the mountainous and hilly areas and cold and snowy conditions.
Color comments: There are brown or white stains come down to the mouth on two sides of the black goats’ face and prevalently colour gets light at the end of legs and around the rear side of udder.
Efabis main colour: Different colours from black to brown
Horn shape size and comments: Generally, both males and females are horned. Males have stronger horns than the females. Horns are bow shaped curling around ears.
Description of origin: Indigenous breed
Location within country: The Taurus Mountains in the Mediterranean Region
Performance data reference: 1. Özkan ELMAZ, Mustafa SAATCI, Nuri MAMAK, Birol DAĞ, Ahmet Hamdi AKTAŞ, Bekir GÖK: Türkiye’de yeni bir ırk olarak tanımlanan Honamlı keçi ve oğlaklarının bazı morfolojik özelliklerinin belirlenmesi. Kafkas Univ. Vet. Fak. Derg., 18 (3): 481-485, 2012. 2. Özkan ELMAZ, Mustafa SAATCI, Birol DAĞ, Ahmet Hamdi AKTAŞ, Ayhan ATA, Mehmet Şükrü GÜLAY, Nuri MAMAK, Bekir GÖK: Some descriptive characteristics of a new goat breed called Honamlı in Turkey, Tropical Animal Health and Production, DOI: 10.1007/s11250-012-0156-7, 2012.

Description: The breed is named after Kaçkar Mountains.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is well adapted to high altitutes, rugged areas and snowy regions.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to mountainous areas and harsh climate conditions.
Color comments: Head and leg can be brown
Efabis main colour: The wool colour varies from black to light brown and occasionally mottled.
Horn shape size and comments: Both rams and ewes are polled
Description of origin: Indigenous
Location within country: North-eastern Anatolia. Artvin, Rize, Trabzon and Giresun provinces

Additional information: It is able to walk long distances on rugged lands.
Additional information comments: Breeding is around gardens as family-herds of 2-10 goats or as commercial herds of 20-200 goats. It is shepherded to the provinces of Osmaniye, Adana and Mersin for grazing.
Special characteristic of product: Its milk is preferred especially by Kahramanmaraş ice-cream producers.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has resistance to hot and cold weathers and infectious diseases.
Efabis main colour: Although its usual colour is black, also the chestnut, red-brown, gray and local white stains may be seen. While on someone heads, ears and body are in same colour, someone may be found with gray or brown big stains.
Horn shape size and comments: Some of them may be horned. Bucks’ horns are thick, strong and long. Does’ horns are short, slim and turned backward.
Description of origin: composite of Damascus goats and Hair goats
Location within country: Provinces of Kilis, Gaziantep, Hatay, Adıyaman, Adana, Maraş provinces, South East Anatolia and Mediterranean region.

Description: The meaning of Kil is hair
Other name: Adi Keci, Anatolian Black, Davar, Kara Keci, Kil Kecisi, Turkish Native, Hair Goat
Description Of Specific Uses: Maraş ice-cream comes from Kil Goat milk.
Additional information: In some regions, called Pavga types of goats are rather small in some areas as found in the so-called moderate form Çandır, Kabakulak, or Davar, called in some places found in many types of stout.
Efabis cultural role comment: Hair of Kil Goat has a role in maintaining handicrafts (tents, fleece, column, saddle bags, bags, sacks, feed bag, place mat and socks)
Adaptability to specific environment: These goats are well adapted to mountainous and scrubs regions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed has a strong body and resistant to local diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the Autumn. Calving and maternal instincts are good. Herding instints is middle. Survival ability rate of kids up to weaning is very high 100% for males and females is 94%. Testosteron quantity (pg/ml): 77.09 Semen volume (ml): 1.07 Sperm concentration (x109/ml): 2.86 Sperm motility (%): 78.64 Abnormal spermatozoa rate: (%) 7.09
Special characteristic of product: A special knife is made from the horns of goat
Other special qualities: Hair goats is conducive to climbing ıts very strong muscle structure.
Efabis genetic features: Blood Groups: HbAA, HbBB and HbAB. Transferin Polimorfizm: TfAA, TfAB ve TfBB. Haplotype diversity: 0.996, Nucleotide diversity: 0,0203
Efabis environmental role: Scrub, oak and woodlands are ideal living areas for these goats
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to all climate and rangeland conditions of Turkey.
Color comments: There are brown or white stains come down to the mouth on two sides of the black goats’ face and prevalently the colour gets light at the end of legs and rear surface of the udder
Efabis main colour: It is named as black goat because of its black hair colour. Gray, brown or blue-pied can be seen
Horn shape size and comments: Usually both males and females are horned. Bucks have strong horns. Distance between the tips of horns can be 60-70 cm. In does, horns are turned backward sometimes twisted and more elegant in comparison to male horns. The cross section of horn is oval or circular.
Description of origin: INDIGENOUS BREED
Location within country: country-wide of Turkey, especially south-west, western and eastern Turkey
Performance data reference: 1. Breed Register (The TR Official Gazette dated 12/12/2004 and 25668 numbered 2004/39 numbered Communiqué) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (Mınıstry of Food Agrıculture and Lıvestock General Dırectorate of Agrıcultural Research and Policy) 3. Erduran H. 2012. Farklı Şartlarda Yarı-Entansif Koşullarda Yetiştirilen Kıl Keçisi Melezlerin Verim Performanslarının Karşılaştırılması. TAGEM 2012 Gelişme Raporu.
Comments managment conditions: Performance was measured under transhumant conditions
Additional performance parameters: Birth rate 90-95%, twinning rate 12-43% Weight and Daily Gain of Hair Goats in extensive conditions  Day 0 30 60 90 120 150 180 avg  Weight (day/kg) hair (male) 3,47 8,25 12,88 17,23 19,76 23,20 24,53 hair (female) 3,28 7,68 11,94 15,18 17,72 20,91 22,43 Daily gain (day/g) hair (male) 159,21 154,48 145,07 84,30 114,76 44,24 117,01  hair (female) 146,52 141,86 108,07 84,73 106,31 50,80 106,38

Other name: (West) Caucasian, Georgian, Megrel, Mengrelian, Tiflis, Megrel'skaya
Color comments: uni coloured: black, grey, brown, white, roan

Description: It has a middle-sized body and head. Ears are pendulous. Although its basic colour is black, also white, cream, blackwhite,gray, ash-gray and brown animals may also be seen. Bucks have strong horns which are long,turned up and slanted backwards. Generally, does are polled, horned females have small and slim horns. Sometimes it is spiral and slanted downward.
Description Of Specific Uses: Main products of Norduz goat are milk, meat and hair. The milk is usually processed into the cheese. The herby cheese called 'Otlu Peynir' is a famous traditional product of Van provincial. Apart from cheese, butter is also produced from goat milk. The down fiber is collected and used for Kashmir production. There are special products obtained from the down fiber, such as blankents, gloves and socks in Norduz area. The upper hair is used for making felt tent.
Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk. In 2012, still at risk.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Main characteristics of Norduz goat are the favorable preweaning viability, the relatively high twinning rate and the milk production level as compared to other breeds of the region.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is breed on low and high pastures of Norduz locality with rich vegetation and water resources and rugged, slanted lands.
Color comments: multi coloured
Efabis main colour: The principle colour of Norduz goat is black. Also, white, black-white, grey, roan and brown colour can be found.
Horn shape size and comments: Males have robust, long and upward horns. They are gently curved to both side and back. Females are seldom polled. In females, horns are thinner relative to those in males. Sometimes horns are curved downward in spherical form.
Description of origin: Indigenous. Although no registered information on Norduz goat and its origin is available, there is a belief that is breed has been brought to Norduz area from Northern Iraq 250-300 years ago.
Performance data reference: Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2004), Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011)

Specific reproductive characteristic: High twinning rate.
Color comments: Main color is white, also beige animals can be seen
Horn shape size and comments: 90% of bucks have strong horn, 25% doe are polled
Description of origin: It was developed in Çanakkale Onsekiz Mart University Farm in 1978 by crossbreeding Saanen bucks and Turk Kil goats
Location within country: South Marmara, Aegean and Thrace region
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, semi - intensive

Additional information:
Population size increases up to 1 500 000 during the summer months, after the breeding season.
In 2003, this breed is at risk.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, grey, black
Location within country: Kars Province, eastern Anatolia, North-eastern Turkey

Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk.
Description of origin: indigenous breed
originated in the 4-8th century in hot arid steppes of the Arabian Peninsula

Additional information: 2003, this breed is at risk.
Description of origin: indigenous breed of Anatolia, composite of Arab and 'Circassian' variety of Arab

Adaptability to specific environment: It is resistant to harsh environmental condition.
Color comments: Head is generally white but some animals with brown or black stains can also be found.
Horn shape size and comments: Both rams and ewes are polled
Description of origin: It was developed in Acıpayam State Farm. It carries 50% Awassi, 25% Daglic and 25% Ost Fries genotype
Location within country: The Provinces of Denizli, Afyon, Isparta and Antalya
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011).

Additional information: Body is strong. It can survive in different climates with insufficient feeding and keeping. Because of its fatty tail, it has high survival potency during poor feeding periods
Adaptability to specific environment: It can survive in different climates with insufficient feeding and keeping. Because of its fatty tail, it has high survival potency during poor feeding periods.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to harsh environmental conditions and infectious diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period focuses on the Autumn. The birth rate is 87.9%. Herding and maternal instincts are good. Birth difficulty is very low.
Special characteristic of product: Fleece is used for producing carpet, rug, bed and quilt.
Other special qualities: It is able to walk long distances and utilize poor pastures. It is the most submissive one among the native breeds, so the management is quite easy.
Reference for special qualities: 1. Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2006) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011)
Efabis genetic features: Close to the Central Anatolian Merino, away from Karacabey Merino, Dağlıç and Kıvırcık.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to the climate of steppes where summer is hot and dry, and winter is cold and snowy.
Color comments: There are usually black stains on head, nose and hoofs.
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes are polled and rams may have small or rudimentary horns
Description of origin: indigenous breed
Performance data reference: 1. Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2006) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011)
Comments managment conditions: The data were collected from various conditions and herds (stationary and transhumant)
Additional performance parameters: Lambing rate (%): 85-90, Twinning rate (%): 15-20

Description: The Anadolu name means Anatolian. The name of breed was originated from the region of Anatolian of Turkey.
Adaptability to specific environment: It is adapted to the less rugged and poor pastures of the Central Anatolian Region with terrestrial climate. It has ability of adaptation to various environmental conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Its disease resistance is high.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the late summer and autumn. The birth rate is 91.4%. Herding and maternal instincts are good. Birth difficulty is very low. Litter size is 1.3  Survival ability rate of the lambs up to weaning is 85%.
Other special qualities: Its herd and maternal instincts and walking ability of long distances are good.
Reference for special qualities: 1. Anatolian Merino Breed Registration (TR Official Gazette dated 28/12/2007 and 26740 numbered 2007/52 numbered Communiqué) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM 2011)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has ability of adaptation to various environmental conditions.
Horn shape size and comments: Generally, both males and females are polled
Description of origin: Composite of German Mutton Merino (75-80%) and Akkaraman (20-25%)
Performance data reference: 1. Anatolian Merino Breed Registration (TR Official Gazette dated 28/12/2007 and 26740 numbered 2007/52 numbered Communiqué) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM 2011)

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to step climate.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A twinning percentage of 25% is reported for this breed.
Description of origin: composite of East Friesian and Ivesi

Description: The breed was developed in Bandırma Sheep Research Station.
Color comments: Head and legs are black, other part of the body white
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes are polled, 10-15 % of rams are horned
Description of origin: It was developed by crossbreeding with Kivircik sheep, the local breed in the Marmara region, and German Black-Headed Mutton (GBM), the mutton breed imported from Germany
Managment conditions performance measure: The data were collected from semi-intensive condition

Description: Dağlıç means mountain sheep.
Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk.
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to step climate.In the provinces Burdur,Isparta and Konya it is kept in hollows on the foot of mountains and even it is kept in enclosed areas such as groves on windless places.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed' resistance to diseases is very high.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High birth rate, low twinning rate, high survival ability to weaning, high mothering instinct.
Special characteristic of product: Special products produced by this breed are wool products, cheese and butter.
Other special qualities: It is able to walk long distances and its herd instinct is very good.. Grazing ability is very good.
Reference for special qualities: 1-Dağlıç Breed Registration (12.12.2004 dated and 25668 numbered TR Official Gazzette) 2- Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM)
Efabis genetic features: Heritability of weaning weight: (h²): 0,10 Growth rate: 0,04-0,11 Heritability of Birth weight : 0,19-0,21 Heritability of weaning: 0,09-0,10
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Adaptability to mariginal mountainous environment is very good
Color comments: Black or dark-brown stains may be seen around eye and mouth, on ears and legs
Horn shape size and comments: Generally rams are horned and ewes are polled. Horns are big, strong, thick, lateral, twisted and black pigmented.
Location within country: The eastern part of the Aegean Region and southern of the Central Anatolia.
Performance data reference: 1-Dağlıç Breed Registration (12.12.2004 dated and 25668 numbered TR Official Gazzette) 2- Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM) 3-Karabacak A.and Boztepe S. Yağlı Kuyruklu ve Yağsız ince Kuyruklu Koyun Irklarının Besi Performanslarının Karşılaştırılması. 2007. S.Ü.Zir.Fak.Derg.21(42):89-95

Description: The name cames from Gökçeada Island
Adaptability to specific environment: Breeding is mostly in the island of Gökçeada, on the rugged and mountainous lands, on the poor pastures without herdsmen. Additional feeding is applied for the sheep taken in shelters in cold weathers
Specific reproductive characteristic: It is early maturing breed
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It can be bred in rigorous climatic condition. It can survive in a half wild-life as flocks without herdsmen.
Color comments: uni coloured: white with black spots around eyes, nose, ears and legs
Horn shape size and comments: females have often scurs
Description of origin: Indigenous

Additional information: 2001, this breed is at risk.
Adaptability to specific environment: Very well
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to the local diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive performance % 90-92
Other special qualities: Its herd instinct is well developed.
Reference for special qualities: The Catalogue named Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources ın Turkey published by General Directorate of Agricultural Research and Policy in 2011 (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It grazes as climbing to the high plateaus with 2000-2500 m altitude. Generally it is kept in uncovered areas. In winter it is taken in simple shelters for nights and rainy days.
Color comments: The colour can be white, gray, brown, red, black and motley.. Especially in black ones the colour becomes sprinkled with gray as it gets older.
Horn shape size and comments: Males are horned, females are polled
Description of origin: It was developed by crossing Karagül and Dağlıç breeds in Mersin province.
Performance data reference: 1-Slaughter and Carcas Traits of Güney Karaman,Kangal-Akkaraman and Akkaraman Lambs at Different Slaughter Weights ( Turk Journal Veterinery Animals Scince 25 (2005) 495-504 TUBITAK)  2-Fattening Performans and Carcas Charestirictics of Some Fat Tailed Native Sheep Breeds of Turkey,(Selçuk Üniversitesi Ziraat Fakültesi Dergisi 14(21),39-48  3-Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey,breed catalogue (2011)  4-Büyük ve Küçükbaş Hayvancılık Araştırmaları Program Değerlendirme Toplantısında Görüşülecek Projeler (06-10 Mart 2011,Antalya)
Comments managment conditions: Data were recorded at the Bahri Dağdaş International Agricultural Research Institute condition

Description: Hamdani is fat-tailed sheep breed in northern Mesopotamia (Iraq and Turkey)
Adaptability to specific environment: It is well adapted to high and mountainous terrain.
Special characteristic of product: Twinning percentage is reported as 4% for this breed
Reference for special qualities: Odabaşıoğlu F., Öztürk Y. 1998. Van ve Yöresinde Hamdani Koyunlarının Verimleri ve Morfolojik Özelliklerinin Araştırılması Proje Sonuç Raporu (Research of yield and morphologic characters of Hamdani Sheep in Van and Neighbourhood Areas Project Report).
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Quite resistant to adverse environmental conditions and diseases.
Color comments: multi coloured
Efabis main colour: Body is generaly white coloured. It can rarely seen black-white and brown-white coloured.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams horns are a spiral form. Ewes are polled or rarely crescent horns can be seen
Description of origin: Near East fat-tailed type
Location within country: Hakkari, Şırnak, Van, Mardin and Batman provinces, south eastern of Turkey
Managment conditions performance measure: Semi-intensive
Additional performance parameters: birth rate (%): 92 - twinning rate (%): 4

Description: Hasak means of head letter the (H)ampshire Down, German Black Head (Turkish of the name: (A)lman (S)iyah Baş) and (Ak)karaman sheeps
Adaptability to specific environment: Hasak sheep breeding can be both successfully by raising on natural pastures due to its ability to walk long distaces to search food and barn feding.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Hasak is a good flocking maternal instinct. Mating period focuses on the Autumn Survival ability rate of lambs up to weaning rate of 96.8%.
Reference for special qualities: 1. Bahri Dağdaş International Agricultural Research Institute was published in Journal of Animal Research Institute and brochure 2. Turk J. Vet. Anim. Sci.(Tubitak)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Hasak sheep breed can be successfully by raising on natural pastures due to has the blood of Akkaraman.
Color comments: Head and leg can be Brown
Efabis main colour: The wool colour varies from black to light brown and occasionally mottled.
Horn shape size and comments: Both rams and ewes are polled
Description of origin: Composite of breed a Hampshire Down (31.25%) and Alman Siyah Baş-German Black Head (31.25%) and Akkaraman (37.5). Hasak was devoloped at Bahri Dağdaş International Agricultural Research Institute as a meat type sheep breed. It is reared at Institute and kept for commercial croosbreeding purposes.
Performance data reference: 1-Bahri Dağdaş International Agricultural Research Institute was published in Journal of Animal Research Institute and brochure 2-Aktaş A.H. Tek,n M.E. Çolak M. Canatan T. Description: Composite of 3 breeds (H: Hampshire Down, AS: German Black Faced, MER: Merino)
Adaptability to specific environment: It has ability of adaptation to conditions of Central Anatolia.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to local diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the late summer and autumn. The birth rate is 76.0%. Herding and maternal instincts are good. Birth difficulty is very low. Litter size is 1.2.
Efabis genetic features: 31,25% Hampshire Down + 30,25% German Black Faced+ 37,50% Central Anatolian Merino
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has ability of adaptation to various conditions of Anatolia.
Color comments: On head and legs, different colors can be seen from dark brown to black
Horn shape size and comments: Rams and ewes are polled.
Description of origin: Composite of 31,25% Hampshire Down + 30,25% German Black Faced+ 37,50% Central Anatolian Merino
Performance data reference: Tekin ME, Gürkan M, Karabulut O and Düzgün H (2005a) Performance Testing Studies and the Selection of Hasmer, Hasak,Hasiv and Linmer Crossbreed Sheep Types:III. Comments managment conditions: Data were recorded for males at the Bahri Dagdas International Research Institute

Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk. In 2012, still at risk.
Adaptability to specific environment: Its ability of walking and climbing on rugged and rocky areas are very good. It can graze poor pastures on the high altitudes.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Its durability, survival rate and ability of adaptation to harsh environmental conditions are high.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Herd and maternal instincts are high. It is ill-tempered.
Other special qualities: It has the longest tail among the native sheep breeds.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to rainy and moist climate of the Eastern Black Sea Region. It can make use of pastures in high altitudes (more than 2 000 m) of mountainous regions. It is kept in uncovered or partly covered sheepfolds during snowy periods. In that period, feeding largely depends on rough fodders.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, brown, white
Efabis main colour: Body colour varies from black to brown, also the ones in dirty-white colour may be found. In white sheep, there are black stains on the edge of eye, forehead and legs.
Horn shape size and comments: Usually, it is polled. In horny rams, the horns are strong and spiral. In ewes, weak horns may be found.
Description of origin: Indigenous
Location within country: Artvin, Rize, Erzurum and Ardahan provinces, North-eastern part of Turkey
Performance data reference: Sezgin, E. et al. 2011. Determination of some morphological structure, body size and growth rate properties of Hemşin Sheep grown in Artvin. 8th Global Conference on the conservation of Animal Genetic Resources. 199-207
Managment conditions performance measure: Daily gain data was obtained in pasture conditions

Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk. In 2012, under the risk of extinction.
Adaptability to specific environment: While it is sensitive to hot weather. It is adapted to rainy and moist climate conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average lambing rate is 86.
Other special qualities: Its wery reactive to outside stimulus.
Color comments: uni coloured: There are black-brown stains, spots on the uncovered parts of body such as head and legs
Efabis main colour: Wool is generally in white colour, also brown-black wool may be found
Efabis skin colour: Althought skin colour is largely white, It is seen black-brown parts
Horn shape size and comments: Rams horn are spiral, strong and turned forward and lateral sides. Ewes horns are weak.
Description of origin: Locally adapted breed. It was developed by crossing of Akkaraman (White Karaman) and Morkaraman (Red Karaman) rams with Karayaka ewes.
Performance data reference: 1. Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf) 2. Halil Erol, H. İbrahim Akçadag, Murat Unal. Concervation studies of Herik sheep. 8th Global Conferance on the conservation of animal genetic resurces. Tekirdag- Turkiye 4-8 October 2011
Managment conditions performance measure: Extensive and semi-intensive
Comments managment conditions: The animals endure feed shortages during the winter period.

Description: The most numerous and wide spread type of sheep in southwest Asia. It is also bred in Syria, Iraq, Lebanon, Jordan, Israel, Cyprius and Saudi Arabia.
Additional information: It is reported that the İvesi (Awassi) in Turkey made up to 2.3% of the total sheep population in 1984 and up to 1.8% in 1976.
Efabis cultural role comment: Breeder of region is almost the only way of life and livelihood
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to hot climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Quite resistant to adverse environmental conditions and diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A twinning percentage of 6-14% is reported for this breed.
Special characteristic of product: Milk and Meat
Reference for special qualities: Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2004) Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) Project of Improvement of Awassi Sheep Breed in Farmer Condition, interim report (2011)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: The breed is well adapted to hot climate.
Color comments: Head is four different colours as brown, yellowish-brown, black and white.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams’ horns are turned forward and downwards in a spiral form. Also ewes with nohorn or crescenthorns can be seen. Among females the ratio of weakhorn and ram–horn is 10%
Description of origin: In physical and functional properties, the Awassi seems to be very close to fat-tailed sheep of Asia, Africa and Europe.
Location within country: Gaziantep, Şanlıurfa, Hatay, Kilis and Mardin provinces, south eastern part of Turkey
Performance data reference: Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2004) Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) Project of Improvement of Awassi Sheep Breed in Farmer Condition, interim report (2011)
Managment conditions performance measure: Semi-Extansive conditions
Additional performance parameters: birth rate (%): 86.97 - twinning rate (%): 6-10

Description: Kangal is a town of Sivas Province
Adaptability to specific environment: It is known as the animal of dry climates, but able to adapt to various conditions of environment
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to local diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the Autumn. The birth rate is 89.3 Herding and maternal instincts are good. Birth difficulty is very low. Litter size is 1.2
Special characteristic of product: Fleece is used for producing carpet, rug, bed and quilt.
Other special qualities: It is able to walk long distances and utilize poor pastures. Body is strong. It can survive in different climates with insufficient feeding and keeping. It is the most submissive one among the native breeds, so the management is quite easy. It is able to walk long distances
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: This breed can adapt to the climate of steppes where summer is hot and dry, and winter is cold and snowy.
Color comments: Around eye, nose and feet are generally in black colour.
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes are polled but very rarely they have small horns. 10% of the rams have weak horns
Description of origin: Local variety of Akkaraman
Performance data reference: 1. Akçapınar, H., Kadak, R., Odabaşıoğlu, F., 1982. Morkaraman ve Kangal-Akkaraman koyunlarının döl verimi ve süt verimi üzerinde karşılaştırmalı araştırmalar. Ankara Üniv. Vet. Fak. Derg., 29 (3-4) : 379-391. 2. Akçapınar, H., 1994. Koyun Yetiştiriciliği. Medisan Yayınevi, Ankara. 3. Altıoğlu, A., 2007. Comments managment conditions: semi-intensive condition

Color comments: Uni coloured
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes are polled, 10-15% of the rams are horned
Description of origin: It was developed by crossing German Mutton Merino (95%) and Kıvırcık (5%) breeds so it carries Merino genotype over 90%.
Location within country: The Marmara Region, mainly in the South Marmara
Performance data reference: 1. Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2006) 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011)
Managment conditions performance measure: The data were collected from intensive farming condition.

Description: Its name comes from Karakul city of Turkmenistan and Blacklake of Uzbekistan
Description Of Specific Uses: It was an important breed in the past because of the curve strucre of skin which could be used for hat 'kalpak', clothes and decorative aims.
Adaptability to specific environment: Its well adapted to the steppe and arid climate conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to insuffient environmental conditions and infectious diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average lambing rate is % 91. Generally twinning rate is lower than other native sheep breeds.
Other special qualities: Newborn lambs have curly and bright hide but curls become smooth and form the coarse fibres in a short time after the birth.
Reference for special qualities: Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has no special needs for keeping and feeding. It can be bred in inadequate rearing conditions with inadequate pasture.
Color comments: When it is getting older, fleece is seen whitening of the black colour,
Efabis main colour: Its prevalant colour is black. In addition to black colour, some of them may be seen in brown, grey and white colour.
Efabis skin colour: Its prevalant colour is ash-gray. In addition to ıt is seen gray and white colours.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams are horned, ewes are generally polled 13% of them are horned. Rams' horns are strong and twisted forward. Ewes’ horns are weak and turned forward with only one curl beginnng in the back of ears
Description of origin: According to official sources, it was the first time to import from Turkmenistan in 1929 and than the second time to import from Afghanistan in 1956 and it was also brought by immigrated breeders from Batumi city of Georgia during the 1880’s
Managment conditions performance measure: extensive and semi-intensive conditions

Additional information: 2003, this breed is at risk.
Efabis cultural role comment: Breeder of region is almost the only way of life and livelihood
Adaptability to specific environment: Karakas is good , adaptation to different climate condition such as hot and dry summers or cold and snowy winters. It is good,adapted to poor pastures.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to long-distance walks.
Special characteristic of product: Meat and Milk
Reference for special qualities: Bingöl E. (2006). Hakkari’de yetiştirilen Karakaş Koyunlarda döl verimi ile kuzularda büyüme ve gelişme özellikleri. Basılmamış Yüksek Lisans Tezi. Van. (2004).Comparison of SomeReproductiveTraits of Karakaş and Norduz Sheep.Tarım Bilimleri Dergisi. 14 (1):59-63 Gökdal Ö.,Ülker H., OtoM.M., Temur C., Budağ C. (2000). DifferentProductionTraitsand Body Measurements of Karakaş Sheep in Rural Farm Conditions. Tarım Bilimleri Dergisi. 10 (1):103-111 Karaca O., Nurhan A., Andiç S., Altın T. (2003). MilkYieldCharacteristics of Karakaş Sheep. Turk J Vet Anim Sci. 27:589-594
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Quite resistant to adverse environmental conditions and diseases.
Color comments: Multi coloured: Body color is white. Generally, nose, around the eyes, ears and feet are blackspots.
Efabis skin colour: Usually white, some black spots available
Horn shape size and comments: Spiral shaped horns in rams
Description of origin: local variety of White Karaman
Location within country: Eastern and Southeastern Anatolia Region, particularly in Diyarbakir, Siirt, Sanliurfa, Adiyaman, Batman, Bingol, Bitlis, Van, Siirt Elazig and Malatya provinces of Turkey.
Performance data reference: Bingöl E. (2006). Hakkari’de yetiştirilen Karakaş Koyunlarda döl verimi ile kuzularda büyüme ve gelişme özellikleri. Basılmamış Yüksek Lisans Tezi. Van. Yılmaz O., Denk H., Arslan M., (2003).MilkYieldCharacteristics ok Karakas-Akkaraman Ewes in ExtensiveConditions. Vet.Bil.Derg. 19, 1-2:67-72 Ülker H., Gökdal Ö., Aygün T., Karakuş F. (2004).Comparison of SomeReproductiveTraits of Karakaş and Norduz Sheep.Tarım Bilimleri Dergisi. 14 (1):59-63 Gökdal Ö.,Ülker H., OtoM.M., Temur C., Budağ C. (2000). DifferentProductionTraitsand Body Measurements of Karakaş Sheep in Rural Farm Conditions. Tarım Bilimleri Dergisi. 10 (1):103-111 Karaca O., Nurhan A., Andiç S., Altın T. (2003). MilkYieldCharacteristics of Karakaş Sheep. Turk J Vet Anim Sci. 27:589-594
Managment conditions performance measure: Semi-intensive: Pasture-basedextensivebreeding

Description: Indigenous
Description Of Specific Uses: The wool is used for pillows, mattress and quilt.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to wood land and rainy climate. The form of hoofs and legs are strong so that it acts rather fast on the rugged and slant pastures.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is bred in mountainous, wooded, moist and cold enviromental conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average lambing rate is %85. Twinning rate is lower than others native breeds. The twinning percentage is reported for this breed as 4-6%.
Special characteristic of product: It has the most coarse fleece among the Turkey’s sheep breeds. Because fleece is coarse and long, it is preferred mostly for making mattress and quilt. Mattress and quilt.
Other special qualities: Fleece is coarse, flat and long. Medullation can be seen two to tree. Therefore, fleece can not be used textile industry. The wool provides advantage that the rain drops thrown out without reaching the skin. Its management is rather difficult. In addition, its meat is quite delicious.
Reference for special qualities: Breed Registration List, the TR Official Gazette (2006). Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is adapted to rainy, mountainous and moist climate conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually white also brown or black stains in various sizes are found mostly on the head and neck.
Efabis main colour: Body is generally in white colour.
Efabis skin colour: Skin colour is generally in white.
Horn shape size and comments: Males have strong and thick horns turned towards by curls. Generally, females are polled.
Description of origin: Indigeneous breed. There is practically no information about the history of the breed. The Karayaka has long been raised by purebreeding, largely due to geographical isolation.
Location within country: Along the coast between Sinop and Trabzon and mountainous areas of the Black Sea region, the areas around Tokat and Amasya provinces
Performance data reference: Breed Registration List, the TR Official Gazette (2006). Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011) (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Managment conditions performance measure: extensive and semi-intensive conditions
Comments managment conditions: Most of the sheep go to the mountains in summer in large communal flocks and return in winter season.
Additional performance parameters: birth rate (%): 85-90, twinning rate (%): 5-10

Description: Karya means Karya Civilisation
Adaptability to specific environment: Its breeding is preferred especially in rather good keeping and rearing conditions and on plains that have intensification trend
Color comments: Uni color; body is white. Eye, nose and feet are generally black colored
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have spirally strong horn, ewes are polled
Description of origin: Crossing of indigenius breeds Dağlıc, Odemis, Cine Capari with Kivircik and Chios
Location within country: Western Anatolia, South Aegean (Aydın, İzmir, Demizli, Manisa, Uşak, Afyon, Balıkesir)
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011). Altın T., Karaca O., Cemal I., Yılmaz M. and Yılmaz O. The Fattening and Carcass Characteristics of Kıvırcık and Karya Lambs. Hayvansal Üretim. 46 (1): 19-29, 2005
Managment conditions performance measure: The data were collected from semi intensive farming condition

Color comments: Body is generally in white and also black and motley colours may be seen
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have strong, spiral horns, ewes are polled.
Location within country: Thrace, Marmara and North part of the Aegean Region
Performance data reference: Kıvırcık Registration: in the Official Gazette dated 22/04/2006 and 26147 numbered 2006/16, Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011),

Description: Malya name comes from an agricultural farm name .
Adaptability to specific environment: It is well adapted to steppe climate and dry weather conditions. Good keeping and feeding conditions are preferred..
Efabis genetic features: Heritability of birth weight: 0.0788
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Malya sheep breed can be successfully raise on natural pastures due to the blood of Akkaraman
Color comments: Black stains may be found on head and legs
Horn shape size and comments: Both rams and ewes are polled
Description of origin: composite of German Mutton Merino (31%) and White Karaman(69%)
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey Republıc of Turkey Mınıstry of Food Agrıculture and Lıvestock General Dırectorate of Agrıcultural Research and Polıcy and Registration: in the Official Gazette dated 09/07/2006 and 26223 numbered 2006/32 numbered Communiqué.
Additional performance parameters: Survival rate of lambs: up to 6 month 86 %, 2 month 94 %, weight at 6 month 30 kg. fiber lenght 10.27 cm Fecundity: from 1.29 to 1.44; fertility: 90.00%; growth rate at 0-105 days: 259 g, and 105-150 days: 120 g;

Specific reproductive characteristic: Lambs have higher survival rate.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams and ewes are polled
Description of origin: It was developed in Aegean University Menemen Research and Application Farm by crossbreeding IIe de France rams (% 75) and Tahirova ewes (%25).

Other name: Red Karaman, Chacra, Chagra, Chakra, Dugli, Erzurum, Hamra, Shagra, Turkish Brown, Kizil Karaman
Description Of Specific Uses: Due to the strong apperance it is gifted to the brides in wedding seramony. Also it used in special dish called 'Cağ Kebab'.
Efabis cultural role comment: Due to the strong apperance it is gifted to the brides in wedding seramony.
Adaptability to specific environment: It is hardy and well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. It is able to walk long distances.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to low temperatures. Fatty tail is used for energy source during long and inadequate winter feeding periods.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Herd and maternal instincts are good.
Special characteristic of product: It is used in special dish called 'Cağ Kebab'.
Other special qualities: Herd controlling is pretty easy.
Color comments: uni coloured: red, brown
Efabis main colour: Body colour changes among red, maroon and violet, while around eye, mouth and nose are in light head and legs are in dark colour compared to the body.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams usually have big and spiral horns. Ewes are either weak horned or polled.
Description of origin: Indigenous
Location within country: Mainly eastern and central part of Anatolia
Performance data reference: Breed Registration List TR Official Gazette (2004), Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011)

Description: It has a high body frame. Neck is covered completely with fleece. Ram headed ewes with bangs and wattles may be found. Some of them have no ears. Basic colour is white, secondary common colour is ash, also gray-white and brown-white colours may be found. There are black stains on some parts of body, especially on the head. Rams and approximately half of the ewes are horned. It is fat tailed. Tail has three pieces that the third one is longer than the first one and drooping down.
Additional information: Herd and maternal instincts, walking and grazing abilities are good.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Its resistance, survival rate and adaptation ability are great in slanted and rugged region where it is bred.
Efabis main colour: Main body colour is white, secondary common colour is ash, also gray-white and brown-white colours may be found. Head, dewlap and legs are generally brown or black. There are black stains on some parts of body, especially on the head.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have strong spiral horns. Nearly 50% of the ewes have short, weak and straight hornes.
Description of origin: Van province Norduz district

Description: The Orta Anadolu name means Central Anatolian
Adaptability to specific environment: It is well adapted to the steps conditions of Central Anatolia. It has ability of adaptation to various environmental conditions
Specific resistance or tolerance: Its disease resistance is high
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mating period is focuses on the late summer and autumn. The birth rate is 87.0%. Herding and maternal instincts are good. Birth difficulty is very low. Litter size is 1.4.  Survival ability rate of lambs up to weaning is 90%.
Special characteristic of product: Fleece is formed by fine and uniform fibres. So, it is used for producing cloth.
Other special qualities: The breed is used for genetic source. It can make use of dry pastures better than other breeds except for the native ones.
Reference for special qualities: Central Anatolian Merino Registration (TR Official Gazette dated 28/12/2007 and 26740 numbered 2007/52 numbered Communiqué). Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM 2011)
Efabis genetic features: Heritability of birth weight: 0.2, Heritability of sheep weight at shearing: 0.4, Heritability of fleece weight of young sheep: 0.3, Heritability of litter size: 0.3. Close to the Akkaraman and Karacabey Merino, away from Dağlıç and Kıvırcık.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It has ability of adaptation to various environmental conditions.
Horn shape size and comments: Generally, both males and females are polled.
Description of origin: Composite of German Mutton Merino (80%) and Akkaraman (20%)
Performance data reference: 1. Central Anatolian Merino Breed Registration (TR Official Gazette dated 28/12/2007 and 26740 numbered 2007/52 numbered Communiqué). 2. Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey (TAGEM 2011) 3. FAO Breed Survey (1995) F60-60 Data transferred by EAAP in 9/99

Adaptability to specific environment: Good
Specific resistance or tolerance: It can be bred in inadequate feeding, sheltering and poor pasture conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive performance % 92
Reference for special qualities: The Catalogue named Domestic Anımal Genetic Resources ın Turkey published by General Directorate of Agricultural Research and Policy in 2011 (http://www.tagem.gov.tr/pdf/english_AnGR.pdf)
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Its sheepfolds are generally built adjacent to a hill. It is kept in hollows on mountains and even in uncovered groves of windless places in the provinces of Burdur and Isparta.
Horn shape size and comments: Males have strong, spiral horns turned lateral sides and females are generally polled.
Description of origin: It was developed by crossing Dağlıç and Kıvırcık breeds in Afyonkarahisar Province
Location within country: Northern west part of the Mediterranean Region and interior part of the West Anatolia

Description: Ramlic name comes from combination of Rambouillet and Daglic breeds’ name
Specific resistance or tolerance: The breeds has high ability to harsh environmental condition.
Other special qualities: Ramlıç lambs have higher survival rate. Herd instinct is well .
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have strong horn, ewes are polled
Description of origin: crossbreeding of American Rambouillet (65%) and Dagliç (35%) developed at Istanbul University
Import: Rambouillet rams were imported in 1958 from Montana USA
Location within country: Central Anatolia Afyon and Eskişehir provinces
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2009, Turkish Version),

Description: The name comes from Chios Island
Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk. In 2012, still at risk.
Efabis cultural role comment: Cultural events and programmes organised in Seferihisar and Çeşme every year in order to increase public awareness and encourage farmers of this valuable sheep breed.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to cool down climate.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A twinning percentage over 70 % is reported for this very prolific breed.
Color comments: uni coloured: white with black spots around mouth, eyes, ears and legs
Efabis main colour: Body is white. There are black stains around eye and mouth, on the end of nose and on ears and feet
Efabis skin colour: Skin colour is white and black stains spread on body.
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have strong, black, spiral horns, . Ewes are polled.
Description of origin: Indigenous breed. It has been suggested that the breed is the result of crossbreeding between local sheep breed of the island of Chios and breeds of Anoatolia that Kıvırcık and Dağlıç.
Location within country: Especially in Çeşme and also the provinces of İzmir, Aydın and the coastal locations of the Marmara and Aegean Regions
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011), Breed Registration List, TR Official Gazette (2004)
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data was collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, fed on concentrates, grazing, fodder.
Comments managment conditions: It is bred as family focks of 3-5 heads. Because of its high reroduction potential and milk yield, extra feding is applied especially in production period.
Additional performance parameters: In good feeding conditions this breed can produce more than 500 kg milk yield.

Description: Sönmez refer to surname of he who improved this breed
Adaptability to specific environment: Resistant to hot and dry conditions
Reference for special qualities: Kaymakçı M.Taşkın T.Koşum N. 2002 Sönmez Koyunlarında Tip Sabitleştirilmesi E.Ü.Zir.Fak.Derg. 39 (2): 87-94
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Resistant to hot and dry conditions
Horn shape size and comments: While ewes are polled , rams may be with small horns
Description of origin: composite of Tahirova (%75)[ East friz (%56,25), Kıvırcık (%18,75)], Sakız(%25)
Performance data reference: Kaymakçı M.Taşkın T.Koşum N. 2002 Sönmez Koyunlarında Tip Sabitleştirilmesi E.Ü.Zir.Fak.Derg. 39 (2): 87-94

Description: Tahirova ewes are known as a breed with high milk production and high fertility.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: rams are polled, ewes are polled
Description of origin: Tahirova sheep was developed by crossing with 75% East Friesian and 25% Kıvırcık. It was developed in in Tahirova State Farm in 1969.
Location within country: Southern Marmara, Aegean and Thrace regions.

Other name: Gürcü, Kars, Kesik, Herik/Herigi, Tunç, Çildir
Additional information: In 2003, this breed is at risk. In 2012, still at risk.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: It is well adapted to mountainous areas. Grazing ability is well.
Color comments: uni coloured: white with dark marks around eyes and on feet
Horn shape size and comments: Rams are horned. Horns are spiral, turned forward and heteroniymous. Ewes are generally polled but horned ones may be found.
Description of origin: Descended from Tushin (Georgia), similar to Tushinsky. The breed is distributed in Zakata, Azerbaijan and Armenia and Caucasia.
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011), Breed Registration List, TR Official Gazette (2004)
Managment conditions performance measure: Stationary conditions

Description: Türkgeldi type has high fertility and lactation yield from Kivircik that native local breed. Because of the composition of milk, Türkgeldi type is very important for manufactured cheese.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is known for its good adaptability to step climate.
Specific reproductive characteristic: A twinning percentage of 45% is reported for this breed.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: rams have horn, ewes are polled
Description of origin: It was developed in in Türkgeldi State Farm in 1981 - 2000 by crossbreeding Tahirova rams (% 75) and Kivircik ewes (%25)

Efabis cultural role comment: has a role in maintaining gastronomy (taking into account linkages between the breed and typical local products or recipes)
Adaptability to specific environment: It is well adapted to hot and dry climate and It can walk on rugged and rocky area.
Specific resistance or tolerance: It is resistant to hot and dry climate.
Special characteristic of product: In the region, Its milk is generally used in the mesh cheese that is a traditional cheese
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: They have complied with rocky and bumpy land terms of Karacadag Mountain
Color comments: The colour is generally beige, white- cream. There are black stains on the head, ears and legs. It can be seen black colour on the tail.
Efabis skin colour: White, there are black spots on the skin
Horn shape size and comments: Ewes and rams are polled but sometimes rams have small horns
Description of origin: It is developed by crossing local domestic sheep types of Karacadag region and transhumant sheep passed through this region.
Location within country: It is bred in Karacadag region located among Diyarbakır, Mardin and Sanliurfa provinces
Performance data reference: Determination of milk yield, reproductive success, growth and development, and morphological traits of Zom Sheep in Farmer Conditions Project Report (2012)
Managment conditions performance measure: Semi-intensive

Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are well adapted to the harsh environmental conditions
Specific resistance or tolerance: The animals are reported to be resistant to diseases.
Other special qualities: Herd and maternal instincts, and grazing ability are very good. Because it has rather submissive nature, its herd management is easy.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, sometimes light brown to dark black spots on feet and belly
Efabis main colour: Body colour is generally beige or ash-gray. Head, ears, legs and belly are coloured in various tones from brown to black or stains in these colours
Horn shape size and comments: Rams have strong spiral horns, ewes are usually polled.
Description of origin: Indigenous breed
Location within country: Aydin Province Koçarlı and Çine districts
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, extensive (non backyard)
Performance data reference: Domestic Animal Genetic Resources in Turkey, Breed Catalogue (2011), Breed Registration List, TR Official Gazette (2007), Karaca, O., Cemal, İ., Atay, O., 1999. Çine Çaparı, Çine Tipi ve Menemen X Çine Tipi (F1) kuzularda kimi besi ve kesim özellikleri. Uluslararası Hayvancılık Kongresi, p.766-770, 21-24 September1999, Ege University Agricultural Faculty, İzmir.
Managment conditions performance measure: The data was collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 4 months per year and fed on concentrates.

Additional information: 2003, this breed is at risk.
Specific resistance or tolerance: This breed is reported to be resistant to the toxicity of the Kanyasi plant.
Color comments: uni coloured: white with black or brown face
Description of origin: local variety of Akkaraman

Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to the local semi-arid and sub-humid climate.
Color comments: uni coloured: black, grey
Horn shape size and comments: short curved horns
Description of origin: few animals imported from Egypt in 1968 and 1970
Performance data reference: W55-5 N9 A.S. Abdel-Aziz (?) Characteristics of the Egyptian Buffalo.
Managment conditions performance measure: The adult body weight and withers height refer to animals 18 months old. The milk yield has been estimated.

Description: Some literature indicate that Ankole cattle is a strain of Sanga Breed of which Tusi people kept on selecting within Sanga breed and came up with Ankole cattle. Some people refer/name this Cattle Breed as Tusi Cattle
Additional information: Currently the breed is becoming popular in the country
Color comments: Brown/fawn, red/red-brown, black in combination of these colour and white.
Horn shape size and comments: long and massive horns
Description of origin: They came from Tusi people of Rwanda to the Western and South of Uganda, then pastoralist in the course of serch for green pasture and water they shifted to weestern Tanzania.
Additional performance parameters: Mortality 2%-20%; Lactation Length 250 days (Average)

Color comments: Fawn (redish) andwhite pied
Description of origin: exotic; continuously imported
Location within country: Arusha, Kilimanjaaaro and southern highlands regions
Comments managment conditions: Ayrshires are kept on large scale dairy farms, mostly owned by the government and in addition there exists a number of privately owned large-scale dairy farms near major towns/cities, especially in Dar es Salaam, Coast, Iringa and Arusha regions the keep Friesians. The management system is fenced grazing systems and concentrate supplementation of milking cows, calves and breeding bulls.

Description: Tanzania Boran are mainly kept in the Ranches especially in Coastal region, Central, Northern and Lake zones. The breed thrives in warm, cool and dry in the arid and semi arid environment. The vegetation type is usually bush and dwarf shrub grassland. Management system is extensive and semi transhumance. Prophylactic measures against trypanosomiasis are the common health management practices
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to semi-arid and sub-humid climates.
Other special qualities: The animals often have to walk long distances in search of water.
Color comments:
uni coloured: usually white or grey, also red
multi coloured: also pied
Horn shape size and comments: short horns
Description of origin: The breed is belived to come from South West Asia to the horn of Africa in 1300 to 1500 years ago. Then it extended to the Sourthern Ethiopia and contiguous areas of Kenya and Somali then from southern Kenya to Tanzania
Location within country: scattered in a few areas in the country, mainly in ranching company farms
Performance data reference: N2-40 N9 F20(1)-104 W67-53 W57-30 FAO Breed Survey
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were measured on animals kept under stationary conditions and fed on grazing and fodder.
Comments managment conditions:
In Tanzania Boran cattle are reared under two production systems: a) Pastoral range, stationary, fed on extensive grazing in an agro-pastoral farming system in the semi-arid ecological zone; b) Livestock-crop-lowlands in the sub-humid ecological zone. There is inadequate water supply.
Aditionally, according to the Country report on AnGR 2004, Commercial ranching in Tanzania is mainly based on extensive grazing, usually in paddocks. It is mainly practiced in ranches owned by the National Ranching Company (NARCO) established in the 1970s. The dominant breed in most ranches is the Boran and crosses of Boran with indigenous breeds or exotic beef sire breeds crossed with Borans.
Additional performance parameters: It is an improved TSZ animal for beef production. There is a lack of controled mating.

Description: The strain is mostly found in Kilimanjaro region along the Mountain Kilimanjaro and is kept by Chagga people. Due to some reasons, the breed has disappeared (Extinct) since 1990s. The introduction of exotic dairy cattle such as Friesian, Ayrshire and Jersey affected the existence of Chagga cattle. Unlike other areas in Tanzania where indigenous cattle are kept extensively, Chagga people started indoor (Zero grazing) quite long ago with their indigenous cattle i.e. Chagga cattle breed. They easily adopted the exotic breeds because their problem was mainly milk and manure at the same time land shortage was increasing. It is said that indigenous cattle eat less and give less manure compared to exotics that eat more and give significant amount of manure. This led progressively disappearance of Chagga cattle breed.
Additional information: The breed is an extict, very few animal can be counted of the breed type.
Additional information comments: Efforts to rescue the breed is required
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to a sub-humid climate.
Color comments: Multcoloured (black, white and black,Redish/brown)
Horn shape size and comments: amall, different orientaion (upward/lateral curved)
Description of origin: variety of Tanzanian Zebu
Comments managment conditions: There is lack of fodder. In Tanzania the Chagga Zebu are reared mainly under a pastoral range production system, under stationary conditions, fed on zero grazing in an agricultural farming system within the sub-humid ecological zone.

Description: Ethiopian Boran is now known as Tanzania Boran owing to the fact that Tanzania had Indigenous Boran which was kept on crossing with Ethiopian Boran for long time since 1940s. Thus, through backcrossing towards Tanzania Indigenous Boran since the importation of Ethiopia Boran ceased there is no trace of Ethiopian Boran in Tanzania
Other name: Borana, Borena, Galla, Somali Boran, Tanaland Boran, Avai
Color comments: uni coloured: grey, white
Description of origin: unimproved variety of Boran
Managment conditions performance measure: The milk yield per lacation refers to pastoral conditions.
Additional performance parameters: - Weaning weight 170.2;

Color comments: multi coloured: black-pied and sometimes red-pied
Description of origin: exotic; continuously imported
Comments managment conditions: Friesians are kept on large scale dairy farms, mostly owned by the government and in addition there exists a number of privately owned large-scale dairy farms near major towns/cities, especially in Dar es Salaam, Coast, Iringa and Arusha regions the keep Friesians. The management system is fenced grazing systems and concentrate supplementation of milking cows, calves and breeding bulls.

Description: Iringa Red Cattle is one of Strains under Small East African Zebu, Dominant in Iringa region and their colour is red
Additional information: They are adapted to highlands condition, hardy can walk long distance
Color comments: Dominated by red colour
Horn shape size and comments: Thick horn at base growing with diffrent curve orientation.
Description of origin: local strain of Small East African Zebu in Tanzania
Performance data reference: D.S.C Sendalo R.P. Mbwile Y.N Msanga P.A.A Mwakilembe J.K Murro P.L. Mwambene A.A. temu , 2007. Socio-economic and Phenotypic characteristics of Iringa red cattle. Ministry of livestock Development and Fisheries, Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: Communal grazing environment
Additional performance parameters: Theyb are hards

Description: Imported breed from European countries
Additional information: The breed needs conducive environment in order to reach high production potential, in the country it is well distributed in the Regions like Arusha, Kilimanjaro and Southern highlands of the country.
Description of origin: continually imported; exotic
Performance data reference: Livestock breed survey 2008, Ministry of Livestock Development and Fisheries, Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: Zero grazing or semi intensive management is practices

Description: Maasai Cattle is one of the Strains of Small East African Shorthorn Zebu. Called Maasi because it is mostly owned by the Maasai people
Additional information: the breed adapted to harsh environment (drought and diseases)
Additional information comments: Animals are mostly depend on natural pastures and no/very minimal supplimentation is done.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to live under semi-arid climatic conditions.
Color comments: Black but there are many varieties (Black with white patches, Red and white/grey, fawn and brindle, colour sided)
Description of origin: Tanganyika shorthorn zebu
Location within country: northern to southern parts of the country
Managment conditions performance measure: Communal grazing, no breeding control, suppliments and with minimal disease comntrol
Comments managment conditions: These animals are fed on total grazing. Special conditions faced by the breed include inadequate water supply and veterinary care and futhermore, animals have to cross long distances in search of water. In Tanzania the two main production systems under which Masai cattle are reared are: a) Pastoral range, transhumant, fed on extensive grazing, in a pastoral farming system within the semi-arid ecological zone. b) Livestock-crop-lowlands, nomadic, in the humid and in the highland ecological zones.
Additional performance parameters: Few performance records available

Description: This is a composite breed developed by crossing Ayrshire and Indo-Zebu breeds of Sahiwal and Red Sindhi and African Zebu, Tanzania Shorthorn Zebu and Boran.
Additional information: A hardy dual purpose cattle breed for semi arid conditions of Tanzania for production of milk and beef in the grazing conditions. However, when kept in intensive management and fed concentrates, the milk production increases to more than 1500 kg per lactation. High tolerance for most tropical diseases, such as intestinal worm infestation and Foot and Mouth Disease. Mortality in calves has been reduced to 4 % at controlled management conditions where restricted suckling is practiced instead of feeding calves using bucket.
Additional information comments: The breed is becoming popular as a replacement for Sahiwal at the Northern Tanzania and among Maasai community for comparatively high milk production to the Tanzania short horn Zebu. Beef production is through steers who achieved 230 kg at the 4 years of age when kept under grazing management only.
Adaptability to specific environment: The Mpwapwa cattle is a dual-purpose breed with high production potential under semi-arid conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually light to dark red like Sahiwal
Horn shape size and comments: Short thick horns varying 30 to 46 cm
Description of origin: Studies on crossbreeding of cattle were embarked on in 1930s at Mpwapwa. Several Bos indicus (Tanzania Shorthorn Zebu, Boran, Sahiwal and Red Sindhi) and Bos taurus (Ayrshire, Friesian, Jersey and Guernsey) were involved. These studies led to the development of the composite Mpwapwa Breed of which 75% constitutes of Sahiwal and Red Sindhi.
Year of origin: Started breeding in 1940s and breed was closed in 1958
Performance data reference: W65-13 N2-31 A6-23 FAO Breed Survey S.M. Das, ZRTC, LPRI Aron (1993) Annual Research Report LPRI Mpwapwa. Proc. of 100 years of Livestock Services in Tanzania 1905-2005, Ministry of Water and Livestock Development, Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance was measured at the Livestock Breeding Station Mpwapwa under improved management conditions with little or no concentrates fed and unimproved pastures.
Comments managment conditions: In Tanzania there are two production systems under which Mpwapwa cattle are reared: a) Pastoral range, stationary, fed on grazing and fodder in an agro-pastoral farming system within the semi-arid ecological zone. b) Livestock-crop-lowlands, fed on zero grazing within the sub-humid ecolgical zone.
Additional performance parameters:
- weaning weight 52-56 kg;
- live weight at slaughter 425.9 kg;

Description: Sahiwal
Other name: Lola, Montgomery, Multani, Teli, Lambi Bar
Additional information: the breed is good milkers than the local zebu, Produces relatively small calves with easy calving.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The animals are reported to show resistance to tick borne diseases.
Special characteristic of product: This is an excellent dairy breed.
Color comments: Their colour can range from reddish brown through to the more predominant red, with varying amounts of white on the neck, and the underline. In males the colour darkens towards the extremities, such as the head, legs and tail
Horn shape size and comments: Rudmentary thick at base, usually are dehorned and looks polled.
Description of origin: Punjab region of Pakstan/Sahiwal District,
Import: 1939-1963 Imported breed from Pakstan to Kenya 60 males and 12 females and Tanzanian imported the breed from Kenya
Managment conditions performance measure: Communal grazing management
Comments managment conditions: Minimal care are taken on management, hardy environment with frequent drought.
Additional performance parameters: Resistance to tick born diseases

Description: The strain is dominated by farmers based in Singida region and the dominant colour for such cattle is white.
Description Of Specific Uses: Security (bank) to save for emergencies also money from saling animals are used to buy cerials and other home needs.
Additional information: The strain is hardy to Drought and Temperature
Color comments: The body is dominated by white colour/ grey and redish
Horn shape size and comments: Short horned strain, with different shape and orientaion
Description of origin: The strain is mostly found in Singida region.
Managment conditions performance measure: Extensivev grazing, with minimum supplimentation.

Description: The strain is mostly found in Tarime region. The strain are named after their localities
Additional information: The breed is tolerant to various tropical diseases, drought but also they are good grazers.
Color comments: Brown, Fawn, Brown mixed with other colour (black/white/red etc.)
Description of origin: Found in Tarim district Mara region, Tanzania
Import: Through natural selection of indigenous Tanganyika short horn zebu
Location within country: Tarime district of mara region, North west Tanzania

Description: The strain is mostly found in Zanzibar Islands. Their current population is not known
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is adapted to live under semi-arid and humid climatic conditions.
Color comments: uni coloured: light red, dun, black, grey
Description of origin: variety of Small East African Zebu: with some influence from Indian, Somali and Boran
Location within country: Zanzibar and Pemba, coastal areas of Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: Extensive system
Comments managment conditions: There is lack of water and proper veterinary care. Zanzibar Zebu are reared in: a) Livestock-crop-lowlands production system, fed on extensive grazing; b) Agricultural farming system within the sub-humid and highland ecological zones fed on grazing and concentrates.

Additional information: The dominant character they have no tail
Description of origin: Through natural selection of Tanzania indigenous chicken

Description: Name such strain is originated from Singida Region local language "Kuku Mbuni" means chicken looks like Ostrich
Color comments: Multicolour (Black,buuf, black and white)
Performance data reference: Livestock breed survey 2008, Ministry of Livestock Development anrd Fisherise, Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: local environment under extensive system

Description of origin: Originated from the country of Sussex

Description: They are small in size , short and they are most found in Morogoro region of Tanzania
Additional information: They are short, laying many eggs, good mothering ability.
Special characteristic of product: ability to lay many eggs
Other special qualities: short legs
Reference for special qualities: Livestock breed survery 2008, Ministry of Livestock Development and Fisheries, Tanzania
Color comments: Multicolor (Brown, Black and or mixture with other color)
Description of origin: They are most fopund in Morogoro region
USA Rhiodes Island

Color comments: White
Description of origin: Central Ialy

Description: Anglonubians are considered a dairy breed with high butterfat content of their milk. The Anglonubian was developed in UK breeding native milking stock with goats from Middle East and Sudan. Its characteristic with large, pendulous ears and a Roman nose and have comparatively long legs. Anglonubians can live in very hot climates and have a longer breeding season than other dairy goats.
Additional information: Anglonubian goats are adapted to temperate zones and these perform and adapt well to Northern Tanzania regions and on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro and Meru. Anglonubians attach readily to their new owners with nexk and side stroking and also love humnan interaction.
Additional information comments: A good breed for pure breeding to increase milk production in areas where cattle can not be kept, especially on thes slopes of the mountains and also the stud bucks can be used to crossbreed with the indigenous goats for higher meat and dairy performance of the crossbreds.
Color comments: Any color, but mainly brown and black body color with brown, black and white patches and dots all over body and face.
Horn shape size and comments: Short and curved flat horns.
Description of origin: recently introduced; exotic
Import: Imported from USA in 1976 for pure breeding and crossbreeding with indigenous with the main purpose of increasing milk yield of crossbred dairy goats.
Location within country: Northern (Arusha, Kilimanjaro and Manyara regions) and Eastern (Tanga, Morogoro and Coastal region) of the country
Performance data reference: Small Ruminant Research Highlights in Tanzania. 1991. S. M. Das and D. S. C. Sendalo, Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock Development and Cooperatives, Tanzania Livestock Breed Survey, 2008. Ministry of Livestock Development and Fisheries, Tanzania
Managment conditions performance measure: The data was measured under the controlled management conditions at Livestock Research Centre, West Kilimanjaro, where Anglonubian goats were kept under semi-intensive conditions and kept on adequate pastures and given some concentrates to the milking does, kids and stud bucks. The disease control measures, vaccinations and deworming was done as scheduled.
Comments managment conditions: Anglonubian goats kept under intensive management by farmers (stall feeding by cut and carry and concentrates fed twice a day) performed much better than those kept at the research centres and under extensive management. The goats kept under intensive management had higher growth rate and attained higher weights at 3 years of age (males), also milk production was high.
Additional performance parameters: Data from the intensive management farmer conditions is being collected at present.

Description: The Boer goat is also known as Afrikaqner, South African common goat and Boer goat. Boer goats were evolved in South Africa from indigenous African and the introduced European stock.
Description of origin: Exotic breed imported from South Africa.
Import: Imported to Tanzania in 1950 for crossbreeding with Indigenous goats and Kamorai goats to develope Blended goats
Location within country: Central Zone Dodoma, Mpwapwa and Eastern Zone - Ngerengere farms
Managment conditions performance measure: Controlled management conditions, grazing in paddocks at research institute and also data obtained from semi-grazing system in the farmers managed farms in semi-arid environment
Comments managment conditions: Well adapted to semi-arid conditions and to extensive grazing and are good browsers. Have little problems with worm infestation in extensive grazing.
Additional performance parameters: Mainly used for meat production by crossing with the Kamorai x Indigenous crossbreds to form Blended goats. They have faster growth rate than the indigenous and Kamorai goats.

Description: The Alpine goats were taken from Switzerland to UK and USA and selected for much greated uniformity, size and production. The color of British Alpine ranges from pure white through shades of fawn, gray, brown, black, red, bluff and piebald, or various shadings or conminations of these colors. The beard of males is also quite pronounced and ears of of medium size and erect. Very few farmers in Northern Tanzania, especially missionary schools and some NGO run farmer associations keep the British Alpine and thus the breed is almost extinct in Tanzania.
Horn shape size and comments: Sharp, straight pointed horns.
Description of origin: recently introduced; exotic

Description: Gogo goats are meat goats with medium sized with small, sharp pointed horns in both males and females. It is multi-colored with black or white body color and dots of brown or black on the body. The ears are small and erect pointing backwards and has a small tail.
