A meat production potential of 120 to 150 kg is estimated per female breeder per year, given that it produces 6 litters of 8 weaned kits totaling 40 to 50 young.

Description of origin: imported; exotic
Comments managment conditions: The rabbits are kept mainly by children and women in small units.
Additional performance parameters: Generally the exotic rabbits in Uganda are ready for mating around 5 - 6 months and continue active production for 2 to 3 years. The average size among improved rabbits is 3 - 5 kg mature live weight. Rabbits can produce up to 8 - 9 litters of 8 - 12 kits per annum. A meat production potential of 120 to 150 kg is estimated per female breeder per year, given that it produces 6 litters of 8 weaned kits totaling 40 to 50 young.

Description of origin: imported; exotic
Comments managment conditions: The rabbits are kept mainly by children and women in small units.
Additional performance parameters: Generally the exotic rabbits in Uganda are ready for mating around 5 - 6 months and continue active production for 2 to 3 years. The average size among improved rabbits is 3 - 5 kg mature live weight. Rabbits can produce up to 8 - 9 litters of 8 - 12 kits per annum. A meat production potential of 120 to 150 kg is estimated per female breeder per year, given that it produces 6 litters of 8 weaned kits totaling 40 to 50 young.

Description of origin: imported; exotic
Comments managment conditions: The rabbits are kept mainly by children and women in small units.
Additional performance parameters: Generally the exotic rabbits in Uganda are ready for mating around 5 - 6 months and continue active production for 2 to 3 years. The average size among improved rabbits is 3 - 5 kg mature live weight. Rabbits can produce up to 8 - 9 litters of 8 - 12 kits per annum. A meat production potential of 120 to 150 kg is estimated per female breeder per year, given that it produces 6 litters of 8 weaned kits totaling 40 to 50 young.

Description Of Specific Uses: Sheep perform important social and traditional roles; sheep are slaughtered at important Moslem festivities and they are offered as sacrifice among traditional healers, the black and white coated animals are particularly prized.
Color comments: uni coloured: usually white with black or brown head
Description of origin: East African Fat-Tail type
Comments managment conditions: Two production systems are used to rear East African Blackheaded sheep in Uganda: a) Crop-livestock highlands, stationary, fed on extensive grazing in an agro-pastoral farming system within the highland ecological zone, mainly kept to produce meat. b) Lowlands, stationary, fed on extensive grazing in an agro-pastoral farming system within the semi-arid ecological zone, mainly kept to produce meat.
Additional performance parameters: There is very little performance data available for this breed. At Mbarara Livestock Experimental Station in western Uganda, 2 lambings a year occur in well managed ewes and 18% of births produce twins.

Description Of Specific Uses: Sheep perform important social and traditional roles; sheep are slaughtered at important Moslem festivities and they are offered as sacrifice among traditional healers, the black and white coated animals are particularly prized.
Other special qualities: The animals within the pastoral range-livestock production system are kept for social purposes whereas the animals within the lowlands are mainly kept for meat production.
Reference for special qualities: Information provided by Dr. Francis Mbuza: questionnaire for the project identification mission on AnGR.
Color comments: multi coloured: red-brown, occasionally pied
Description of origin: East African fat-tailed type
Comments managment conditions: Two production systems are used to rear Masai sheep in Uganda: a) Pastoral range-livestock, stationary, fed on extensive grazing in an agro-pastoral farming system within the arid ecological zone. b) Lowlands, stationary, fed on extensive grazing in an agro-pastoral farming system within the sub-humid ecological zone. (Information provided by Dr. Francis Mbuza: questionnaire for the project identification mission on AnGR)
Additional performance parameters: There is very little information available on the performance of this breed in Uganda.

Description: Imported. The title comes from the counties of Aberdeen and Angus, Scotland, where this breed was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Aberdeen-angus bulls are used in industrial crossing with dairy and double cows. Weight of crosses prevail over native breed animals weight by 2,2-13,1%, slaughter output - by 4,7-14,3%
Additional information: These animals are small compared to other beef breeds.
Additional information comments: Remarkable traits - high fertility, small size of fetus and good developed rare 1/3 part of body with good fulled muscles (trousers, riding-breeches), which falls up to hocks. This increases dressing percentage at 3-5% and reduces bone percentage in carcass at 3.7-4.8% compare with Simmental, Black-and-White and Whiteheaded Ukrainian breeds.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of the breed has good adaptive ability to cold climate, a little worse - to hot conditions
Specific resistance or tolerance: certain resistance to eye cancer and solar udder burning due to dark skin pigmentation
Specific reproductive characteristic: The Aberdeen Angus cows have good motherly properties. Aberdeen-Angus breed prevail over other beef breeds on fertility and ease calving. Average reproductive ability of cows is more than 93%
Special characteristic of product: After slaughter ones obtained tender, thin fiber, juicy meat with a strong мarbling
Other special qualities: Cattle is rather early maturing, well and rapidly fed to required conditions, undemanding to feed. Characteristic for animals of the breed is a relatively early completion of growth (with good meat maturing) and rapid total body fatting
Reference for special qualities: Angus breed in breed-creating process/ L.O. Tymchenko, O.G.Tymchenko// Interinstitutional thematic collection"Animal breeding and Genetics". - K.: "Agrarian science", 2001. - Vol. 34. - P. 169-172.
Efabis genetic features: Coefficient of homozygocity - 0,14-0,117. The frequency of breed specific allele QQ ' is 0.106. There is revealed the presence of alleles GYE'Q ', BOYD', characteristic for the Holstein breed
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Good acclimatization in different climatic zones of Ukraine
Color comments: uni coloured: black, but some are red
Horn shape size and comments: polled
Description of origin: exotic, imported. The basis for creating of this breed in Scotland was the local black polled breed.
Import: From 1958 to 1975 into Ukraine there were imported 121 heads, including 57 bulls of this breed. Dams of this breed firstly entered Ukraine in 1961 from Canada (26 heifers and 1 bull) and from Scotland in 1962 (16 heifers and 2 bulls). In 1992 42 heifers and 9 sires of this breed entered Ukraine and in 1993 came 178 heifers of large type.
Location within country: 25 regions of all climatic zones of Ukraine - Polissya, forest-steppe and steppe.
Performance data reference: The program of selection of Aberdeen-Angus cattle for 2003-2012 years/ Under the general edition of I.V.Guzev. - K, 2005. - 344 p., Breeding resources of Ukraine/ Under the scientific edition of M.V.Zubets, V.P.Burkat. - K: "Agrarian science", 1998. - 336 p.
Managment conditions performance measure: good pastures
Additional performance parameters: Pre slaughter weight of bulls at 18 months was 458 kg, fat yield - 7.8%. Milk production (at weaning calves at 6 months) - 175 kg.

Description: Got its name from the place where it was established - peninsula Anheln of Schleswig-Holstein province in the extreme north-east Germany.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used to improve the red breeds of Ukraine.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals are characterized by high acclimatization ability
Specific reproductive characteristic: Animals of this breed are characterized by easy calving, the lowest rate of birth of dead calves, high survival rate of new-born calves.
Special characteristic of product: High content of kappa-casein in milk. Meat of young bulls is of high quality with thin fibers.
Other special qualities: strong leg and feet
Efabis genetic features: Amongst B blood group alleles the most common are: PA, VOYD ', BP', YY ', G''
Color comments: Red colour (from light red to cherry, brown and chestnut) with a dark shade in the area of head, neck and legs. At the udder, in groin and at the tip of the tail sometimes found white marks.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are white, black at tip, directed and curved upwards.
Description of origin: imported; exotic. One of the oldest native breeds of Germany and the world
Import: It was entered in early XIX century in the area of Odessa, Kherson and Crimea. In 1964 99 young bulls and 66 heifers was imported to breeding farm "Bilshovyk" at the south of Ukraine. By 1990, from Germany it was imported 1,539 animals of this breed, including 350 bulls.
Location within country: Breeded in Vinnitsa, Mykolayiv and Kherson regions.
Additional performance parameters: Young bulls at the age of 18 months has live weight 450-480 kg

Description Of Specific Uses: Crossbreeding with other breeds to improve their performance and technological features, enhance adaptability to industrial technology.
Additional information: Low rate of feed spending per unit of output in general and concentrates in particular - respectively 0.95 and 0.25 feed units per liter of milk.
Adaptability to specific environment: Species has exclusive persistence and adaptation properties
Specific resistance or tolerance: Satisfactory resistance
Specific reproductive characteristic: High level of reproduction ability
Special characteristic of product: High protein content in milk. High output of cream is caused by a lot of milk fat balls
Other special qualities: For fat yield breed prevail over a number of other breeds. Breed is characterised with early maturity.
Efabis skin colour: Some animals have black pigmentation of certain areas of the skin
Description of origin: exotic; imported. It is believed that this breed was created by crossing local cattle with Dutch, Shorthorn, Hereford, Guernsey, Jersey and other breeds.
Import: Introduced in the former Soviet Union from Finland in 1933-1935
Location within country: At some breeding farms of Lviv and Poltava regions.
Additional performance parameters: calves' output per 100 cows - 61

Description: Refer to the name of location, where it is bred and to specific colour.
Additional information: There were created in the breed 10 lines and related groups and over 30 high productive dam families. This breed is local endangered. It should be conserved, because it has valuable qualities and good adaptation to local conditions.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to the climatic conditions of the Carpathian and Transcarpathian region
Specific reproductive characteristic: 4-5-year-old bulls of Brown Carpathian breed has ejaculate volume 5-5,3 ml, sperm concentration - 1.03 - 1.05 billion/mL, semen activity - 8,2-8,3 points; resistance - 33 - 34 th. units, resistance of sperm to freezing - 88-93, fertilization from the first insemination - 68-70%.
Special characteristic of product: very good, specific meat
Other special qualities: This breed gives good meat in mountain areas. Animals has good indicators of meat production, can long time maintain fatness
Reference for special qualities: Breeding resources of Ukraine/ Under the scientific edition of M.V.Zubets, V.P.Burkat. - K: "Agrarian science", 1998. - 336 p.
Efabis genetic features: High frequency of alleles QTY2 (about 0.14), O '(0.10), E'J' and I1Q'E'Q '(0,11), which can be considered as specific markers of this breed
Color comments: uni coloured: brown
Efabis main colour: Colour is from dark brown to light brown
Description of origin: Brown Carpathian breed is a result of many years reproductive crossbreeding of local brown cattle named ""Rizhka"" and ""Mokan" with imported brown alpine breeds and strains: Swiss, Montafon, Intal and partially Algouska.
Performance data reference: Breeding resources of Ukraine/ Under the scientific edition of M.V.Zubets, V.P.Burkat. - K: "Agrarian science", 1998. - 336 p.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept at stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.

Description: The name derives from the name of Province Sherole, located in France, where it was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used for reproductive and industrial crossing with animals of dairy and double breeds.
Additional information: Amongst the faults of the breed there are heavy calving, the softness of back, friability of constitution. In common the animals of the breed has sub lethal gene of doppellenderity, which is hypertrophy of the rear third part of body.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals are characterized by good acclimatization ability in different climatic zones due to good thermo-regulation.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Cows are characterized by good reproductive ability. One of the negative characteristics of this breed is a difficult course of calving.
Special characteristic of product: Meat is of high quality, lean and tender
Other special qualities: Amongst the breed characteristics is good and quick increasing of the meat (flesh) for a long time without an excessive fattening of the body. The breed has good slaughter properties. The animals are large with high energy of growth, have stable heredity and rich gene pool.
Efabis main colour: Animals are of cream-white, light shaded.
Description of origin: Imported from France; exotic. The pedigree youngsters of the Charolais breed were imported from France in 1955 - 1975 years (300 head). This breed was created in France by a long-term selection of local cattle, close to Simmental for meat traits.
Import: 300 heads of breeding youngsters of Charolais, including 262 heifers and 38 bulls were imported into Ukraine from France between 1955 and 1975.
Location within country: Breeding in Volyn, Zhytomyr, Kyiv, Kharkiv and Chernihiv regions
Additional performance parameters: The average live weight of 8-month bulls is 306-354, heifers - 281-297 kg.

Description: The name comes from the county of Hereford, where the breed was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used for industrial and reproductive crossing in order to obtain high-performance beef cattle.
Additional information: There is bred animals of two types: small compact of Hungarian breeding and large (massive) type of American and Canadian selection.
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals of the breed are characterized by exceptional ability to adapt to different climate conditions and nutrition, and by high endurance.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Characterized by resistance to some diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High homozyhozity (Ca = 0.219) provides strong preservation of breed properties, the possibility of effective use in industrial crossing. However, when pure breeding the reproductive abilities can decrease. To avoid this, you must use at breeding erythrocyte antigens heterogeneous selection of breeding pairs.
Special characteristic of product: Meat is marble, fine-grained, tender, has a pleasant taste and smell.
Other special qualities: Breed is considered to be early-maturing, inclined to fattening when young. Animals have a roundish body shape and have a high output of good meat with a small proportion of bones
Efabis genetic features: The most common are breedspecific alells YD'I ', which frequency is 0.371. The total frequency of the three most common alleles YD'I ', b, G' is 0,726.
Color comments: Red colour with a white head, dewlap, stomach, legs and tail tip.
Description of origin: imported; exotic
Import: Between 1961 and 1970 into Ukraine there were imported 351 heifers of Hereford breed. In 1992-1993 to the main breeding center from the U.S. and Canada were imported 35 heifers and 13 bulls.

Description: In the nineteenth century Dutch cattle entered North America from the Schleswig-Holstein ports in the north-west Germany.
Description Of Specific Uses: Animals of this breed are used to improve the majority of dairy breeds in Ukraine.
Efabis genetic features: The most common allele of the breed is BGYE'Q ', quite common are alleles BOY, I2, OJ'K'O', YA'Y '.
Color comments: Colour is black-and-white and red-and-white.
Description of origin: imported; exotic. For the creating of breed Dutch breed cows were used.
Import: To the former Soviet Union in 1976-1977 was imported 43 thousand of doses of semen of four Red-and-White Holstein bulls. In 1978 they brought 11 Holstein Red-and-White bulls, four of them were sent to breeding enterprizes of Ukraine. Later to Ukraine were imported bulls from Switzerland and Germany.
Location within country: It is bred in 12 regions of Ukraine and Crimea.
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive

Description: Proceeds from the name of location, where breed was bred
Additional information: Breed belongs to local, endangered breeds of Ukraine
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals less than other breeds are predisposed to infectious and parasitic diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility of cows for the first insemination is on average 52-60%
Special characteristic of product: Lebedyn cows milk is characterized by high cheese-suitability. Cheese from milk of Lebedyn cows, when compared with cheese from the milk of Simmental cows has higher total concentration of amino acids, especially essential amino acids and has high content of glutamic acid. Raw milk of Lebedyn cows is characterized by the higher content of oleic fatty saturated acid, which creates the soft consistency of cheese. It was proved, that coagulation of milk of Lebedyn cows was higher than Swiss ones. The cost of 1 kg of cheese was also lowest amongst compared breeds, when it is produced from milk of Lebedyn cows.
Other special qualities: The breed is very early-maturing
Efabis genetic features: Lebedyn cattle has typical for all brown breeds range of immunogenetic markers. In the system B allele OTY2 is the most frequent (up to 0.26). Alleles BGKB'O ', BGKE'O', BGKE'G'O'G'', O ' has frequency about 0.1-0.2. Factor Z' is absent amongst other antigenes.
Color comments: Brown colour with shades from grey to dark brown. Hoofs and the tip of the tail is dark coloured. Typical animals of the breed has lighter wool around upper lip and nasal mirror.
Efabis main colour: Grey-brown with darker colouring of front part and sides of body.
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is of dark color.
Horn shape size and comments: Tips of the horns are dark.
Description of origin: Indigenous, created in the result of reproductive crossing of local breeds (mostly Grey Ukrainian breed) with Swiss bulls and further breeding of the best crosses "in itself"
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.

Adaptability to specific environment: Easily bears cold, heat, high humidity.
Specific reproductive characteristic: 98% of cows of this breed calved without assistance.
Other special qualities: Well expressed fattening and good meat traits, clearly marked muscularity, animals are large
Description of origin: imported; exotic. Breed is derived by merging of three branches: Haronn and Kqersi (animals of large type) and Iberian (small type).
Import: Into Ukraine animals of this breed was brought in 1977 into Chernihiv experimental farm research station.
Comments managment conditions: Cattle are well adopted to different methods of maintenance (as to farmyard, so to grazing)
Additional performance parameters: At the intensive feeding bulls at 12 months reach live weight 465 kg, heifers - 376 kg, at 18-month - respectively 674 and 512 kg.

Description: The name comes from the province of Limousin in France, where the breed was bred
Description Of Specific Uses: In Ukraine the animals of Limousine breed are widely used for industrial crossbreeding with dairy and double cattle for latter growth intensity increasing and obtaining of valuable lean beef. Use this breed for reproductive crossing results in new breeds and types of beef cattle.
Additional information: Animals of the American selection, unlike the Hungarian ones, are more typical, some of them are hornless. Good use of pastures, including the slopes of the mountains.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals of this breed are appreciated for undemanding, endurance, good use of pastures.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High fertility. Calving are without complications.
Special characteristic of product: Excellent quality of carcasses and meat
Other special qualities: Limousin breed gives wide range of final products: from milk calves to heavy heifers, as well as various types of young animals. Distinctive feature of breed - obtaining the final product despite of the animal age and the possibility of adaptation to production environment. Animals are not inclined to fattening at a young age and can give plenty of lean meat at relatively small need for high quality food
Efabis genetic features: According to the immunogenetic testing of animals of this breed there are such most common allele BGKQTI'P'B ", BQI'O ', BGKO', GOT2B" in its allele fund. Herd is characterized by medium level consolidation (Ca = 0.092)
Color comments: Colour varies from light golden-red to red-brown, around the eyes and nasal mirror hair is blond in the form of rings.
Horn shape size and comments: Horns are thin, light.
Description of origin: Exotic. Created by improving of local Aquitaine cattle
Import: Imported from Hungary and earlier from the USA. In 1993, into the Main selection center 64 heifers and 4 bulls of Limousin breed were imported from Colorado (USA).
Location within country: Lviv, Odessa, Sumy, Chernihiv region of Ukraine
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of weaning calves is 240-300 kg. Bulls at the age of two and three years - respectively 790 and 855 kg.

Description: The name comes from the Piedmont region, where it was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used in industrial crossing. Progeny from cross of bulls of this breed with dams of Holstein and Black-and-White breeds have an average gain 1,2-1,3 kg, carcass yield - 60-63% and are born without problems.
Special characteristic of product: Calves give plenty of tender, lean meat, with good taste and low content of cholesterol.
Other special qualities: Calves have a thin skin and skeleton, grow well.
Description of origin: imported from Italy. Created in Italy by way of prolonged selection of grey steppe cattle for meat traits.
Import: In 1995-1996 pp. to the Main selection center 6 bull and 12 heifers were brought from Italy.
Comments managment conditions: Animals do not require special feeding, good eat hay and grass.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of heifers at 17-25 months ranged from 380 to 540 kg, bulls at 18-21 months - from 600 to 700 kg.

Description: Comes from the mountain valley Pintsgow in the province of Salzburg.
Adaptability to specific environment: Breed is well adapted to mountain conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Average volume of ejaculate in 4-5-year-old - 4-5 ml, concentration - 1 -1.2 billion / mL, activity - 8-8,4 points, resistance to freezing - 88 - 95%, fertilization at the first insemination - 67-70%.
Other special qualities: Cattle of this breed belongs to double type of production
Efabis genetic features: Specificity of the gene pool of breed is marked by such alleles in the system of blood groups: BA'P'Q ', BGKE'F'G'O'G'', Q, O', BI1PE3'G'I'G'', OA'E3'F 'J'I'Q', GOTY, BGKB'O '
Color comments: Animals are of red colour with a broad white stripe on the back (belt), which runs along the belly from front to back
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is brown or dark
Horn shape size and comments: Horns are large.
Description of origin: Derived by reproductive crossing of Tuksunllertal strain of Tyrolean breed with the local red cattle
Import: Pintsgau cattle began to be imported to Bukovina (Transcarpathian region) in 1860, and the second time - in 1895
Location within country: Carpathian mountain areas, Chernivtsi and Ivano-Frankivsk region

Additional information: There are no more purebred animals of authentic Red Polish in Ukraine, they all are improved with other foreign breeds, primarily Holstein. Therefore, there is the question of renaming the array of animals, which are known as Red Polish into Western type of Ukrainian Red Dairy breed. Ukrainian Red Dairy breed was created at the related to Red Polish breed stock and improved by the same methods as Red Polish.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals are well adapted to conditions of Polissya region of Ukraine
Specific resistance or tolerance: A general resistance has been reported.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive ability is within the physiological norm.
Special characteristic of product: Milk has good technological properties and is used as quality material for cheese production. Meat of terminal calves has high quality.
Other special qualities: Quickly responds by increasing of milk production at improving of feeding and management. Undemanding to feed.
Color comments: It has uniform colour with different shades - yellow-red, cherry-red, reddish-brown, brown.
Description of origin: Created by a complex reproductive crossing of Polish local cattle with Angler and Danish Red breeds
Location within country: Volyn and Ternopol Regions, western Ukraine
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 7 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.

Description: Named after the location where this breed is bred and managed now, as well as for the direction of production.
Additional information: There are 6 lines and more than 30 families in the breed.
Additional information comments: Animals steadily transmit to progeny their productive, biological and exterior-constitutional peculiarities.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Youngsters are characterised by resistance to gastrointestinal and pulmonary diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The animals are marked for good reproductive ability (85 - 90 calves per 100 females), and easy calving (4.5-5 points).
Other special qualities: The breed is moderately early-maturing (17-18 months).
Reference for special qualities: Kravtsiv, R.Y. Beef - valuable nutritional product and the state and perspectives of its production/ R.Y. Kravtsiv, G.M.Koval// Scientific herald of Lviv National Academy of Veterinary Medicine. - Vol.5. - Part 3. - P. 151-155.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: They satisfactorily stand as low, so high temperature, that makes possible to keep them at open yards the whole year.
Color comments: Light shades
Description of origin: It is resulted in complex reproductive crossbreeding of native Simmental, Grey Ukrainian and foreign Charolais, Chianina and Ingush breeds.
Location within country: The area of breed using covers 9 regions of Ukraine (23 breeding farms), except the south.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves in 18 months - 510-530 kg, heifers at 18 months - 400-410 kg, the cost of feed per 1 kg of gain - 6.8 feed units.

Other name: Red Colonist, Red German, Chervona Stepova
Adaptability to specific environment: This breed is exceptionally good adapted to the continental dry hot climate of southern Ukraine.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive ability of Red Steppe cattle is good in normal conditions of feeding and management (in average 90 or more calves from 100 cows).
Other special qualities: Good reaction at improving of management and feeding conditions, high payment of feed by milk, which has a relatively low fat content and solids in milk. Animals are poorly accustomed to industrial technologies.
Efabis genetic features: Out of ten most common B allele blood groups animals of Red Steppe has four main ones - BOYD ', BO, BP', YY '.
Color comments: There are animals with white spots mainly on the udder, chest and head
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is dark gray or marble.
Description of origin: composite of Red East Friesian, Angeln and Ukranian Grey, later also Swiss Brown and East Friesian.
Location within country: The Red Steppe breed natural habitat is the steppe areas of Ukraine.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected form animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: There are 3 main zonal types: Zaporozhskij (high milk production), Crimean (combine high milk yields with high fat content) and Donetskij (high milk production with high live weight).

Description: The name comes from the river Simme in the valley which was derived this breed.
Additional information: Animals of this breed are characterized by strength of the constitution, the ability to consume large quantities of bulky food, good meat quality and high potential milk production.
Additional information comments: There are two types of animals in farms of Ukraine - milk-and-meat type and meat-and-milk type.
Adaptability to specific environment: Cattle is known for good adaptation properties.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility of Simmental cows decreases with increasing of their productivity
Special characteristic of product: Meat is juicy, bright in color
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are of double direction of production.
Efabis genetic features: For the animals of this breed typical is hemoglobin locus polymorphism - the frequency of hemoglobin in average is 0.18.
Color comments: Colour is light-brown. There are red-and-white animals, but all animals have white head and bottom of abdomen.
Description of origin: Simmentals of Ukraine has blood of Ukrainian Grey breed, as it was crossed with it at the very beginning of importation of Simmental into Ukraine.
Import: Firstly Simmental were brought into Unkraine at the beginning of XIX century to Chernigiv region.

Horn shape size and comments: There are two types in the breed: antlered and polled.
Description of origin: It is based on widespread in Ukraine Simmental cattle of double direction of productivity, using the cattle of foreign selection (poll Simmental of American and Austrian selection).
Location within country: The area of spreading includes seven regions of Ukraine
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Additional performance parameters: The rate of fertility is 90-98%

Additional information: There are two innerbreed types: Tauride (high share of zebu blood) and Znamyansk.
Additional information comments: Cow live weight at 3-5 age is 437-532 kg. Young bulls reach live weight 480-530 kg at 16-18 months at daily gains 990-1020 g.
Adaptability to specific environment: Resistant to sudden changes of temperature
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to mastitis, piroplasmosis, tuberculosis, leukosis, brucellosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Calves output per 100 cows is 85-97%. Easy calving and good maternal properties.
Other special qualities: Characterized by good fattening and meat traits.
Reference for special qualities: Guzev I.V., Chyrkova O.P. Breedcreating process in beef-breeding of Ukraine/Animal breeding and genetics. - Interinstitutional thematic scientific collection. - Vol. 44. - 2010. - P. 10-14.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Animals are well adapted to extreme conditions of the southern Ukraine. Animals of this breed have no sharp reaction at sun radiation and high air humidity.
Color comments: uni coloured: typically red or light grey
Description of origin: Resulted in complex reproductive crossing and hybridization of bulls of beef breeds (Aberdeen-Angus, Hereford, Charolais, Santa-Gertrude) and zebu animals at dams of Red Steppe breed
Location within country: Donetsk, Mykolayiv, Odesa, Kherson, Chernigiv region (southern and eastern regions)
Comments managment conditions: The animals have relative simplicity to the conditions of feeding and housing. Breed is characterized by good use of pasture forage.
Additional performance parameters: The content of bones is 17.1%, the cost of feed per 1 kg of gain is 6,7-7,8 kg of oat feed units.

Description: The name comes from the canton Schwitz, where the breed was created
Additional information: The main breed resources are concentrated at the "Mikhaylivka" breeding farm, Sumy oblast (region).
Adaptability to specific environment: Characterized by high biological plasticity, so have good acclimatisation ability.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertilization at the first insemination - 68-72%.
Special characteristic of product: Milk is highly butter-suitable, due to relatively high number of fat balls in 1 ml of milk, their diameter and speed of churning. At production of hard cheese like Dutch from Swiss cows milk, one spent 0.7 kg less of raw milk than at the production of this cheese from milk of Lebedyn cows.
Efabis genetic features: Animals have high frequency (0,22) of ОТУ2 allele in system В blood group. Besides it, their characteristic feature is relatively high frequency BYG′P′Q′Y′G′′ allele.
Color comments: Of silver-brown colour, from silver-gray and light brown to dark brown shades. The most typical is greyish color with a light stripe along the spine. When growing older, the color of animals become lighter.
Description of origin: exotic; imported. This breed was bred in Switzerland by purebred selection.
Import: First time Swiss breed entered Ukraine in 1960-1965, mainly from Austria. During this period were imported 443 heifers and 93 bulls to Kharkiv and Transcarpathian regions. From 1977 till 1984 to Ukraine were imported 13 bulls from USA, Canada and Austrian to Sumy, Chernigiv and Transcarpathian breeding joint ventures. Deeply frozen semen of valuable foreign bulls was widely used as well. In 1993-1994 to “Bezdrik” breeding plant of Sumy region was imported 176 Swiss heifers from Germany.
Location within country: Sumy, Transcarpathian, partly Chernihiv and Kharkiv regions.

Description: The name refers to the country, where this breed was bred and the direction of production.
Additional information: In the breed there were approved 7 lines, 42 families and two types: Lokhvytsky-Zolotonoshskiy and Holovenkivskyy.
Additional information comments: Animals are massive with good developed forms.
Adaptability to specific environment: High acclimatization ability of animals
Specific reproductive characteristic: The cows are characterized by good maternal properties, good reproductive traits (85 - 90 calves per 100 cows). Calving runs easy usually, without complications. The share of heavy calvings is 2.9%. They have no postnatal diseases.
Other special qualities: Young bulls reach live weight 600 kg at 18 months at daily gains 1500 g. Food consumption to get 1 kg of gain constitute 6.0-7.7 feed units.
Reference for special qualities: Guzev I.V., Chyrkova O.P. Breedcreating process in beef-breeding of Ukraine/Animal breeding and genetics. - Interinstitutional thematic scientific collection. - Vol. 44. - 2010. - P. 10-14.
Description of origin: The Ukrainian Beef breed was resulted in complex reproductive crossbreeding of females of local Gray Ukrainian and Simmental breeds with bulls of French Charolais and Italian Kian.
Location within country: Animals are bred in majority of climatic zones of Ukraine (southern-eastern region: Dnipropetrovsk region; central region: Poltava, Chernigiv region; Sumy region).
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Comments managment conditions: Good pasture use.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves at weaning at 6 months is 200 - 220 kg. In the 18 months of age they reach the live weight 565 kg, with average daily gain 1208 g at cost of feed per 1 kg of gain 6.8 HP units.

Other name: Ukrayinska chorno-ryaba molochna, Ukrainian black spotted
Additional information: Today's type of the Black-and-White cattle has been formed up in Ukraine, for number and structure over 40. In the breed there were selected three innerbreed types, which differs in maternal basis and share of Holstein blood: Central-eastern, Western and Polissian. Central-eastern type - 65-70 % of cattle of this breed in number. years. The number of cattle has grown more than eight times over that period of time.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals of the breed do not yield on resistance to the source breeds and to other breeds of the relevant area
Specific reproductive characteristic: Уоung bulls for the ejaculate volume, sperm concentration, activity and fertilizing ability do not yield to the source breeds.
Reference for special qualities: Breeding resources of Ukraine/ Under the scientific edition of M.V.Zubets, V.P.Burkat. - K: "Agrarian science", 1998. - 336 p.
Efabis genetic features: High frequency of A, C, E, F, L, H′ antigens (more than 50 %) and low frequency (less than 10 %) of R1, M, U′, H′′ factors is typical for the animals of new breed. For antigens A, C, X1, U′ this breed is like to Holstein, for factors E, X2, V, L the animals are close to Holland breed. Specific for this breed are such factors as R2 (its frequency is 44% versus 14,2 of Holstein and 12,2 - of Holland breeds), W (less, then Holstein and Holland breeds have). The most specific for this breed are factors U і H′′. For alleles of B-system blood group the biggest share have BOY, BOYD′ і OJ′K′O′, that shows its clear differentiation compare with source breeds.
Description of origin: Resulted in crossing of black-and-white cattle of native selection with Holstein bulls.
Location within country: Raised in all regions of Ukraine and Crimea
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Additional performance parameters: Animals of Western innerbreed type in productivity by 10-15% yield to the animals of Central-eastern type.

Description: The name derives from the colour of animals and type of production
Additional information: It is recommended to breed the animals of the breed in the farms of Sumy, Kharkiv, Chernihiv and Transcarpathian regions and used as breeding material for improving of brown breeds.
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are characterized by good acclimatization ability
Specific resistance or tolerance: Characterized by resistance to diseases
Specific reproductive characteristic: Characterized by good reproductive ability.
Special characteristic of product: Increased milk fat and protein, especially kappa-casein fractions, that provides its high cheese-suitability.
Other special qualities: High suitability for machine milking technology, higher at 1-1.5 lactation average length of commercial use
Efabis main colour: Different shades of brown (from light to dark)
Description of origin: Created by crossing of Lebedyn and Swiss of Western European and North American selection cattle and later breeding of improved cattle of desired type "in itself".
Comments managment conditions: Animals fits to different systems of management

Description: indigenous
Description Of Specific Uses: Used for crossbreeding with beef cattle. Cattle of Grey Ukrainian has qualitative skin, which is used as high-qualitative material.
Additional information: Grey Ukrainian belongs to the local, endangered breeds of Ukraine.
Additional information comments: Grey Ukrainian bull youngsters' raw hides at 12 months' age weighted 33.4±2.25 kg and were treated as heavy hides. Raw hides' output-to-finish weight ratio was 10.21 %. Length of raw hide was 208±4.5 cm.
Efabis cultural role comment: indigenous breed, which is typical for ancient image of Ukraine and is associated with ancient (beginning of the farming) times.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to the steppe conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: The breed is noted for resistance to a number of diseases (epizootiсs).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Characterized by small size of fetus, high rate of fertility. Output of calves per 100 cows for many years is at the level of 90-99%.
Special characteristic of product: The milk has a high butterfat content.
Other special qualities: Animals of this breed are hardy animals with low nutritional requirements and good viability.
Efabis genetic features: The animals of the breed are bearers of rare genes. This breed should exist at least as a potential source of genetic material that can be used in the future. Recent studies of blood and milk discovered unusual genetic combination in the genotype, such as specific alleles of system B blood group, rare hereditary units of milk casein alleles. In erythrocytes one found variant of protein - fosfohlyukomutaza, in plasma - a new protein - posttransferyn 3. Breed is marked by high saturation of antigenic factors because of the large number of multi-allele and a high frequency of factor V. Coefficient of homozygosis on alleles of a blood group B is 0.68, which indicates the stock of genetic variability. Specific for breed are alleles: BGKQYB'FE'GI'O ', BI1QTI', BP1QA'D ', O1'A'D'G', OB'E2'K'P'Y '. Medium content of aberant cells was 37.9-48.1 %, what is higher, than other breeds' animals have.
Color comments: Colour is gray or light gray, often with dark shade at neck, chest, belly. Calves born are of burnt orange colour.
Efabis skin colour: Nasal mirror is of dark colour. Gained dark pigmentation of the skin. Hooves, horns end, tassel tail - of dark color.
Horn shape size and comments: The horns are long, wide apart, lyra-liked, with black ends. At some cases distance between horn tips reached 213 cm. Length of horns sometimes was reported 61-92 cm.
Description of origin: Native breed of Ukraine, one of the oldest breeds in the world.
Location within country: Bred in Donetsk, Kyiv, Sumy, Kherson and Dnipropetrovsk regions.
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5-6 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Additional performance parameters: In the 16 months age bulls achieved weight 420-480 kg, spent 7.8 oat feed units per 1 kg of gain.

Additional information: Cows are characterized by high milk production with high content of fat and other nutrients in milk and satisfactory (as for high productive cattle) reproductive ability.
Adaptability to specific environment: High adaptation and acclimatization properties
Specific resistance or tolerance: For resistance cattle of new breed does not yield to the maternal (Red Steppe) and parental (Angler, Red Danish, Holstein) breeds. In same conditions of feeding and management animals of new breed do not differ significantly from Red Steppe on resistance to leukemia and mastitis.
Efabis genetic features: Frequency of B-allele variant of cappa-casein is 0.240.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Recommended for breeding in extreme hot climate zones of south and east of Ukraine
Color comments: Colour of animals is mainly red, crimson, cherry, some animals of Holstained type - red and red-and-white.
Description of origin: This breed was created in farms of Southern and Eastern Ukraine at dams of Red Steppe breed by means of reproductive crossbreeding with use of Angler, Red Danish and Red-and-White Holstein bulls.
Location within country: South, east and center of Ukraine
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive

Description: The name comes from the direction of production, colour and country, where it is bred
Other name: Ukrayinska chervono-ryaba molochna, Ukrainian Red spotted
Additional information: The breed has a precise, clear and sufficient genealogy structure for pure breeding: three interbreed types, five breeding farm types, 12 breeding farm lines and 46 high productive families. There are three innerbreed types in the breed (Central, Southwestern and Carpathian) and six plant types (Vinnitskij, Kyivskij, Prylukskij, Kharkivskij, Cherkasskij and Bukovinskij).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Bulls for reproductive ability (ejaculate volume, sperm concentration, mobility and fertilizing ability of sperm) do not significantly differ from the Simmental.
Efabis genetic features: Frequency of B-allele variant of cappa-casein (CSN3) in milk is 0.250. Frequency of L-allele of growth hormone gene, which correlates with milk fat is 0.715. On BLG frequency of A-allele was 0.165, B-allele - 0.835.
Description of origin: Created at the result of reproductive crossing of Simmental breed with Red-and-White Holsteins. In some areas additionally used Montbeliard and Ayrshire cattle.
Location within country: The area of breed raising covers 19 regions (oblast) of Ukraine and Crimea.
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of heifers at 12 months - 300-320 kg, at 18 months - 400-450 kg.

Description: The name comes from colour and habitat of animals of this breed.
Additional information: It yields to other breeds in productivity, especially to Black-and-White. That's why array of breed sharply decreased. It is a local endangered breed of Ukraine, which needs saving.
Additional information comments: Hoof horn is dense.
Efabis cultural role comment: It is ancient native breed of Ukraine.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to local conditions of Polissya region (western part of Ukraine).
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals are resistant against leucosis, tubercolosis and brucellosis.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Volume of ejaculate of bulls of 4-5-years old - 4,3-5,0 ml, sperm concentration - 1,02-1,06 billion / mL, activity - 8,1-8,5 points, resistance - 21 -25 th., resistance to freezing - 87-91%, fertilization at the first insemination - 68-72%.
Other special qualities: These animals are reported to have a high feed-conversion efficiency.
Reference for special qualities: Yefimenko, M.Ya. The state of Whiteheaded Ukrainian conservation at modern stage/ M.Ya.Efimenko, M.G.Porhun, M.Y.Chehivskiy, A.V.Boyarska, V.M.Bulka//Interdisciplinary thematic scientific digest "Animal Breeding and Genetics". - Vol.42. - K.: Agrarian Science. - P. 82-87.
Efabis genetic features: Typical for animals of this breed is high proportion of alleles in the B system of blood groups: BGKTE'O ', OTYK'Y', YA ', O, OA'.
Color comments: The animals of the breed are white headed black with white accents on the chest, belly and legs, white head is with dark circles around the eyes.
Description of origin: Composite of Groningen Whiteheaded of different strains and Ukrainian Grey.
Managment conditions performance measure: Performance data were collected from animals kept under stationary conditions, housed for 5.5 months per year and fed on grazing, fodder and concentrates.
Comments managment conditions: Nutritionally undemanding.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of youngsters at age 6 and 12 months for heifers is respectively 140 and 235 kg, for bulls - 160 and 306 kg.

Description: Named after the region where this breed was created. This breed have being created over 20 years (1974-1994). The second beef cattle breed, which was created in Ukraine.
Description Of Specific Uses: Bulls are used in the industrial crossing with dairy breeds, providing increased meat production crosses by 8,1-10,1%.
Additional information: Breed includes 6 lines and 24 families. Animals steadily transfer to progeny biological, exterior-constitutional features and productive traits (high energy growth, slaughter traits and meat quality)
Additional information comments: Intensive use of pastures contributes to high outcome of calves - 81.0 %.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapt to climatic zones of the Western region.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Cattle resistant to infectious diseases (leukemia, brucellosis and tuberculosis).
Specific reproductive characteristic: The cows have good motherly properties.The high reproductive abiliity and ease calvings. Calving runs usually easy, without complications, practically there are no difficult ones.
Special characteristic of product: Excellent meat quality.
Other special qualities: Excellent meat quality. Young bulls of Volynian Beef breed are characterized by a unique ability to gain lean beef with high ratio of protein and fat in the flesh of carcasses 1,9:1 even when they reach the final live weight 590-600 kg at 18 months.
Reference for special qualities: The program of selection of Volynian Beef cattle breed for the period 2003-2012/ Yanko T.S., Zubets M.V., Burkat V.P., Vdovychenko Yu. V., Podoba B.Ye. et al. - K.: Agrarna nauka, 2003. - 79 p.
Efabis environmental role: Enclosure-pasturing grazing system used for keeping of animals of this breed on pasture enhances pasture productivity by 25-30%, prolongates the use of herbage. Animals use crop residues and crops of "green belt".
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: They tolerate cold, heat. They are characterized by efficient use of pasture, coarse and succulent feeds.
Color comments: Red colour from light to dark red with white marks on the head.
Horn shape size and comments: Polled
Description of origin: Native breed, created in Volyn at the Near Carpathian and Polissian conditions by means of reproductive crossbreeding of local Black-and-White and Red Polish breeds (maternal basis) with bulls of Aberdeen - Angus, Hereford, Limousine breeds.
Location within country: Vinnytsia, Volyn, Kyiv, Lviv, Rivne regions of Ukraine (39 farms, including 14 breeding).
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, intensive, semi - intensive
Comments managment conditions: Dams are managed in winter at loose housing system at deep bedding in buildings of light type with free access to farm feeding yards. Terminal young bulls are managed in stalls (bound), using cheap rough, succulent feeds, including concentrates up to 20% in ratio structure; in summer - grazing, except terminal young bulls, without concentrates feeding. Calves till 6-8-months are managed at suckling.
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of calves at weaning at 6 months - 180 - 220 kg. Calves aged 15-18 months reach a live weight of 472-592 kg. The cost of feed per 1 kg of gain - 6,2-8 feed units.

Additional information: 2004, this breed is in critical condition (467 head, 4 bulls).
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to pasturing.
Color comments: uni colour: various shades of grey
Description of origin: composite of Aberdeen-Angus (62,5%), Charolais (25%) and Russian Simmental (12,5%)

Description: Named after district (Adler) in Sochi, city in the south of Russia, where it was created and colour of this poultry.
Additional information: Poultry is not demandable to feed. Good adapted to floor keeping.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens are active, have high energy of growth and are feathered quickly.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to diseases and have no falling out of ovudict at early laying (4.5-5 months).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Can have productive laying at the age of 4.5-5 months.
Color comments: Feather color is so-called "columbian": white feather of body with black feathers at сrest, tail and wings.
Description of origin: Created at the Adler poultry-breeding farm in Russia by crossing of Russian White, New Hempshire, Plimouthrock White, Pervomayska and Yurlov Sonorous with later selection of high-productive hybrids and later pure-breeding of them.
Location within country: Mainly south and southeastern part of Ukraine (6 farms).
Additional performance parameters: Viability of youngsters - 98%, adult - 92-94%; hatching out percent - 80-82%.

Description of origin: This strain was produced in 1976 from crossing the White Dwarf Strain 53 and the Rhode Island Red Strain 02 at the Crimean branch of the Poultry Research Institute, Simferopol, Ukraine.

Description: Name derives from place where it was created and direction of productivity.
Additional information: In the breed there are 5 subpopulations for the feather colour: white, cuckoo, black-striped, black-and-white and blue.
Additional information comments: Scientists of Poultry breeding instritute proved high effeciency of intensive fattening of young roosters for the meat at their floor management (with protein level 20-21%). At 2-months age live weight of roosters is 2 kg at feed consumption for 1 kg of gain 2.3 kg.
Adaptability to specific environment: Better adapted to floor keeping at free mating, but can be managed in cages of different constructions at artificial inseminations.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Higher adaptability to diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: chicken hatching is 88-91%.
Special characteristic of product: Eggs and meat has better consumer demand because of higher taste qualities.
Other special qualities: High embryonal viability of youngsters.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Efabis environmental role: Rather good eat local food.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: have higher adaptability to temperature stresses.
Color comments: Daily chickens are with smart differently coloured down.
Description of origin: Since 2000 at the Institute of poultry-breeding there were done work on creation of breed which at the conditions of yard had good laying, high mass of eggs and better meat quality that other breeds at the base of native and imported chicken breeds.

Additional information: Daily chickens are covered with black down, active.
Additional information comments: Poultry is characterized with calm temperament.
Adaptability to specific environment: Poultry is better adapted to floor keeping.
Color comments: comment: brown eyes, red ear lobes
Description of origin: developed in Institute of poultry breeding, Ukraine at the base of Black Avstralorp, created in Australia.
This strain was produced in 1976 from crossing the White Dwarf Strain 53 and Rhode Island Red Line 02. It has been developed at the Crimean branch of Poultry Research Institute, Simferopol, Ukraine.

Color comments: comment: brown eyes, red ear lobes
Description of origin: This variety was produced from Black Australorp at the Institute of Farm Animal Breeding and Genetics, St. Petersburg, Puskin, Russian Federation.

Color comments: comment: brown eyes or reddish-bay, red ear lobes
Description of origin: This variety was imported in 1983 from Yerevan Agricultural Institute, Yerevan, Armenia.

Description: Name originates from bright feather of poultry and place where this breed was created (Borky, Kharkiv region, former Institute of poultry breeding).
Description Of Specific Uses: Breed is presented in Ukraine by one line AA, which is used as well at crossing as maternal for new 2-lined diautosexed egg cross "Slobidskyi 2a" with double colorsexing of daily youngsters.
Additional information comments: Now breed is presented only by one line A with three main feather colour types: silver-striped feral type - 87% (genetype of roosters SS BB ii CC ee coco blbl), silver feral type - 8% (genetype of roosters SS bb ii CC ee coco blbl), black-striped - 5% (genetype of roosters SS BB ii CC EE coco blbl).
Specific resistance or tolerance: embryonal viability of youngsters is high (hatchability is 93-95%).
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: adapted to keeping as at the floor, so in cages of different types at free mating or artificial insemination.
Color comments: At crossing of hens of "A" line with roosters of paternal line 02 of breed Red Rhode Island one gets colorsexed daily chickens at accuracy of their sexing 98-99% (roosters are silver-striped, hens - golden-striped).
Description of origin: Created at the period 1998-2005 as the result of complex reproductive crossing combined with hybrydologic, immunogenetic and genealogic analysis at wide genetic base of White and Coloured Leghorns of native selection.
Additional performance parameters: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 160 days; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 94-96%; hatching out percent - 88-92%; egg's weight at 52 weeks - 58.0-59.0 g; laying for average layer - 255-265 eggs.

Other special qualities: A quick growth of the egg weight, high viability and fodder conversion, good daptability to being kept in a cage would ensure low cost production.
Description of origin: created with the use of Leghorn White, Rod Island Red and white and Californian Gray. A two line cross.

Additional information: Food costs for 100 chickens 40.5 kg; live weight at 24 weeks - hens - 2.8 kg, roosters - 3.4 kg.
Additional information comments: Live weight at 42 days' age - 2582 g, daily gain - 61.5 g, food conversion - 1.72 kg/kg.
Description of origin: Cornish and Plymouth Rock were used as basis to create this cross.
Location within country: 2 farms in the central region of Ukraine (Kiev region), 2 farms in the southeast regions of Ukraine.
Additional performance parameters: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 23-24 weeks; the peak of egg-production - 90%;survival rate till 62 weeks - 90-92%; live weight at culling (65 weeks) - 3.81 kg; chickens hatching - 85%.

Additional information: At crossing roosters of this breed transmit to descendents white feather colour and good meat body shapes, rapid growth rate and rate of feathering.
Additional information comments: All meat (table) chicken crosses, which are bred in Ukraine, in the form of only paternal flocks are imported yearly from different import firms. The crosses are 4-lined and created at the base of two-lines (A and B) of White Cornish breed and two lines (C and D) of White Plymouth Rock breed.
Description of origin: In England at the base Cornwalian asian fighting chicken.
Additional performance parameters: Chicken hatching - 65-70%.

Description of origin: imported from France into Ukraine.
Additional performance parameters: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 160 days; age of reaching of peak of egg-production intensity - 190 days; age of laying beginning - 130 days; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 93.4%; hatching out percent - 80.3%; egg's weight at 30 weeks - 60.0 g; egg's weight at 75 weeks - 64.0 g; laying for average layer for 75 weeks - 287 eggs.

Additional information: This breed was re-synthesed.
Additional information comments: This breed is not related with Striped Plymouth-Rock.
Adaptability to specific environment: good-adapted to local conditions.
Specific resistance or tolerance: incresed stress-resistance and Marek disease resistance.
Special characteristic of product: Yolk is 29-30% of an egg.
Description of origin: local.
Location within country: Harkiv region (nothern east of Ukraine) - Birky village.

Additional information: average live weight at 35 days' age - 1533 g, at 45 days' age - 1955 g, survival rate fot 24 weeks - 94-96%, food conversion at 35 days' age - 1.76 kg/kg, at 45 days' age - 1.90 kg/kg.
Additional information comments: live weight at 42 days - 2242 g; food conversion - 1.82 kg/kg.
Description of origin: imported from France.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: Laying ability for 64 weeks - 175 eggs, number of incubation eggs from layer - 162; chickens' yield from layer - 138 ones; age of 50%-production intensity reaching - 24-25 weeks.

Additional information: live weight at 42-days' age - 2478 g, food conversion - 1.78 kg/kg.

Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: Laying ability for 65 weeks at initial layer - 182.7 eggs, laying ability for 65 weeks at average layer - 190.8 eggs; number of incubation eggs from layer at initial layer - 171.2; chickens' yield - 80.9%; number of daily chickens at initial layer - 138.5.

Additional information: Poultry is characterized with high mobility.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens are with light-brown down, on the back there is one stripe and two dark-and-brown strips.
Adaptability to specific environment: More adapted to floor keeping.
Special characteristic of product: The form of eggs is prolonged.
Efabis main colour: Hens - at brown-and-grey background there is yellow-and-golden crest (e+), wings' tips and quill feathers - black. Roosters' feather is bright, golden-and-red crest, back and loin; black tail with greenish shade.
Description of origin: imported; exotic

Description: Named after name of farm "Kuchinskiy", where it was created at the jubilee of the farm (50 years since establishing).
Additional information: Daily chickens have brown-greyish or dark straw-coloured down. Chest and stomack is yellow-greyish. Majority of chickens from head alongside back have 1-3 distinct dark strips. There can be found as well continuous brown-and-black or pale yellow with brown-and-red head.
Additional information comments: Poultry has calm temperament.
Adaptability to specific environment: Poultry is undemandable to feed and keeping conditions.
Color comments: Distinct sex dimorphism of roosters is defirintiated at age 50-60 weeks. Adult roosters have red feather colour with shining golden crest and back and black feather at chest and tail. At wings - black with greenish shade strip.
Efabis main colour: Golden calico with grey down and light wing feathers.
Description of origin: Created by specialists of State breeding farm "Kuchinskij" of Moskow region, scientists of Timiryazev Moskow agrarian academy and Institute of general genetics at the base of egg and meat-and-egg poultry (New Hempshire, Avstralorp, Brown Leghorn, Rhode Island, Striped Plimouth Rock, Livenska).
Additional performance parameters: laying intensity till 68 weeks - 210-225 eggs; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 90-92%; hatching out percent - 79-81%; egg's weight at 52 weeks - 59.0-60.5 g.

Description Of Specific Uses: At the base of the cross there were created different high-productive crosses, including autosexed (youngsters can be defined by sex by length of feather).
Additional information: Instinct of hatching is absent.
Additional information comments: Typical technological feature of the breed is organized hatching out of eggs youngsters at incubation.
Adaptability to specific environment: Breed is good adapted to keeping in cage batteries of different type.
Other special qualities: Poultry is very active, mobile.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: 1-day aged youngsters are of yellow colour.
Description of origin: Imported

Additional information: Characterized with calm temperament.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens are covered with silverish down, active.
Adaptability to specific environment: Breed is more adapted to floor keeping.
Efabis main colour: Mainly colombian - at white background of body there is black necklace, tips of flight and quill feathers are black as well.
Description of origin: Created in England, but during many generations scientists of Institute of poultry breeding improved its exterior and economic-useful traits with moderate crossing with other breeds.

Color comments: comment: plumage coloured shades from yellowish brown to dark brown
Description of origin: This breed has been developed in 1976 at the Poultry Research Institute, Borki, Ukraine by crossing three Rhode Island Red and three Pottava Clay Lines.

Other special qualities: Late feathering is prevailing in this line. This line is homozygous for several plumage colour genes (c: recessive white, I: dominant white, Co, S: silver, sex-linked).
Description of origin: Synthetic Line, imported from The Netherlands in 1978 and from Hisex Brown Maternal Line B2

Other special qualities: Late feathering is prevailing in this line. Homozygous for several plumage colour genes (c: recessive white, I: dominant white, Co, S: silver, sex-linked).
Description of origin: synthetic line, imported from The Netherlands in 1978 and from Hisex Brown Maternal Line B8

Other special qualities: Early feathering is prevailing in this line. Several major genes are determining the plumage colour (ey: recessive black, Co, Mh, s+: recessive gold, sex-linked) are present.
Color comments: comment: plumage coloured like in Rhode Island red
Description of origin: synthetic line, imported from The Netherlands in 1978 and from Hisex Brown Maternal Line T5

Other special qualities: Early feathering is prevailing in this line. Several major genes are determining the plumage colour (ey: recessive black, Co, Mh, s+: recessive gold, sex-linked) are present.
Color comments: comment: plumage coloured like in Rhode Island red
Description of origin: synthetic line, imported from The Netherlands in 1978 and from Hisex Brown Maternal Line T8

Color comments: Genetic formula of plumage allows to reach different colours (blue, golden, black striped, red striped), when crossed with coloured chicken.
Description of origin: In simplified view - two most vital lines of locally adapted Plymouth Rock White was crossed in introductive and absorbent way with Cobb-500 of foreign selection. Some part of the posterity was bred "in itself", and some part was again used in absorbent crossing with old roosters of Cobb-500.

Additional information: survival rate of youngsters - 97-98%; food consumption for 20 weeks of rearing - 7.4-7.8 kg, live weight at 20 weeks - 1.6-1.7 kg.
Additional information comments: 1-day chicken of the final hybrid can be sorted for sex for down colour.
Other special qualities: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 145-150 days; the peak of egg-production - 92-94%; live weight at 76-week age - 1.9-2.1 kg.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: Cornish and Plymouth Rock were used as basis to create this cross.
Location within country: eastern part of Ukraine (1 farm), western part of Ukraine (3 farms), southern part of Ukraine (1 farm, Kirovograd region), central part of Ukraine (1 farm, Poltava).

Description: Named after specific appearence - naked neck (gene, which is dominant).
Additional information: Poultry can be scared very easy.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens have different colour of down and distinct neck-naked feature, active, have high energy of growth.
Adaptability to specific environment: Good adapt as to floor keeping, so to cage keeping.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Have high reproductive qualities.
Special characteristic of product: Meat tastes as tyrkey meat.
Other special qualities: Undemandable to feed.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p., http://borona.net/hight-technologies/poultry/poultry_790.html
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Poultry can withstand as frost, so heat.
Color comments: comment: reddish bay eyes, red ear lobes
Efabis main colour: They can be of different colours (black, brown, cuckoo and others).
Description of origin: the breed was imported to Russia from Hungary and Romania, where was widely spread.
Additional performance parameters: Poultry is late-matured, with high viability.

Description of origin: This strain has been produced in 1986 from crossing Red Dwarf Strain 54 and Single Comb Light Brown Leghorn at the Poultry Research Institute, Borki, Ukraine.

Description Of Specific Uses: All meat (table) chicken crosses, which are bred in Ukraine, in the form of only paternal flocks are imported yearly from different import firms. The crosses are 4-lined and created at the base of two-lines (A and B) of White Cornish breed and two lines (C and D) of White Plymouth Rock breed.
Additional information: Poultry is calm.
Additional information comments: Compare with Cornish breed live weight is lesser, but they have higher laying ability and chicken hatchability.
Description of origin: Created in USA (Plymouth state) by crossing of Dominican chicken with Kohinhin, Brahma and other breeds. Imported into Europe in 1879.
Additional performance parameters: Chicken hatching - 80-85%.

Description: local breed, which long time was bred in Poltava and Kharkiv regions. Nowdays breed it is ancient Poltava Clay population, improved by Institute of poultry breeding in Borky.
Description Of Specific Uses: used for breeding work.
Additional information: During selection in Poultry department the special attention is given to egg quality and improving of productive and reproductive traits.
Additional information comments: Crossing of Poltavian Clay hens with White Leghorn roosters gives high-productive hybrid hens with laying 260-265 eggs and high viability.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to keeping both on the floor and in cages.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistent to neoplastic diseases, especially to Marec disease.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The brooding instinct is well developed.
Special characteristic of product: Meat has high tasty qualities. At intensive fattening meat became juicy and tastier because of laying fat between muscle fibres. Poultry carcass has pleasant yellowish colour.
Other special qualities: Poultry is characterized with higher viability, stress-resistence. Poultry has calm temperament.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: comment: yellow eyes, red ear lobes, the tail is black.
Efabis main colour: reddish, like clay. There can be light-clayish and dark-clayish ones.
Description of origin: There are several selected and experimental lines of the Poltava Clay chicken which originated presumably from Romny District, Poltava Region, Ukraine (19th century) and bred at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station, Borki, Ukraine since 1951.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 166-172 days;hen's live weight at 52-week age - 2.2-2.3 kg, roosters' - 3.2-3.4 kg; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 93-95%; hatching out percent - 80-82%; egg's weight at 30 weeks - 51.5-53.0, at 52 weeks - 59.5-60.5 g; laying for average layer - 235-240 eggs.

Description of origin: This strain has been produced in 1976 by crossing White Dwarf Strain 53 and Rhode Island Red Strain 02 at the Crimean branch of the Poultry Research Institute, Simferopol, Ukraine.

Color comments: comment: brown eyes or reddish-bay, red ear lobes
Description of origin: imported in 1983 from Yerevan Agricultural Institute Yerevan, Armenia

Additional information: In Uklraine breed is represented in the form of two lines - line 38 and line 02. Both lines are created in the Poultry Research Institute, Borki, Ukraine in 1974 with complex hybridologic crossing. Line 38 is a dual purpose strain.
Additional information comments: Daily youngsters can be divided by sex - hens are a bit darker, than roosters.
Adaptability to specific environment: can be used as in cages, so at the floor.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Poultry of Line 38 of the breed is resistant to Marec disease.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: imported from Ivaya, Japan and from Sky Hybrid Maternal Line S in 1968.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: Line 02: Hen's live weight - 2.1-2.4 kg, roosters' - 2.9-3.4 kg; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 94-96%; hatching out percent - 78-82%; laying for average layer - 230-240 eggs. Line 38: Hen's live weight - 2.0-2.1 kg, roosters' - 2.8-3.2 kg; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 95-97%; hatching out percent - 77-80%; laying for average layer - 240-245 eggs.

Description Of Specific Uses: Line 68 of the breed is used as maternal line in native 2-lined colorsexed cross "Borky color". At crossing of hens of 68 line with roosters of paternal line 38 of breed Rhode Island Red one get colorsexed hybrid chicken with accuracy of their sexing 98-99% (roosters - silver-and-white, hens - golden-and-red).
Adaptability to specific environment: can be managed as in cages of different constructions, so at the floor at free mating of artificial insemination.
Other special qualities: Poultry has calm temperament.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: Daily chicken has light-yellow down.
Description of origin: In Ukraine breed is represented in the form of one synthetic line - 68, which is created by way of complex reproductive crossing of 3 lines of egg straines (Canadian and Holland selection) with white feather.
Additional performance parameters: Age of reaching of 50% egg-production intensity - 164 days; the percent of preserved poultry till adult - 92-94%; hatching out percent - 78-82%; egg's weight at 52 weeks - 59.0-60.0 g; laying for average layer - 240-250 eggs.

Description: Selection of Ross firm.

Breed/Most common name: Single Comb White Leghorn-Line D4 or 04
Additional information: It is a library stock since 1988.
