Description of origin: imported from Eniya, Japan in 1963 and from Line D

Additional information: Poultry is characterized with high mobility.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens are feathered with light yellow, active.
Adaptability to specific environment: Rather adapted to keeping in cage batteries of different types.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Good adapted to conditions of Ukraine.
Description of origin: Created at the Institute of poultry breeding at the base of Leghorn breed of different genetic origin (Japanese, Dutch, Canadian).
Location within country: Borky farm (Kharkiv region, east of Ukraine).

Additional information: rare breed in Ukraine according to the Institute of Fowl Raising of the UAAS.
Additional information comments: undemandable.
Adaptability to specific environment: good-adapted to different environment.
Specific resistance or tolerance: frost-resistance.
Specific reproductive characteristic: hens have strong instinct of hatching.
Efabis main colour: More often there are black and red with brown chicken, but there can be white ones, but more seldom. There can be, but rarely silver or barred earers.
Description of origin: native
Location within country: There should be done expeditions on chicken number reveiling in Harkiv, Kyjiv, Cherkassy, Transcarpathian regions.
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Comments managment conditions: can be kept in rather cold buildings.

Description of origin: This strain was developed from strains B11, B22, B33 which were imported from the All-Russian Poultry Research and Technological Institute, Serghiyev Posad, Moscow region, Russia in 1974 and supplemented with white coloured progeny from crossing White Dwarf Strain and Rhode Island Red Strain 02. It has been developed at the Crimean branch of the Poultry Research Institute, Simferopol, Ukraine.

Description: Named after Yurlovo village in Russia and possibility of roosters to prolonged crow.
Additional information: rare breed in Ukraine according to the Institute of poultry breeding.
Additional information comments: Daily chickens are covered with black down with light spots at stomach, active.
Adaptability to specific environment: Poultry is adapted to floor keeping
Other special qualities: Poultry is marked with calm temperament.
Efabis main colour: Feather colour mainly black with silver crest
Description of origin: Developed in Russia by folk selection method. But Ukrainian population differs a bit from original one as scientists of Institute of poultry-breeding long time improved its exterior and economic useful traits.
Location within country: Borky farm (south of Ukraine, Kharkiv region).
Additional performance parameters: Breed is late maturing.

Description of origin: created at the base of Pekin breed
Location within country: Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Cherkassy, Kharkiv, Mikolayiv, Zaporizhie, Vinnitsa, Sumy, Odessa, Kyiv oblasts. Totally in all regions 24 farms.
Additional performance parameters: Paternal forms are B1 and B2. B1 ducks have laying ability for 40 weeks 180 eggs; ducklings' hatching - 74%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.5 kg, females - 3.3 kg; ducklings' survival rate - 98%. B2 ducks have laying ability for initial layer at 40 weeks' age - 196 eggs; ducklings' hatching - 78%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.0 kg, females - 2.8 kg; ducklings' survival rate - 99%. Hybrids of these two lines have live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.4 kg, females - 3.2 kg; survival rate of ducklings for 7 weeks - 98.0%; feed efficiency - 2.8 kg; ducklings' hatching rate - 78%.

Description of origin: created at the base of Pekin breed in Hungary.
Location within country: 1 reproductive farm at the south of Ukraine (Mykolaiv region).
Additional performance parameters: Paternal forms have laying ability for initial layer at 40 weeks' age 170-190 eggs; ducklings hatching - 63-68%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.1-3.2 kg, females - 2.7-2.8 kg; ducklings' survival rate for 7 weeks - 97%. Hybrids have live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.1-3.3 kg, females - 2.7-2.9 kg; survival rate of ducklings for 7 weeks - 98.0%.

Description of origin: created at the base of Pekin breed.
Location within country: central part of Ukraine (1 reproductive farm).
Additional performance parameters: Paternal forms are M1 and M2. M1 ducks have laying ability for 40 weeks 160 eggs with egg weight - 95.0 g; ducklings hatching - 60%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.3 kg, females - 3.1 kg. M2 ducks have laying ability for initial layer at 40 weeks' age - 190 eggs with egg weight - 92.0 g; ducklings hatching - 70%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.0 kg, females - 2.7 kg. Hybrids of these two lines have live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.2 kg, females - 3.0 kg; survival rate of ducklings for 7 weeks - 98.0%.

Description: created at the west pre-mountanious area of Pekin.
Additional information: One of the best breeds in growth intensity and meat qualities.
Additional information comments: In Ukraine breed is represented as strains "Medeo","Temp", "Blagovarskiy".
Color comments: Ducklings are yellow.
Location within country: western part of Ukraine (3 farms) and 1 farm at the central part.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.

Description of origin: created at the base of Pekin breed.
Location within country: southeastern part of Ukraine (2 farms) and central part of Ukraine (1 farm).
Additional performance parameters: Paternal forms have laying ability for initial layer at 40 weeks' age 210 eggs; ducklings' hatching - 60-68%; live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.0-3.2 kg, females - 2.6-2.8 kg; ducklings' survival rate for 7 weeks - 99%. Hybrids have live weight at 7 weeks' age for males - 3.2 kg, females - 2.8 kg; survival rate of ducklings for 7 weeks - 98.0%.

Description: Named so due to specific appearance and name of country, where it was bred.
Additional information: live weight of ducklings at 7-week age - 2.7-3.0 kg.
Color comments: Ducks are multi coloured: black plumage with white spotting on neck and upper breast region and, sometimes with white primaries, dark slate beak, lighter in males, black eyes.
Description of origin: Developed from 1948-1954 at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station out of the native Black (or Black-Grey) White-breasted ducks that were paired to a Black White-breasted drake produced by segregating offspring from crossing of the Pekin duck and a Khaki Campbell drake.
Location within country: There should be done expeditions in private husbandries on revealing of availability of the breed in Ternopil (western part of Ukraine), Poltava (central part of Ukraine) and Mykolajiv (southern part) regions.
Additional performance parameters: ducks' laying ability for 21 week of productive life - 100-120 eggs, ducklings' outlet percent - 76-81%.

Description: Named because of country, where it was bred and colour of feather (clayish).
Additional information: Used for producing a new synthetic duck population.
Additional information comments: Live weight of ducklings at 7-week age - 2.6-2.8 kg.
Color comments: Males have light green (light olive colour) of feather and females - dark green.
Description of origin: This breed was developed from 1948-1953 at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station, Borki, Ukraine from segregating of individuals of Ukrainian Grey. later selection was done, considering colour of poultry (clayish). Selection is directed to save typical poultry exterior, increasing of live weight and poultry survival rate, ducks' laying ability, hatching ability.
Location within country: There should be done expeditions on revealing of availability of the breed in Ternopil (western part of Ukraine), Poltava (central part of Ukraine) and Mykolajiv (southern part) regions.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: Ducks' laying ability for 21 week of productive life - 104-110 eggs, ducklings' outlet percent - 75-78%.

Description: Name of the breed derives from the name of country (Ukraine), where it was created and colour of feather.
Additional information: live weight of ducklings at 7-week age - 2.6-2.8 kg.
Color comments: comment: olive coloured in males and dark olive coloured in females, dark brown eyes, the drakes' heads are dark-grey with a white collar on the neck, the back is dark-brown, the breast is red-brown
Description of origin: This breed was developed from 1948-1953 at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station, Borki (Harkiv region), Ukraine by using the native local Grey ducks. Later used introductory crossing with feral drakes.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: ducks' laying ability for 21 week of productive life - 99-100 eggs, ducklings' outlet percent - 69-76%.

Description: The name is given to ducks which were bred at the territory of Ukraine and after their feather colour.
Additional information: Live weight of ducklings at 7-week age - 2.8-3.2 kg.
Color comments: beak is pale pink or orange, grey eyes
Description of origin: This breed was developed from 1948-1953 at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station, Borki from segregating individuals of Ukrainian Grey ducks. Selection is directed to improve poultry exterior, increasing of live weight, ducks' laying ability, hatching ability, ducklings' growing intensity. There are three selected lines of Ukrainian White ducks.
Location within country: There should be done expedition revealing of this breed duck availability in Ternopil region.
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: ducks' laying ability for 21 week of productive life - 105-115 eggs, ducklings' outlet percent - 76-80 %.

Special characteristic of product: The meat has a reduced fat content.
Color comments: comment: pale pink or orange
Description of origin: This line has been developed in 1990 on the base of Ukrainian White, Line 7. A line with reduced fat content (25.9%).

Color comments: comment: pale pink in females and yellow in males
Description of origin: This line has been developed from 1970 onwards by selecting Ukrainian White.

Color comments: comment: pale pink or orange
Description of origin: This line has been developed from 1970 onwards on the base of Ukrainian White ducks crossed once with Pekin drakes of American origin (combination 13 cross) and was used as a maternal line of the Kharkovsky 37 cross.

Description: Named after region of Russia, where it was created (Gorky region).
Additional information: live weight of goslings at 9-week age is 3.5-3.6 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: goslings' hatching percent - 70-80%.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: uni coloured: white, sometimes grey
Description of origin: Created as a result of complex reproductive crossbreeding of local geese of Gorky region (Russia) with Chinese and Solntsegorsky geese.
Location within country: 5 farms in the centre of Ukraine (Kyjiv and Vinnitsa regions) and 1 farm in the south of country (Zaporizhzhya region).

Description Of Specific Uses: The geese are fed to obtain fat liver.
Additional information: Live weight of gooslings at 9-weeks' age - 3.8-4.0 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Gooslings' hatching - 65-70%.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: imported
Location within country: 10 farms (5 in the southern part, 1 - in the western, 3 - in the central, 1 - in the north-eastern part).

Description: named after colour of geese and area where it was bred (Kuban).
Additional information: gooslings' hatching - 75-84%, live weight of gooslings at 9-week age - 3.0-3.5 kg.
Description of origin: Created in poultry department of Kuban agricultural institute with backward crossing of Gorkivsky geese with Chinese ones.
Location within country: 1 farm in the southern region (Mykolaiv region).

Description: Name is given because of poultry colour and size (excellent meat forms and high growth intensity).
Additional information: Maintained as a closed flock with a sex ratio 1: 3-4 and under individual selection and group mating at the reproducer.
Additional information comments: Gooslings' live weight at 9-weeks' age: males' - 4.5-4.8 kg, females' - 3.9-4.3 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Gooslings' hatching is 65-76%.
Other special qualities: Large Grey geese can be fattened for fat liver, which weighed in average 340 g, some geese at special fattening have fat liver 500 g.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: comment: lighter colour of breast and abdomen, orange beak, brown eyes
Description of origin: created by the scientists of Institute of poultry breeding of NAAS at the base of local Roman and Toulouse geese with selection for live weight, performance, vitality and fertility increasing at feed with lowered level of concentrates. Work was started at 1939.
Location within country: 14 farms (3 - in the south, 6 - in the centre, 5 - in the south-east).

Description: Name is given after size and colour of geese.
Additional information: These geese are single of white geese of Ukraine, that have high genetic predisposition to fattening for fat liver, average weight of which at gooslings' fattening since 80-days' age is 340 g, since 135-days' age - 404 g, since 170-days' age - 444 g, adult geese - 500-700 g.
Additional information comments: Live weight of gooslings at 9-week's age - 4.2-4.5 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Gooslings' output - 70-75%.
Special characteristic of product: fat liver
Other special qualities: Geese are characterized with high output of feather-and-down material of lifetime plucking - 120 g per head.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: created by the scientists of Institute of poultry breeding of NAAS by way of double-hybrid crossing of loca Large Grey and Rhein geese with later selection for qualitative traits and autosexity, increased growth energy of gooslings, adult poultry live weight, high fertility of females and fertilizing ability of males. Work was started at 1980.
Location within country: 6 farms (2 - in the south-eastern, 2 - in the southern, 1 - in the central, 1 - in the north-eastern parts of Ukraine).

Additional information: One more direction of this breed use - down use. At 11-week age goose can be plucked and take about 100 g of down. Generally, per year one goose can give a half of kg of down.
Additional information comments: Breed is of heavy type.
Specific reproductive characteristic: gooslings' hatching - 60-65%.
Other special qualities: Can be used for goose liver production.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p. http://ptahosweet.com/?p=legard
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: consume 20% lesser feed, then other breeds.
Color comments: Distinctive breed trait - blue eyes, gooslings have dark spots at yellow down.
Description of origin: created in Denmark at the base of local populations.
Location within country: 3 farms (1 - in the southern part of Ukraine, 1 - in south-eastern, 1 - in western part (Lviv).
Additional performance parameters: live weight of gooslings at 9-week age - 4.5-4.9 kg.

Description: Named after name of poultry breeding plant, where it was created in Russia (Lindovskiy).
Additional information: live weight of goslings at 9-week age - 5.0-5.1 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: goslings hatching percent - 70%.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., Bogatyr V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: Created in Russia by complex reproductive crossing of local geese with poultry of Chinese breed and later - Solntsegorsky breed group with later selection for live weight, laying ability and eggs hatching increasing.
Location within country: 3 farms (1 - in central region, 1 - in east-northern region and 1 - in southern region).

Description of origin: composite of three breeds: (F1: indigenous breed White x China Grey) (male) x Large Grey (female)

Description Of Specific Uses: Males are used for crossing with Large White females to get industrial hybrids, which have not only improved meat forms, but later are suitable for special fattening for fat liver.
Additional information: Geese of the breed at pure breeding are characterised with high fattening abilities, have high reproductive performance and are suitable to be fattened for fat liver.
Additional information comments: Live weight of gooslings at 9-weeks' age - 3.7-4.0 kg. Survival rate of gooslings - 94-95%.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Gooslings' output - 65-70%.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Color comments: comment: orange beak, blue eyes
Description of origin: imported in 1969.

Description: Named after territory, where it was historically located in east-north of Ukraine - Romny.
Additional information: one of the oldest breeds in Ukraine.
Additional information comments: live weight of goslings at 9-week age - up to 4.0 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: gosling hatching percent - 40-50%.
Color comments: multi coloured: grey, white or spotted, most common is grey, plumage on the neck and back is dark grey, belly is white.
Description of origin: Created on the basis of local geese raised in Sumy region (north-eastern part of Ukraine).
Location within country: There should be done expdions on number revealing in Poltava and Sumy regions.

Color comments: comment: sex dimorphism in down and plumage coloured, grey primaries in white females at 8 weeks of age (c and /c and , s /sp, sd/wgg/w) versus self-white plumage in males (c and /c, sp/sp, sd/w, g/w)
Description of origin: developed from 1986-1990 on the base of Rhenish White and Large Grey geese at the Ukrainian Poultry Research Station, Borki, Ukraine

Description Of Specific Uses: The Toulouse geese are used to enhance meat properties of other breeds and production of liver.
Additional information: live weight of goslings at 9-week age - up to 4.5 kg.
Additional information comments: gosling hatching percent - 40-50%.
Specific reproductive characteristic: have better fertility at water availability.
Color comments: uni coloured: dark grey back, light-grey on the breast, white on the belly
Description of origin: Created in France as a result of local geese selection.
Location within country: 1 farm at the south-east of Ukraine (Dnepropetrovsk region).

Description Of Specific Uses: Arabian horses are used to improve other horse breeds to make them drier and more elegant, strengthen tendons and ligaments, improve the quality of movements.
Additional information: Horses of purebred Arabian horse breed that were bred in former USSR, including Ukraine, are divided into four interlinear types: koheylan, sihlavi and hadban and koheylan-sihlavi.
Adaptability to specific environment: They have good adaptation.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Grey Arabian horses are resistant to melanosarkoma.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Horses of this breed possess good fertility and resistance. This traits horses of the breed transmits to the offspring. Some dams born 18-20 foals.
Other special qualities: Arabian horses are characterized with ability to fast restoring of vital energy, unpretentiousness, hardiness, and, at the same time, goodwill to man.
Color comments: Black and dark bay are not characteristic for this breed, horses of this colour are met seldom.
Description of origin: imported; exotic

Description: Breed is named after the name of war hero - Boodjonnij.
Description Of Specific Uses: Horses of this breed successfully used under saddle as well in harness.
Additional information: Budyonny stallion Zanos passed under rider per day 309 km, for 69 hours 45 minutes - 611 km, in 15 days - 1800 km. In draft tests Budyonny horses showed maximum draft force 460 kg.
Adaptability to specific environment: They are hardy and undemanding.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Horses of the breed were always characterized with comparatively high reproductive ability. However, recently there has been some reduction in this trait. Analysis of reproductive ability of modern breeding mares shows that the level of mare pregnancy is 84%, foals output - 73-75%.
Other special qualities: Vice is quite common trait of the animals of this breed.
Color comments: Color of Budyonny horses is mainly red and golden-red of various shades, rarely can be met brown and even more rarely bay.
Description of origin: Indigenous breed of the former USSR. It was created at Budyonnij and First Horse Army horse farms in the Rostov region in 1948 by crossbreeding of Don and Black Sea dams with Blood Saddle breed stallions. The breed was formed in the conditions of cultivated pasture keeping with regular training. At the same time crosses of the desired type that have useful traits of source breeds bred "in itself"; crosses of lightweight structure and delicate constitution crossed back with stallions of massive Don breed; crosses with insufficiently expressed saddle qualities were re-crossed with Blood Saddle horse breed sires.
Location within country: Lugansk and Mikolayiv (eastern part of Ukraine).

Description: This breed was derived in Latvia, so was named after the name of the country.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used in horse sport both in harness and under saddle.
Additional information: There are three types in the breed: basic, heavy and lightweight. Most of the horses of light type for the exterior are close to half-blood saddle horse breeds. This is achieved by crossing with Hanover, Trakenen and Pure-blood stallions.
Additional information comments: Breed is characterized with universal working qualities, longevity, calmness.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High fecundity.
Other special qualities: They are long-living.
Color comments: Color is mostly bay and red with large patches on the head and limbs.
Description of origin: Created in Latvia by a complex reproductive crossbreeding of local mares with European half-blooded harness and carthorse breeds.

Description: Named after name of noted in Ukraine horse-breeding farm in New Olexandrivka vilage in the southern east of Ukraine, where this breed was bred at the final stage.
Description Of Specific Uses: Transporting light loads in collective and private farms.
Additional information: More than 20 representatives of Newolexandrian type were awarded the title of breed champions. It is known that Newolexandrian heavy draft horses are best horse herd improvers in commercial horse-breeding. Use of this breed in all regions of Ukraine gives possibility to obtain from small mares larger and stronger hybrids with good working qualities.
Adaptability to specific environment: Characterised by excellent adaptability to various farm and climatic conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The breed has high reproductive abiliity. Foaling rate in leading breeding farm - 85-95 and more per 100 mares.
Other special qualities: Temper is vigorous, balanced. Breed is early-matured and has great longevity. They are mobile, have high work-effeciency when driving by step, trot with load. They have great carrying capacity.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Undemanding to feed, can digest it well and keep fatness long time.
Efabis main colour: Dominating colours are red and red-roan, bay and bay-roan.
Description of origin: The work with the breed in Ukraine began in 1868, when to Poltava region was imported cart horses from Western European countries, mainly from Belgium. Local mares (partially improved by various other breeds before) were crossed with Belgian Mountain Arden sires, to a lesser extent with Brabants and Persherons. Till 1920 in the breed of Russian Ardens there were formed several breed types. The smallest, but most uniform proportional figure had Dibrovsky Arden. In 1929 Dibrovsky cart horses of Mariupol national farm was transferred to Novooleksandrivka stud, where selection work was being built on cross lines with simultaneous application of inbreeding.
Location within country: Poltava, Sumy, Ternopil, Cherkassy, Chernigov region of Ukraine.
Additional performance parameters: Maximal draft power - 669 kg.

Description: Name was derived from the name of originator and direction of use of horses.
Description Of Specific Uses: This breed is known as universal harness breed and improver of local horses. Pure-blood and crossbred horses of this breed are also used for riding and classical variants of equestrian sport.
Additional information: Among Orlov trotters there are isolated 3 breed and 5 farm types. During 2000-2005 years Orlov trotters of Ukrainian selection there was done several international records of breed in different gender and age categories.
Adaptability to specific environment: Orlov trotters easily adapt to different conditions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Mares are quite prolific. Output of foals - 80-85 from 100 mares.
Other special qualities: Orlov trotters mostly have balanced, friendly and energetic temperament. They are relatively late-maturing and finish growth and development till 6-7-year.
Efabis genetic features: Alleles' frequencies on three blood protein loci: transferrine (Tf), albumine (Al) and esterase (Es). Amongst investigated 998 Orlov trotters were found such allele frequencies: Tf D - 0,099; Tf F - 0,357; Tf H - 0,213; Tf O - 0,035; Tf R - 0,296; Al A - 0,400; Al B - 0,600; Es F - 0,199; Es G - 0,356; Es I - 0,444; Es H - 0,001.
Efabis main colour: Color - gray (50%), more often spotted ("in apples") with dark or white mane and tail, bay (23%), black (20%) and red (5%).
Description of origin: This light harness breed was created in late XVIII-early XIX century in Khrenovsk horse farm by means of reproductive crossbreeding of Arabic horses and some eastern breeds with cart horses from West Germany (Danish, Dutch, Meklenburghian, etc.).
Location within country: 12 farms in central, southern and eastern parts of Ukraine.

Description Of Specific Uses: Used in agricultural work.
Adaptability to specific environment: Horses have good acclimatization ability.
Specific reproductive characteristic: At some breeding farms' conditions from 100 mares they receive 85-95 foals.
Other special qualities: Have balanced energetic temperament, are characterized by endurance, high work effeciency and are early maturing - they finish their growth to three years.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Undemandable to feed, can digest it well and keep fatness.
Color comments: Black colour is rare for breed.
Description of origin: Created by means of complex reproductive crossbreeding of local mare population with Ardennes, Barbonson and other cart horse breeds.

Description: The name comes from the name of Shetland Islands where the breed was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: They are used for children's sports, for circus or as decorative horses.
Additional information: Considering ratio size/power of this breed, it is one of the strongest breeds.
Additional information comments: Temper of this breed is as a rule calm and easy.
Specific resistance or tolerance: They are resistant to diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Reproductive ability is 95-97 foals per 100 mares.
Other special qualities: Shetland pony are characterized by endurance, they are undemanding and tireless.
Color comments: They are mostly uni coloured: black (35.3%), red (23.6%), and others (palamino (17.6%).
Description of origin: imported to "Askania-Nova" reservation

Additional information: extinct since 1919.
Specific resistance or tolerance: were hardy very much.
Special characteristic of product: meat was very delicious.
Efabis environmental role: harmed to agrarian fields very much.
Color comments: The suit of foals was red first years of life. In winter suit became lighter.
Efabis main colour: Horses had dun suit with dark mane and tail, often with dark strip along back and zebra-like limbs.
Description of origin: prehistoric steppe horse
Location within country: last horse died near Askania-Nova, Kherson steppes.

Description: Originates from the name of breeding plant "Tori" in Estonia, where this breed was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: Best crosses are done when cross Torian mares with Trakenian stallions.
Additional information: There are three types in the breed: massive, lightened, basic.
Additional information comments: When tested for maximum carrying capacity, Torian horses had excellent results, compared to such breeds, as Arden and local Estonian. Besides power, Torian horses revealed good ability to trotting and high endurance.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Some mares gave birth during their life to 16—17 foals, and Hilda mare - 23 foals. Sometimes mares give offspring, when they are over 30 years.
Other special qualities: Torian horses are calm, easy lend itself to riding training, not balky.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Endurance and high adaptability is characteristic for the breed.
Efabis main colour: Horse colour is red and brown (up to 60%) with white patches at head and limbs, bay (up to 34%), less common is black and roan.
Description of origin: The Torian breed is a multi-breed mix created as a result of crossbreeding of local Estonian horses with Western breeds. Officially approbated in 1950.
Location within country: 1 breeding plant in western part of Ukraine.

Description: Duroc pigs were named after Duroc name of the stallion of the owner, who bred red hogs in the county Saramoga of New York State.
Description Of Specific Uses: Used for industrial crossing, as well as for the creating of new breeds, types and lines of meat productivity.
Additional information: 2004, Durok account for 0.23% of the total pedigree pig population, with 1,185 animals.
Adaptability to specific environment: Animals have good adaptation to the conditions of different climatic zones.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Sows have lower reproductive qualities, than dams of other breeds, especially for multiple pregnancy, but they have high maternal traits and feed offspring very well.
Special characteristic of product: Chemical and physical parameters of meat and lard show their good quality. They have a lot of intramuscular fat - 3.93%, which provides high-caloric meat and good taste.
Other special qualities: Animals are characterized by high precocity, reach the desired fattening conditions at early age, have exeptionally high growth rate, good meat qualities and effective use of feed. Pigs are characterized by calmness.
Efabis genetic features: Duroc pig breed is characterized by relatively high concentration of alleles Aave (0.570), Bb (0.382) Da (0,130), Fa (0,176). For E blood group system they have five alleles (Eaeg - 0,133; Eedg - 0,384; Eedfh - 0,315; Ebdt -0,004) and 12 genotypes. The value of the effective number of alleles and average number of phenotypes for the sum of D, E, F, G blood group systems for pigs of this breed are respectively 9.7 and 19.6. Heterozygosity for B, E, F and G loci complex - 46%.
Color comments: Suit is red with different shades from dark to light.
Description of origin: imported; exotic. The breed is created in the north-eastern United States by crossing the red pigs, bred in New Jersey with pigs, bred in New York.
Import: The main part of breed array in Ukraine was imported from the United States in 1976. Later - from Czechoslovakia in 1983, 1984, 1985. From England - in 1991.
Location within country: The area of breeding covers three southern regions of Ukraine: Zaporizhzhya, Mykolaiv, Kherson
Comments managment conditions: Suitable for breeding in different economic conditions, including mechanized farms of industrial type.
Additional performance parameters: The cost of feed per 1 kg of growth - 3,6-3,7 feed (oat) units, thickness of speck above the sixth-seven chest vertebra - 19-23 mm. Age of reaching of 100 kg live weight - 184 days. Square of "muscle cells" (rib eye) - 38.17 sq.cm (max. 40.3 sq.cm), length of carcass - 98.9 cm (max-103.6 cm), weight of back legs - 11.92 kg (max-12, 9 kg).

Description Of Specific Uses: Landrases are used in commercial crossbreeding to increase meat qualities of native breeds.
Additional information: In 2004 Landras account for 1.13% of the total pedigree pig population, with 5807 animals.
Adaptability to specific environment: demanding to environment.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Dams are prolific, have high productivity and good maternal quality.
Special characteristic of product: Carcasses have thin layer of speck, good developed sirloin and rear 1/3 of body.
Other special qualities: At the unsatisfied feeding and management conditions dams decreases fertilization, prolificacy, young animals lose precocity and meat qualities.
Description of origin: exotic. Created in Denmark at the end of ХІХ century by reproductive crossing of local long-eared pigs with animals of Large White breed of English selection at the satisfied feed conditions.
Import: Imported from Canada in 1960, later from Sweden, United Kingdom and Russia.
Location within country: Spread in 18 regions of Ukraine of different climatic zones.
Additional performance parameters: When fattening, youngsters reach live weight 100 kg for 170-180 days, expensing 3,4-3,6 feed units for 1 kg of gain. Live weight of nest at 2 months is 170-216 kg.

Description Of Specific Uses: The boars are widely used for commercial crossbreeding with sows of the Large White and other breeds.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to pasture keeping and withstand heat well.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Dams of this breed are characterized by good nursing abilities, give prolific and viable litters.
Other special qualities: Have calm temperament.
Color comments: Bristle is black, black-and-red, thin.
Description of origin: Created in the southwestern part of Great Britain in the second half of XIX century by crossing of local long-eared pigs with Neapolitan and Chinese animals.
Import: To Ukraine pigs of this breed were brought from Germany in 1947.
Location within country: Pigs of this breed are bred in Donetsk, Kiev and Poltava regions. Leading breeding plant is "Red Star" of Konstantinovsky district, Donetsk region.
Comments managment conditions: Not demanding to the management conditions, good adapted to the grazing.
Additional performance parameters: At the state breed trial pigs of Large Black breed had average daily gains 733 g at the cost of feed per 1 kg gain 4.07 feed units, reach 100 kg live weight at 186 days. At a proper feeding Large Black pigs in 10 - 11 months can reach 210-230 kg. Mass of nest in 2 months - 160-175 kg.

Additional information: There are three production types: meat, meat-and-fat and fat. The main type is the meat-and-fat or universal type. In 2004 Great White account for 86.81% of the total pedigree pig population, with 447127 animals.
Efabis genetic features: Immunogenetic profile of Great White pigs is characterized by wide range of gene frequencies of some blood groups alleles (from 0 to 1). The lowest index of gene frequencies is found on Hb, Fa, Bb systems. High level of immunogenetic similarity is fixed between different herds (r=0.69-0.96), that is evidence of intensive exchange of selection material between breeding farms.
Color comments: Bristle is white.
Description of origin: imported from United Kingdom. This pig breed was created in England in the 19th century. As a result of a long lasting breeding work, influence of the climate and feeding, the English Great White pig type was radically changed, and now it is actually a domestic Great white breed which exceeds the European type by many characteristics.
Location within country: Are bred in all regions of Ukraine.
Additional performance parameters: Length of boars' body is 182-190 cm, dams - 166-170.

Description: native authohtonous breed, named after area (Mirgorodshchyna), where this breed was bred.
Description Of Specific Uses: Good results are done, when Mirgorodian boars are crossed with Large White dams, and dams - with boars of pork productivity direction.
Additional information: The breed is considered to be in danger of extinction. In 2004, Mirgorod account for 1.52 % of the total pedigree pig population, with 783 animals. Hardly can be found pure-bred animals. This breed absorbed three pig breeding groups - Krolevetska, Prydniprovska and Podilska.
Additional information comments: DNA-Material of the breed with gene frequency: RYRI+ 99,9%; RYRI++ 0,1% is stored at the Institute of pig-breeding .
Adaptability to specific environment: The animals are completely adapted to the local climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Strong resistance to infections is reported for this breed.
Specific reproductive characteristic: The high milk production, prolificacy and the high percentage of piglets' survival is remarkable.
Special characteristic of product: This breed produces high quality meat. Lard of this breed has high temperature of melting (42 degrees of Celsius), which makes this lard suitable for long storing. Meat of these pigs has high index of pH - 5.1.
Other special qualities: This breed is well adapted to pasture feeding. Additionally the breed is known for a high gaining.
Reference for special qualities: Mykytjuk, D.M. Analysis of genetic resources of animal breeding of Ukraine at the context of their conservation and sustainable use/D.M.Mykytjuk, I.V.Guzev, M.G.Porhun, Y.M.Ryasenko, S.V.Ovcharuk// Animal Breeding and Genetics: Interinstitutional thematic scientific digest. - Vol.40. - K: Agrarian Science, 2006. - P. 129-140.
Efabis genetic features: Degree of homozigocity of main boars is 56.5%, main dams - 64.4. Population is marked for slight genetic differentiation. Mirgorod pigs are marked with degj/dbg, aegj/deg, degj/def alleles of E blood system.
Efabis environmental role: Pigs of this breed can use pastures.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Pigs of Mirgorodian breed are undemanding to environmental conditions.
Color comments: There can be found Black-and-Red animals or animals with white belt behind blades and at front legs.
Efabis main colour: Black-and-White with predominance of black spots.
Description of origin: Composite of boars of Berkshire, Middle White, partially Large White, Large Black and Tamworth breeds and local spotted dams. Were bred under conditions of Ukrainian forest-steppe zone soft climate. In 1882 from United Kingdom imported Berkshire and Medium White, in 1911 - Large Black and Tamworth.
Location within country: Central Ukraine, Poltava Region, Mirgorod District. Except this territory spread in four more regions of west and north-west regions of Ukraine.
Comments managment conditions: High protein feed at early age is demanded.
Additional performance parameters: Higher percent of globulins in colostrum of dams makes higher survival rate of youngsters.

Additional information: It is the first native high-productive meat pig breed, which meet demands of modern consumer.
Additional information comments: There is great demand for pigs of this breed, not only at big, but as well at small farms.
Adaptability to specific environment: Adapted to different climate and food conditions.
Special characteristic of product: Meat is tender with high protein content (20.1%) with low losses during cooking (43.6%) and braising (37.5%). The most valuable by amino acid composition is meat of pigs, slaughtered at 120 kg.
Efabis genetic features: Level of homozygosis of herds for their estimation on 27 antigens of ten genetic systems of blood groups is high and is 61.7% (on line Asbestos - 76.3%, Effect - 71.7%), indicating rather high consolidation.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Description of origin: It was created in the Institute of Pig Breeding of the UAAS during 1966 - 1993 period under methodological supervision of Professor B. V. Bankovsky by means of a complex reproductive crossbreeding. It is a composite of 2 native breeds (Large White, Mirgorod) and 5 foriegn (Landrace, Pietrain, Wessex-Saddleback, Hempshyr and Duroc).
Location within country: The most widely pigs of this breed are used in Poltava, Lugansk, Odessa, Sumy, Khmelnytsky and Chernivtsi regions.
Additional performance parameters: Weight of piglets of the same nest at two-month age - 185-240 kg, rate of preserved offspring till weaning - 90-95%. Young animals when fattening up reaches 100 kg live weight at 172-178 days, the cost of food is 3,2-3,5 feed (oat) units per 1 kg gain, weight of ham - 11.1 - 11.5 kg, pork fat thickness, measured at sixth-seven chest vertebra - 22-24 mm, ribber-eye - 32-35 sq. cm, length of carcass - 96 cm. At increasing of live weight up to 120 and 140 kg, meat yield decreases slowly to the level of 60-57%, but it is 5-6% higher than this index of Large White pigs.

Other name: Red-belt specialized line, Chervono-poyasa specializovana liniya
Description Of Specific Uses: This line of pigs is used as a parent form in interlinear breeding and crossbreeding.
Additional information: Using of this breed boars with dams of different breeds enhances the offspring quantity of piglets for 1 farrow on 0,2-0,55 piglets, reduces time of achieving of slaughtering condition at 15-18 days, lower cost of feed per each kilogram of gain in 0,3-0,5 food units and increases dressing percentage by 2-3%.
Efabis genetic features: Average level of homozygocity of this line herds ranged from 0.60 to 0.55. Boars have a high combinational ability in all variants of mating.
Color comments: multi-coloured: red with a not wide white belt in the shoulder-blade area. When aging colour becomes darker.
Description of origin: Approbated in 1994. It was created under a methodological supervision of academician V. P. Ribalko by means of complex reproductive crossbreeding of pigs of Poltavian meat type and breeds Large White, Landras, Duroc and Hampshire.
Comments managment conditions: Animals are unpretentious to the conditions of feeding and maintenance.
Additional performance parameters: According to the six series of control experiments on fattening, youngsters reached live weight 100 kg in average for 176 days with average daily gain 846 g, 3.59 feed unit costs for 1 kg of gain and output of meat in the carcass 62.1%. Offsprings of Dithyramb 1851 and Diction 1704 reached live weight 100 kg for 172 days at average daily gain 924 g and costs 3.01 food units for 1 kg of gain. Best animal when fattening reached 100 kg live weight for 169 days at average gain 1014 g. Live weight of piglets of one nest in 2 months - 176.7 kg.

Description Of Specific Uses: Hybridization (maternal and paternal forms), which facilitate the output of piglets for one farrow by 0.5-0.6 piglets, their survival rate by 2.4-4.8%, reducing of fattening terms by 7-14 days and decreasing of food cost by 6-10% at improving of slaughtering and meat qualities.
Additional information: There are three plant breed types: central Poltavian, Kharkivian and Askanian, 12 factory lines and 25 families.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to local climatic and feeding conditions
Specific resistance or tolerance: They have high resistance and stress-persistance.
Special characteristic of product: Meat and fat are of high quality and good taste.
Other special qualities: Well adapted to the conditions of industrial technology.
Efabis genetic features: Plant types of breed are consolidated. Level of homozygocity reaches 57,1-63,7%. Especially can be marked at this point boars of Tsukata (70%) and Cyclones (65.9%) line in central Poltavian type. Pigs of Askanian type have heterozygocity for complex B, E, F and G loci 36.3%.
Description of origin: Created on the basis of meat pigs of Poltavian meat type and crosses of different combinations of Kharkiv, Belarus and Askania selection.
Location within country: Breed is bred in 9 regions of Ukraine.
Additional performance parameters: Weight of nest (piglets of one dam) at 2 months age -182 kg, milk production 54-56 kg, age of reaching of live weight 100 kg - 175-180 days, the cost of feed per 1 kg of gain - 3,46-3,93 food units, ham weight - 10.5-11 kg, pork fat thickness over 6-7 chest vertebra - 24-25 mm.

Other name: Ukrayinska Stepova Ryaba, Ukrainian Spotted Steppe
Additional information: The breed was recognized in 1961. In 2004, Ukrainian Spotted Steppe account for 0.08% of the total pedigree pig population, with 390 animals. This breed is in critical condition with only 50 sows and 6 boars in research farm in Kherson region.
Additional information comments: This breed for the development and performance is close to the Ukrainian White Steppe.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to hot climate in southern Ukraine.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Better than pigs of Ukrainian Steppe White adapted to hot dry climate (in summer do not reduce gains)
Special characteristic of product: Animals give tender, tasty, juicy meat with a good ratio of tryptophan and oxyprolin (BKP = 8,6-10,4).
Other special qualities: Breed is early-maturing. Temperament is calm.
Efabis genetic features: A characteristic feature of Ukrainian Steppe Black-and-White breed is low level of polymorphism in the B-system of blood groups, almost complete monomorphism for allele Db and high compared with other breeds of southern Ukraine Fa allele concentration (0,475). For E-system blood groups were found 4 allele (Eaeg - 0,003; Ebdg - 0,338; Eedg - 0,394; Eedth - 0,265) and 8 genotypes. Effective number of alleles and average number of phenotypes for the sum of D, E, F, V genetic systems of blood groups for pigs of this breed is respectively 8.9 and 14.1. Heterozygosity for complex B, E, F and V loci - 45.7%.
Color comments: Spotted with different shades: light, dark, reddish.
Description of origin: Created by Academician L. K. Greben during 1938-1961 period in "Askania-Nova" experimental farm, Kherson region. This breed is composite of Ukrainian White Steppe, Berkshire and Mangalitsa.
Additional performance parameters: When meat fattening reach live weight 100 kg at the age 180-190 days at average gain 680-740 g and feed consumption per 1 kg of gain 3.6-3.9 feed (oat) units. Weight of nest at weaning in the 60-day age - 170-180 kg.

Other name: Ukrayinska Stepova Bila, Ukrainskaya Stepnaya Belaya
Description Of Specific Uses: Breed is commonly used for industrial crossing and breed-linear hybridization.
Additional information: The breed was recognized in 1932. In 2004, Ukrainian White Steppe account for 2.95% of the total pedigree pig population, with 15238 animals.
Additional information comments: Typical for them is good digestibility of food, which is poor for nutrients and undemanding to management conditions.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well (better than Large White) adapted to southern hot dry climate.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Animals have high resistance.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Boars are characterized by high reproductive ability, and dams - multiple pregnancy.
Other special qualities: Temperament is calm and good temper.
Efabis genetic features: Ukrainian Steppe White breed indicated low levels of polymorphism B, D and F blood group systems. For E-system blood groups one revealed five alleles (Eaeg - 0,012; Ebdg -0,291; Eedg - 0,384; Eedth - 0,312; Ebdt - 0,001) and 10 genotypes. The value of the effective number of alleles and the average number of phenotypes for sum B, D, E genetic systems of blood groups for pigs of this breed are respectively 8.2 and 14.8. Heterozygosity for complex B, E loci - 33.4%.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Pigs of Ukrainian Steppe White breed very well withstand severe heat of summer, spring dry winds, severe winters with strong winds and blizzards.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Efabis skin colour: Skin colour is white with pink shade, but there can be dark spots.
Description of origin: Resulted in simple hybridization of local native dams of southern Ukraine with Large White boars of English selection and use of risky method in pig-breeding - close inbreeding of dams with father and brothers.
Comments managment conditions: Good use of southern succulent feed, alfalfa hay.
Additional performance parameters: At control fattening record value of early-maturing - 153 days, of gain - 1078 g, feed costs per 1 kg of gain - 2.44 feed units, dressing percentage - 87%, carcass length - 109 cm, ham weight - 12.7 kg.

Description: Originates from county names Wales, where it was created.
Description Of Specific Uses: The Wales pigs show good results in crossbreeding.
Additional information: Use of Wales breed for industrial crossing and hybridization increases multiple farrowing by 1,9-20%, survival rate of piglets - by 2,2-24,1% and their weight at weaning - by 5-26,3%. Hybrid youngsters by 17,8-18,4 days earlier reaches weight 100 kg at a much lower cost of feed (by 0,61-0,88 feed units).
Specific reproductive characteristic: Dams have good maternal qualities, multiple fetus.
Special characteristic of product: Meat is tender, not intensively colored, with a bit less moisture capacity.
Other special qualities: Good use pastures.
Efabis genetic features: Analysis of genealogical lines innerbreed differentiation for frequency of individual genotypes and the number of homo-and heterozygous animals showed no significant difference. Index of genetic match was 94-99%, indicating rather high genetic similarity of Wales breed animals.
Color comments: Bristle is white and glossy.
Description of origin: Imported from United Kingdom in 1964-1968
Additional performance parameters: Weight of piglets of one nest at two-month age - 168-210 kg. At control fattening youngsters has average daily gain 784 g, reaches live weight 100 kg at the age of 177 days at the cost of food 3,5-3,7 feed units.

Additional information: female eggs laying begins at 35-40 days of maturity.
Specific reproductive characteristic: youngsters' survival rate - 70%.
Color comments: Quails have distinctly expressed sex dimorphism: females have lighter feather at neck, at chest - grey with black, beak of adult males is darker, than females have and over cloaca there is distinctly seen gland of pink colour, females have no gland. Egg shell is ash-grey with spots of different colours.
Location within country: 2 farms in the south of Ukraine (Kherson and Odessa regions) and 1 farm in Kiev region (central part).
Performance data reference: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Additional performance parameters: eggs' fertility of 8-40-weeks' age females is 80-90%.

Additional information: at 5-week age youngsters' live weight is 140-150 g.
Specific reproductive characteristic: egg laying begins at 6-7-weeks' age.
Reference for special qualities: Catalogue of breeding resources of farm poultry of Ukraine/Pabat V.O., Mykytyuk D.M., Frolov V.V., Bilous O.V., Ryabokon Yu.O., Katerynych O.O., Bondarenko Yu.V., Mosyakina T.V., Kovalenko G.T., Gadyuchko O.T., Gryshchenko D.M., V.P., Lyutyy Yu.S. - К.: „Atmosphere”, 2006. – 80 p.
Description of origin: created in USA.
Location within country: 1 farm in central region (Kiev region), 1 farm in the south of country (Kherson city), 1 farm in the east-northern part of Ukraine (Sumy city).

Description: Was created in USA by crossing of New-Zealand White, Chinchilla, Himalaian and Erminian.
Additional information: For 1 year it is possible to get from one rabbit 35-40 small rabbits.
Additional information comments: Can be inseminated at 5 months' age.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to the climatic and farming conditions of various regions.
Specific reproductive characteristic: For one time rabbit can born 8-10 small rabbits.
Other special qualities: The rabbits are characterized by high energy and fodder return.
Color comments: comment: white and red eyes, the ears, nose, legs and tail are black pigmented
Description of origin: imported from USA, California
Management system: back yard or farm yard production, scavenger
Feeding of adults: agro-industrial by-products, concentrate, farm-household by-products, grazing

Color comments: multi coloured: dark-grey, iron-grey and black, the belly and lower part of the tail are covered with a blue tinted white undercoat
Description of origin: result of crossbreeding of local rabbits with the Flander breed and subsequent controlled selection
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of rabbits at weaning - 0.792 kg, the number of rabbits in one kindling - 7.45, at the weaning - 7.00.

Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to the climatic conditions.
Color comments:
multi coloured: white with silvery undercoat
comment: eyes are red, the talons are white
Description of origin: imported from California, USA

Additional information: 2004, Its portion in the Ukraine rabbit population is 7%.
Adaptability to specific environment: The breed is well adapted to the local environment.
Color comments:
multi coloured: silver-blue with dark tints
comment: 4 month old rabbits are black coloured
Description of origin: created in Russia

Additional information: 2004: Their portion in the total rabbit population in Ukraine is 15%.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to the local environment.
Color comments: multi coloured: silver-blue coloured hair with wave-like thin black stripes
Description of origin: imported from Russia
Additional performance parameters: Live weight of rabbits at weaning - 0.815 kg, the number of rabbits at one kindling - 8.15, at the weaning - 8.00.

Additional information: 2004: The Great giant's portion in the rabbit population is 10%.
Adaptability to specific environment: Well adapted to the local environment.
Description of origin: imported
Additional performance parameters: Rabbit's weight at weaning is 0.893 kg, number of rabbits, resulted in one kindling - 9.20, the number of rabbits weaned - 8.90.

Description: The name derives from the locality, where it was created at the south of Ukraine (Kherson region) - Ascania-Nova.
Description Of Specific Uses: This breed is widely used as improvers, because of their steady quality transmitting.
Additional information: In 1993 a Tavrian interbreed type of the Askanian fine fleece breed with four lines was created. New type has higher clips of scoured wool (by 0.8-1.2 kg), output of pure fibre increased up to 52-58%, wool length was increased by 1,0-1,5 сm, quality became better as well.
Additional information comments: Askanian merinos are the biggest merinos in the world.
Adaptability to specific environment: well adapted to natural and economic conditions of the south of Ukraine.
Specific reproductive characteristic: This breed is rather fertile: 125—130 lambs are get from 100 ewes, at the best farms — up to 160 lambs from 100 ewes and even more.
Special characteristic of product: Wool of Askanian sheep is white, blobby and aligned very much. Fleece is of moderate density, with staple structure, long (7.5-9 cm). Wool grease colour - white, cream or pale yellow. Its quality and quantity ensure saving of wool mechanical features during its growth from one clipping to another. wool, wool grease.
Other special qualities: Meat is of very good taste.
Efabis genetic features: Askanian sheep are characterized with the high level of polymorphysm of blood group systems А, В, С, R and protein blood loci Tf, Hb, AEs, Ар. Besides that, polymorphic are systems of ceruloplasmin, albumine, prealbumine, acid phosphatase, potassium level at erythrocytes. Breed is marked with high concentration of antigenes АЬ (65,7%), ВЬ (90,1 %), СЬ (96,8%) and allele TfA (0,480), and marker allele ТР. Value of effective alleles number for polymorphic loci is 1,42—3,73. The degree of realization of possible variability — 29,7—73,2. Average heterozigocity for complex of loci — 48,1%.
Color comments: uni coloured: white
Horn shape size and comments: Rams' horns are big and curled on both sides of the head.
Description of origin: Local merinoses at Askania Nova were improved by American Rambouillet.
Year of origin: 1925-1934 (the first stage). It was improved during 1936-1940 and 1961-1993. The breed was approved in 1993.
Additional performance parameters: Ram's greasy wool clip is 16-19, ewes' – 6,5-8,0 kg. It should be mentioned that № 40 ram of «Chervonyi chaban» farm (southern region of Ukraine, Kherson region) in 1957 established the world record in grease wool clip — 30,6 kg; ram's weight was 135 kg.

Breed/Most common name: Askanian Mutton-fleece (double) with crossbred fleece (Bukovynian, Odessian and Dnipropetrovsk) types including
Description Of Specific Uses: Crossing of fine-fleece ewes with Askanian crossbreds improves early maturing and viability of lambs, washed fleece weight — by 0,58— 0,96 kg, dressing percentage — by 5,3%, carcass blocking — by 0,75 score, taste quality — by 0,5 score, food spends for 1 kg of gain are lowered by 4,6%. Crossing of Tsigai ewes with Askanian crossbreds improves lamb live weight by 4,5 kg, or by 17,8% (29,8 vs 25,3 kg), washed fleece weight — by 0,27 kg, or by 35% (1,04 vs 0,77 kg), daily gain of fattening period — by 34,2%, dressing percentage — by 2,1 of absolute percent (51,4 vs 49,3%). Fine-fleece and Tsigai breeds improving by Askanian rams results in washed wool weight increasing by 0,39—0,75 kg, or by 18,5—40,8%, washed fleece output — by 2,1-15 %, wool length increasing by 2,2—4 сm, or by 24—50%, wool faults reducing, improves its curling ability (sinuosity), elasticity, silkiness, colour and quality of wool grease.
Additional information: There are four specific types in the breed, depending on regions of breeding or specific qualities: dnipropetrovsk, bukovynian, odessa and askanian black-headed types.
Additional information comments: The rams are easily clipped.
Special characteristic of product: High taste qualities of meat.
Description of origin: There were three stages: The first is 1959-1964: trying to find successfull for comination genotypes: Tsigai, Askanian Fine-fleece ewes with rams of English mutton breeds (Lincolns, Suffolks, Oxford Downs). The second is 1965-1975: consolidation of breed. The third: 1976-2000 - creation of flocks, characterization of productive traits.
Location within country: 12 breeding herds (8 breeding reproductive farms and 4 breeding farms) of southern, western and eastern regions.
Additional performance parameters: Typical feature of Askanian crossbreds is long wool at large strong wool clippings, high uniformity of wool, clear sinuosity of elastic and silky wool of minor diameter: rams' — 37,6, ewes' — 33,1 mкm with high quality of wool grease of light shades (ram grease fat and salts ratio is 1:0,69).

Description of origin: Maternal base (Dnipropetrovsk innerbreed type of Askanian mutton-wool breed) was crossed with paternal base - rams of Olibs and Merinolanshaft (meat) breeds.
Performance data reference: I.A.Pomitun, Kharkiv Institute of Animal Breeding (http://animal.kharkov.ua/index.php/zhivotnovodsvo/razrabotki/380-metodi-stvorennya-ovets-m-yasnogo-ta-udoskonalennya-tonkorunnogo-m-yaso-vovnovogo-napryamu-produktivnosti-pridniprovska-m-yasna-poroda-ovets)

Other name: Kavkazska tonkorunna, Kavkazskaya tonkorunnaya, Kavkazskiy merynos
Specific reproductive characteristic: Fertility rate - 130-140%.
Description of origin: At Bilshovyk farm (southern part of the Russian Federation) there were crossings of Newcaucasian Merino dams with rams of American Rambouillet and Askanian Fine-Fleece breeds to create new breed - Caucasian. Later crosses were deeply selected to breed sheeps of desirable type.
Additional performance parameters: Rams' washed wool yield - 7,5-9,0 kg, dams' -2,5-3,3 kg. Washed wool output-50-57%. Dams' wool length-7-8 сm, rams'-8-10 сm.

Additional information: There are three types in the breed: lard, meat-and-lard and meat.
Additional information comments: Good gaining ability in summer, even at poor pastures and with poor water supply.
Adaptability to specific environment: Gissarian sheep perfectly adapt to different environmental conditions, especially deserts and semi-deserts.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Each 100 ewes born 115-130 lambs.
Other special qualities: Sheep are early maturing.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Sheep are endurant. Easily bear even long passages (up to 500 km) from winter pastures to summer highlands. They can cross lands as in daytime, so at night.
Comments managment conditions: Round-year pasture keeping.
Additional performance parameters: Finish weight of fattening gelded rams is up to 190 kg. Lard weight at tail is up to 18-20 kg, gelded rams' - up to З0 kg and even more.

Description Of Specific Uses: Because of high milk production, this breed (rams) are widely used for crossing with dams of Berrichon.
Additional information: This breed absorbed local breeds Camar, Larzaka, Kozi-de-Rodes, Segal.
Additional information comments: At herds are widely used dense yaning, artificial inseminations, rams' testing on progenies.
Specific reproductive characteristic: It is generally possible to get 131 lambs from 100 ewes. Lambs' weaning is done at 4-5 weeks, then sheep are milked.
Special characteristic of product: There are no specific smell from this sheep breed's milk, so cheese has superior taste quality. Pecorino, Bri, Camambert, Roqfort.
Other special qualities: Early-maturing breed.
Color comments: White or yellow-and-white.
Comments managment conditions: 210 days per year sheep are kept at pastures.
Additional performance parameters: When feed lambs with hey and briquetted feed, it is possible to get animals with live weight 30-40 kg till 3 -4-month age.

Additional information comments: Lambs under intensive feeding conditions at 8-months' age reach live weight 45-50 kg.
Specific reproductive characteristic: 140-160 lambs per 100 ewes.
Other special qualities: Sheep are early maturing.
Color comments: Wool is white, but the head and limbs are covered with brown hair.
Additional performance parameters: Wool length reaches 10.5-12.5 cm (rams) and 9-10.5 (ewes). Washed wool output is 50-60%.

Description: imported.
Description Of Specific Uses: Crossing with rams of other mutton breeds to improve meat production.
Additional information: Breed is characterized with easy keeping, high growth speed, endurance,excellent meat qualities and good wool production.
Additional information comments: Animals are of different size, from medium to big.
Adaptability to specific environment: can use poor vegetation.
Specific resistance or tolerance: endurant, good adapted to whole-year pasture keeping, can walk for big distances and be the whole night at open air sheepfold.
Specific reproductive characteristic: polyestrous with high reproductive ability (212-227%).
Special characteristic of product: marble, juicy, tender, fast cooked meat, without specific smell.
Other special qualities: good maternal qualities.
Efabis environmental role: can use poor vegetation of ungraded nature pastures and do a landscape more attractive.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: can be bred at different natural-and-climatic conditions.
Description of origin: exotic: recently (7 years) introduced breed (officially) and continually imported to refresh.
Comments managment conditions: The whole year can be kept in open air, use poor vegetation of natural pastures.

Additional information: Ewes of North-caucasian breed are characterised with goof fattening and dressing qualities.
Adaptability to specific environment: adapted to dry climate conditions.
Description of origin: The breed was resulted in crossing of local fine-fleece dams with Lincoln and Romney-Marsh rams. This crossing resulted in big rams and rather small poll ewes. Crosses were bred pure and selected for two types: А (Romney-Marsh descendents) - finefleeced, with dense, but not too much long (up to 9.5 cm) wool and B-type, which was characterised with less qualitative wool, but which was longer and more technological. Since 1952 improving of breed is done for type B.
Additional performance parameters: Lambs can reach 30-33 kg at 4 months.

Description Of Specific Uses: Rams are widely used at crossing.
Additional information: Breed is early-maturing (2-months' lambs weight is 27 kg, sex maturity begins at 7-8 months)
Additional information comments: Amongst 28 imported lambed ewes 27 ones gave lambs.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Breed is very prolific (2 lambings with two lams each).
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Animals are good adapted to different natural conditions.
Description of origin: exotic.

Additional information: This breed is used at Kharkiv type of Prekos sheep breed creating.
Additional information comments: Compared to Prekos breed, cases of chryptorchidism in the breed are met extremely rarely.
Special characteristic of product: Rams' wool grease is white with blue shade, ewes' — white and light, resistant to flushing and oxidation, that creates excellent qualities of wool.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Polwars have special architectonics of wool, that contribute to these sheep successfull breeding under the conditions of high humidity.
Description of origin: 8 rams and 29 ewes entered Ukraine in1981.

Additional information: There are two farm types in Kharkiv type.
Additional information comments: Early-maturting breed.
Specific reproductive characteristic: High rerpoductive ability, ewes characterizes with polyetherism. Number of twins can reach 30-40%. 20% of ewes can be fertile at "dead season" of year.
Horn shape size and comments: 20% of ram can have horns.
Description of origin: Import of foreign Prekos began in 1910, but in 1980 work on creating of our native breed at the base of Prekos, though with better wool, meat, early-maturig and adaptation qualities, began. It began with import of Australian breeds (Merino, Polwarth, Corridele) to improve wool production of adapted Prekos. When creating Transcarpathian type, rams of Tavrian type of Askanian and Altai Fine-Fleece breeds were used.
Location within country: Western (2 farms), central (1 farm) and eastern (1 farm) parts of Ukraine.

Description: There is a village Reshetilovka in Poltava region near Govtva river, where this breed was created.
Additional information: Wool of the breed is of coarse type, used for felt, cloth, belts.
Additional information comments: Ewes are usually milked after lambs' weaning.
Adaptability to specific environment: Better, then Karakul breed adapted to the conditions of south of Ukraine.
Special characteristic of product: Pelts are of good quality, though yields to Karakul ones. Main product - pelt is obtained from 1-3 days' aged lambs skin.
Color comments: uni coloured: black
Horn shape size and comments: females: 20-25% polled. Rams have flat, spiral-curled horns.
Description of origin: resulted in crossing of Russian long-tailed sheep and Crimean sheep.

Description: Named after the place of the first spreading - Romanovo-Borisoglebian district.
Additional information: There are 8-10% of ewes in the breed, which can give 4-8 lambs per lambing and 44-46% ewes, which give 3 lambs per lambing. One lamb per lambing is found only for 6-8% of ewes.
Additional information comments: Sheep have strong herd instinct.
Adaptability to specific environment: Endurant, not demanding.
Specific resistance or tolerance: Resistant to diseases.
Specific reproductive characteristic: Very high reproductive ability (up to five and rather often). Ewes are polyestrous and can give two lambings a year.
Special characteristic of product: Fur coats of Romanov sheep are considered to be the best in the world, because of their good heat-insulating qualities and they are rather strong.
Other special qualities: Rather fearful.
Efabis genetic features: For Romanov sheep the high gene frequency of ES-1b is characteristic. AL B allele is prevailing in the population of Romanov sheep. The animals have rare allele of prealbumine - PA 0, which has low frequency. Ttransferrin has 5 alleles - Tf A, Tf B, Tf C, Tf D, Tf E. The most frequently transferrine alleles are Tf C and Tf D.
Efabis adaptability to marginal land: Good adapted to any environment, even frost.
Color comments: New-born ones are black, since 2-4-week age it is becoming lighter till 3-5 months. Black hair and white down forms grey (steel) colour with blue shade of adults. As a rule, there are white spots at face and ears.
Description of origin: Created in XVIII с. (first mentioned in 1802) at peasant's farms of by-Volgian districts of Yaroslavian region of Russia by way of selection of the best in fur quality traits local northern short-tailed sheep.
Location within country: central and eastern regions of Ukraine (Kiev, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk regions).
Management system: back yard or farm yard production
Additional performance parameters: Rather early-maturing: lambs at 100-days' age weights 20-22 kg, at 8-9 months - 35-40 kg.

Description: The name derives from name of village Sokilky, where this breed was created

Additional information comments: Dominant gene shyrazi (grey colour) when homogenous causes chronical tympany and lambs death in 3-4 months' age, while they were not used for lambskin producing when 1-3 days old.

uni coloured: grey or occasionally black
comment: grey is lethal when homozygous

Additional information: The American Chinchilla rabbit took the world by storm as the ideal fur rabbit, which so greatly resembled the South American Chinchilla lanigera. The original Chinchillas were rather small at 5 to 7 ½ pounds, and American breeders set out to produce a larger animal that would be better suited for meat and pelts. Through selective breeding for larger size, fine bones, and a good dress-out percentage, a breed standard was issued for the Heavyweight Chinchilla. The Heavyweight Chinchilla was renamed the American Chinchilla.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.
Color comments: salt and pepper coloration similar to the Chinchilla (Chinchilla lanigera) of South America
Description of origin: indigenous to France in 1913; imported in 1917 from France to England; imported in 1919 from England to US; locally adapted
Import: since 1917 from Chinchilla (France); since 1919 from Chinchilla (England)

Additional information: The Belgian Hare rabbit is the breed responsible for the domestic rabbit movement in the United States.

Additional information: During World War I, the “V” for Victory was inspired by the “v” shaped carriage of the ears of the Beveren rabbit.

Description of origin: originated in Belgium in 1898; imported to England in 1905; imported to America in 1915; locally adapted

Additional information: The Blanc de Hotot (White of Hotot) was created by Eugenie Bernhard, chatelaine du Calvados. She kept a large rabbitry of Flemish Giants and Geant Papillion Francais (Checkered Giants) Bernhard’s breeding goal was a rabbit for meat and fur, with a white coat and with black eyes. Sometime around 1902, she crossed the Papillion with White Vienna and White Flemish Giants, but progress toward her goal was slow. She saved only the lightly marked animals that were the product of 500 crosses, and by 1912, was eventually able to produce the rabbit we have today.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.
Color comments: white body color with black rings around the eyes
Description of origin: originated in France
Import: since 1921-1922 from Blanc de Hotot (France); since 1978 from Blanc de Hotot (France); since 2004 from Blanc de Hotot (Germany, Holland, and England)

Additional information: Today, the breed has become extinct in all countries except the US and the United Kingdom.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.

Additional information: The Giant Chinchilla is of American origin, developed in 1921 by Edward H. Stahl of Holmes Park, Missouri. Stahl was one of the first men to own the sensational new breed called Chinchilla, which was created in France in 1913. Stahl knew that it would take the American fur industry by storm but would be hampered by the breed’s small size, Stahl set his sights on breeding a “Giant Chinchilla." He began experimental breeding using a pure Chinchilla buck of large size, and with perfect color, to does of New Zealand Whites and several other large breeds. The offspring from the cross with the White Flemish and the American Blue does had reasonably good coloration with progress toward a larger size, and were used for continued selection. On Christmas morning, 1921, a Giant Chinchilla doe was born that he considered his ideal.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.
Color comments: color resembling real Chinchillas (Chinchilla lanigera), neck fur is lighter than body but lighter color is strictly confined to nape, chest is to be lightly ticked, eyes are any color but pink with brown being the preferred color, jet black lacing on the upper edge of ears
Description of origin: indigenous

Additional information: Though Lilac rabbits are known to have originated in a number of locations at about the same time, the first breeder is said to be H. Onslow, of Cambridge, England in 1913. Miss Mabel Illingworth also crossed her newly developed breed, the Blue Imperial, with the Havana to produce a Lilac. She called her new creation Essex Lavenders. C.H. Spruty of Gouda, Holland created the Gouda or Gowenaar in 1917, using Havanas and Blue Beverens, but these were of a greater size. In 1922, Professor R.C. Punnet of Cambridge University created what he called the Cambridge Blue using Blue Beverens and Havanas. All three of the British strains were eventually merged and the rabbits of the pinkish dove coloration became known as Lilacs.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.
Color comments: pinkish dove gray, eyes are Blue-gray, the eyes glow ruby red in subdued light
Description of origin: originated in England in 1913; imported to American in 1922

Additional information: The Rhinelander was developed by Josef Heintz of Grevenbroch, North Rhine-Westphalia, and was first shown in 1902 in Germany. Josef Heintz had crossed a Japanese Harlequin buck to a common gray-checkered doe. One of the bucks out of the litter, was the first “Rhinelander,” having the desirable orange and black marking on the chin, ears, and butterfly markings – the spots on one side of the rabbit being all orange and on the other side all black. Heintz then mated a Harlequin buck to a Checkered Giant doe, which produced a desirable doe in the resulting litter. Using the buck and doe thus produced, he proceeded to breed – keeping the best does and mating them back to Japanese bucks. He succeeded in producing the Rhinelander, and in 1905 the breed was given a standard in Germany.
Additional information comments: The Livestock Conservancy provided text and photos.
Color comments: white body with black and orange markings, markings are evenly distributed on the body, the spine is marked with a line starting at the nape and ending at the tail, ears are colored with black and orange markings from the tips to the base, the eyes are circled by orange and black markings, eyes are chestnut brown
Description of origin: originated in Germany in 1902; imported to America in 1923; imported to America in 1972;
Import: since 1923 from Rhinelander (Germany) since 1972 from Rhinelander (Germany)
